Reviews.Title: “would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: elainep007
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fine suite next to the Strip but without all the casino noise, this is your place. First class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel never fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: Seyahbiz
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Las Vegas for some 15 years for an annual trade show in April. This is my second stay at this property and have to say it is becoming my favourite home away from home for my yearly Las Vegas stay of 7 days. I must say I hesitated reviewing this hotel as I guess I selfishly wanted to make sure our group can get rooms again next year! It seemed much busier this year and at one stage there was some doubt whether we could get enough rooms for our large group of 25+ people. Prices also seem to be increasing, I guess a sign that the US economy might be recovering. The check-in was quick and easy, and I had a fantastic 1 bedroom apartment. Being on our feet at a trade show all day, it was a relaxing haven when coming back to catch some brief Las Vegas sleep. The only slight downside is food options. As this is not a casino hotel (hooray!) there's limited options for dining, especially breakfast. But this is a small blip on what is a great hotel. And next door is a CVS store for getting cereal, milk etc for breakfast in the room. I would recommend this place for tourists (especially families) wanting all the Las Vegas experience but wanting a relatively peaceful, easy, and somewhat economical (for a good Vegas hotel on the Strip) stay.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at how nice the staff was :)”
Reviews.Author: Cheri O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an enjoyable 3 days in Las Vegas and our stay at the Hilton was perfect. We had a mini suite with refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker...just what we need for coffee in the morning and a glass of white wine while getting ready for a night on the Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family”
Reviews.Author: 3Jenni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort during Spring Break with our kids (11 & 6). It is a great property! The kids loved playing in the pool with other kids from around the states. It was nice to get away from the casino scene. We had a 2 bdrm plus--great bathroom with jetted tub and 4 head shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - Flawless Service”
Reviews.Author: onemantwokids
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at this timeshare. Location is very North on the strip by the Stratosphere and now closed Sahara so you will need a car or taxi to get around. We found car rentals very affordable and parking was free at all the casinos. There is a CVS right next door. As an RCI member, valet parking is $14 per night or you can park free in the self-park lot. We used valet all week, they were fast and really helpful with directions when we were going places. The facility itself is beautiful, secure & very clean. On site restaurant open from 6AM till 12AM or 1 AM daily. Food was reasonable and very good. We had a two bedroom, two bath, full kitchen suite. Very clean and spacious with nice furnishings, even the pull-out couch was comfortable. A newspaper is even delivered to your door each morning. We were offered a timeshare tour but declined and were not bothered or pressured any more. Service here from the Valets, Security, Desk Staff, Housekeeping and everyone we came in contact with was impeccable.... There are two outdoor heated pools and several hot tubs. The pool area is beautiful with many palm trees. The do have lifeguards on duty during pool hours. My ONLY complaint would be that the pools were overcrowded on the weekend. Tons of people come in on Thursday or Friday just for the weekend which makes it really difficult to get a pool chair. The rest of the week was fine, not crowded with your pick of sun or shade chairs. We stayed here with our teens and used it as a base for trips to the Grand Canyon South Rim, Valley of Fire and Hoover Dam. The location was great for us and we would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week at a trade show”
Reviews.Author: scottagross
Reviews.Content: Great service and good rates. No casino (fortunately for me) but a short walk to Circus, Circus if I wanted to spend a few dollars. A Starbucks on the ground floor and a small grocery.

Reviews.Title: “A great "non-casino" hotel”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRed
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling to Vegas and don't want to trudge through a smokey casino to get to your room, this is the hotel for you. I was amazed by how clean and fresh the hotel was from the moment I stepped inside and it carried over to the room. The suites here are large and comfortable with a fridge, microwave, sink, and dishes. I found them to be exceptionally clean and I slept like a rock every night. Even without a strip view I still enjoyed looking out at the mountains and watching the lights of the Stratosphere. The downside is that this is pretty far north on the strip with only construction or older casinos nearby. It was about a 15 minute walk to the Wynn, what I consider the very start of the main action on the strip. I was attending a convention in the convention center and it was about a 25 minute walk to get there. Do-able, but not a very exciting walk. The Hilton doesn't have its own restaurants either so unless you want to eat at McDonalds or Circus Circus you'll have to head elsewhere for a true dinner. However, they do have a well-stocked marketplace with basic food items to make in your little en suite kitchen, such as frozen dinners, popcorn, instant oatmeal. They also sell basic sandwiches and the all important coffee drinks. The other nice thing about the hotel is that you won't find those annoying "resort fees" here. The wireless was free (but pretty slow) and the fitness center was hopping. If you can get a good deal, don't mind walking/cabbing/taking the Deuce, and are sick of having to quarantine your clothes after your stay in Vegas, I'd say check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda F
Reviews.Content: The location is great because you don't get all the noise on the strip. It is not that far of a walk to the main part of the strip, actually very enjoyable. The room was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Bruna P
Reviews.Content: Good points - Close to everything - Good atmosphere Bad points - Dirty (found a half eaten pizza in my drawer) - Rough (teenagers running around the halls throwing food ect) - Left with bites all over my legs (Bed bugs) Food wasnt great ither for the prices!

Reviews.Title: “Your Money better spent... elsewere”
Reviews.Author: Buzzin-ur-ear
Reviews.Content: For 200.00 a night...you can stay at a higher-end Hotel on the Vegas strip, and this is why I say this, self parking is quite a trek, from the hotel, now I can see how that would be beneficial, but they have rooms right in the front, so car/people noise Is un avoidable. Housekeeping will only clean what is dirty. So dose that mean it was cleaned when I arrived? Well hair was in the bathroom sink, along with a clump of hair in the blowdryer, I gave an excuse as of why it was missed, the color, everything else looked clean for the most part. If you don't mind the 1920's decore an the creapy feeling of the Shinning a (redrum) movie, and move -able space kick back and stay a few days. Overall If I had say as of where to stay I would not have picked this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing visit!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry P
Reviews.Content: We just spent 7 days at the Hilton Grand Suites in Las Vegas! Had a 2bd/2bath King Suite. The washer /dryer in the suite was awesome and came in so handy. The hotel was beautiful and well kept. The staff was first class! Great family hotel , with a gorgeous pool....palm trees surrounded it! The gym was very nice as was the spa! The beds were very comfortable, best sleep ever! Room attendants were great. Can't say enough about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: MLENJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in a one bedroom and swapped in as HGVC owners from another resort. We were on the 38th floor which offered a nice view but nothing breathtaking. Our 'room' had a full kitchen with all appliances and a washer/dryer, large bathroom with fancy multi-head shower plus a large jacuzzi, roomy bedroom with a king sized bed, and comfortable living room/dining area. Our apartment was immaculate, and if we needed anything (soap, help with the TV controller etc.), it was immediately and cheerfully given. Whenever we asked for something, the staffer always inquired if there was anything else we needed. Nice touch! Pool area is beautifully set up with plenty of seating and shady or sunny spots. Snack bar had good assortment but not great for a 'nice' meal. The gym was outstanding!! Lots of high quality equipment and very well maintained. It is located a short walk from the Encore, Circus Circus and Riviera, not in the high action area of the Strip. As we are not into gambling or bright lights, that was fine for us. We had a car and with free parking at any hotel on the Strip, going out for dinners and shows was just a short and easy drive. There is a bus stop by the front door should you not have a car and there seemed to always be a taxi at the hotel stand. Only negative was that our room wasn't ready until 5 so we had to cool our heels by the pool. Other than that (a problem we quickly got over), this was an excellent place for us to stay in during our visit to Las Vegas. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lindy1970
Reviews.Content: Had a two bedroom suite which was really a one bedroom room and a studio adjoined. It was very large, perfect condition, full kitchen, laundry facilities bathtub, three televisions. It's on the strip only about 300metres from circus circus. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: cjbeasly
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean, no casino, short distance to everywhere you want to go. If you don't have a car, the bus stops in front.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent exchange”
Reviews.Author: tron38us
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located at the beginning of the nice Las Vegas area, across The Encore and very close to Fashion Mall. Eating facilities are a little on the short side, however there are near convenience stores. Pools, spas and gyms are very good, clean and well kept. Bus stop is next to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Best non casino hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph D
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great ammenities for a Non-Casino hotel, Very comfortable suites at reasonable rates, great rates.

Reviews.Title: “las vegas just to see it”
Reviews.Author: irgo05
Reviews.Content: This property is not in the best location. You really have to hike it to get to the good parts. There is construction and open lots all around it and the views aren't that great altho I enjoyed looking at Stratosphere and the Red Rock Canyon off to the distance. However, I think it may have been the cleanest room I have stayed in. The bathroom was super clean, the room seemed fresh (and not because of the febreze spray which I actually hate... what are you trying to hide?). We were in the unrenovated side and I thought why renovate, it still seemed current. Pool area, somewhat small but very resorty... No real restaurants but nice market downstairs, food not so great but edible. Staff was super accomodating. Four stars for cleanliness and staff... but its in no mans land and no restaurants in real "walking distance". Its a 10 plus dollar cab ride to the heart of the strip. The monorail also drops you in a iffy feeling area and still a trek back. My parents had the suite and it was a very nice living space. I had the king studio and really loved it, felt safe and at home and a bargain at 89.00 a nite. If I went back, I probably wouldnt stay there again, I'm a non-repeat plus the location.

Reviews.Title: “This place is posh!”
Reviews.Author: dodobuck
Reviews.Content: We are not members here but we were treated 1st class! The hotel is nicer than many of the casino hotels on the strip. It does NOT have a casino so if you want that you will have to go up the strip, which is easily accessible by car or on foot. You ARE on the strip between Circus Circus and The Stratosphere, but far enough away from the congestion of the main part of the strip. The have a really nice little deli/store that is well stocked with all sorts of goodies and necessities and not too expensive. And the pools are gorgeous, we didn't swim because it was colder while we were there but our 16th floor room had a perfect view of the pools and they were beautiful. The rooms are big and really nice. Valet parking was reasonable, $13 a day as opposed to self park at $8, I say spend the extra five bucks and save yourself the walk. We had a wonderful stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs a casino”
Reviews.Author: jmgljg
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas so we were unsure of the geography of the strip and a little concerned when others told us it was right down the end of the strip with no casino. We preferred this because after being in hectic smoke filled casinoes day and night it was refreshing to come home to the hilton with its quiet ,clean and tidy surrounds . The staff were very obliging of all our needs from booking shows to transport to where to get the best supplies for our stay. Highly recommend the hilton on the strip for the valuable unwinding timeout from the hustle and bustle of fabulous las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “welcome change from a regular hotel room”
Reviews.Author: tsnye
Reviews.Content: wehad an extended stay in vegas, so after our free hotel/casino days were up, we moved the HGVS. It was great. Had a washer dryer in the one bedroom suite, market and sandwich shop downstairs. Rec room, business center, great pool and jacuzzi area with nice bar. Just a walk up the Riviera or a quick cab to any casino. But unless you want to gamble, there is nothing that you need you can't get there.

Reviews.Title: “For business travel, the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: VIAboytes
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas and I hate walking out to do my work at 8:00AM and hearing Casino noise form the slots, gamblers etc! Well no casino here so this is not an issue!! I love it!!! If you want to bring your family this is the place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and spacious”
Reviews.Author: JCvAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I took my godson on his spring break to visit some national parks and we started in Las Vegas and then moved on to Utah. We stayed 3 nights at this Hilton property. The Hotel is north on the strip being much quieter and less foot traffic. The check-in was very slow. The valet parking was most efficient. The room was lovely with a big well equipped kitchen. My only problem was their selection of energy saving lighting. If you entered a room it would take 4-7 minutes to bring the light level to be able to see safely. It had a nice pool and outside space. It would be great for families, no gambling. Limited services like restaurants. I would return but bring candles….. G from Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allie1948
Reviews.Content: I. Stayed 7 nights. Asked for an upgrade and was given a one bedroom apartment. It was great. King bed, spa tub, delightful sitting area, dining area and full kitchen with all mod cons. Even had clothes washer and dryer. The pool and jacuzzi area is surrounded with beautiful gardens. There are B.B.Q's to use by the pools. The concierge is most helpful and knowledgable. There is a small deli on site and the staff are all friendly and helpful. There is a business centre with Internet although I though this was a bit expensive. $5. For about half hour. The position is great, bus stop at door and not too far from the casino,s and excitement that is Las Vegas.This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Big Deal”
Reviews.Author: GregoryOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: We had a Studio. A Studio is a regular hotel room with a kitchenette. A kitchenette is a small fridge, small sink, microwave, toaster and a coffee maker. Can't do much with it except make coffee and toast (you have to drive to a grocery store just to buy a loaf of bread not worth it). The room had a king size bed, a couple of chairs and a table with a flat screen TV. Small bathroom, nothing special. I am not sure if it was the walls or the neighbors but you could clearly hear them talking, laughing and making noise. (they were from NY- you could hear their accents). I did see into the rooms with at least a one bedroom suite and it looked much nicer. Since it was March we didn't use the pool. The view from the front of the Hilton is of an empty lot, an unfinished hotel and a closed hotel (The Sahara) The view from the back of the Hilton is a RV park.

Reviews.Title: “Not Suite”
Reviews.Author: bradybunch123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel so I could utilize my Hilton points. Usually stayed at the LV Hilton but for whatever reason it was sold and no longer a Hilton property. This place was disappointing. First night we had to listen to some loud neighbors having a party next door. The rooms are "suites" but probably smaller than a Hampton Inn standard room. Pool area closed at 8 p.m.!? and that was for everyone....even if you were dressed and wanted to relax poolside. We had to call twice in 4 days to get our room serviced. Nickel and dimed for everything. Charges for business center, $1 per minute...only drinks allowed in pool area had to be purchased at their bar...50cents for every print from their copier....etc. VERY far from the monorail which forced us to use the "Deuce" bus. Which if you have been to Vegas, walking is faster. Lastly, both of our card keys were disabled three times during our visit which if you travel much, you know what a hassle that is! We go to Vegas each year but this will be my first AND last stay at this location. Good luck with selling time shares!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for families”
Reviews.Author: Lmmcd
Reviews.Content: Although its a little way up the strip, it was the best place for a family. pool was great and you don't have to go past any gambling areas to get to your room. The rooms are spectacular and good value

Reviews.Title: “End of the strip, but wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn70820
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on the Las Vegas Strip is at the north end of The Strip, which is not in the heart of the action. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel and we used the bus the entire trip. Friday night was a little slow, but otherwise we could be where we wanted to go in 10-15 minutes. There is no casino there, which we loved. We were there to see shows and do site-seeing. Our one bedroom suite was spacious and had everything we could have wanted. Although we did not use the pool, others were, it was really nice. We are HGV owners at other locations and were there on a marketing trip, adding on additional days. The weather was perfect --mid 70's. Almost everyone we were in contact with was very helpful. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest place to stay for a "Vegas Get Away"”
Reviews.Author: Marcella2007
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were given the opportunity to stay here for $100 – for 2 nights. Of course we had to sit thru one of those time share presentations but we figured, what the heck? To make a long story short - There is no casino and no restaurant at this location. They had a little (very expensive) market on the bottom floor. It stunk for us because we were away from the kids and wanted to be on the Vegas Scene. We wanted to be able to gamble or go downstairs and eat at a nice restaurant if we wanted. Instead we had to take a cab to any spots where there is “Night Life”. Also, the room they gave us was right by a trash shoot or something so we heard very loud "SWOOSHES" all hours of the day and night. THE PRESENTATION: After we declined to purchase a timeshare from the resort, the Guy (Salesman) was so RUDE – My husband and I couldn't help but laugh because we couldn’t believe how unprofessional he was. That really made us not wants to purchase a thing!! I will say this, even though it wasn’t what we expected the people at desk services were EXTREMELY sweet and helpful. Unfortunately – the Hotel is a Resort type and not enough “Vegas” for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Time-share sales package”
Reviews.Author: hotels4pilots
Reviews.Content: Bought this package through HGV and stayed in a "studio" room. Clean room with standard Hilton ammenities, but small compared to other time-share places I've stayed. The lobby is stunning, but the rooms are obviously remodeled, and the hallways remind me of those in "The Shining". My room had an adjoining room and all the sounds that accompany that door, and I had a beautiful view of the Circus Circus trailer park and ghettos of the north Vegas strip. Instead of staying here again, I would stay at the former Las Vegas Hilton for far less, better ammenities, and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Off the bus and tram route - but nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: roadrun50
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious. Livingroom has a pull out couch. Full kitchen including washer and dryer behind a door in the kitchen area. A store on the first floor sells deli food as well as frozen items and some dairy to prepare in the room. The tub was HUGE. A built in item in the bedroom. Excellent security with safe in room and elevator access limited by key card. The parking garage is a short walk out the back. Self parking is $8 a day with in and out allowed. If not eating in your room, it is a bit of a hike to the rest of the strip. You can walk in the cool of the morning or evening or take a taxi. There is bus service on the opposite side of the street. Some walking involved to reach a safe crossing point. The property is in a construction area. Empty lot behind, next door, across the street. There is a pool outside and spa facilities within the complex. My traveling companion made the inexpensive reservations which included a low pressure 2+ hour presentation to buy into the time-share. We were in Las Vegas to see performances by Cirque du Soleil. Given the difficulty getting around, a stay at one of the venues mid-strip would have been a better option.

Reviews.Title: “This is a really great Hilton Vacation Club property”
Reviews.Author: jonsha
Reviews.Content: When you see the hotel and enter the lobby it doesn't feel or look like the typical vacation club properties. Both towers are tall, the lobby has huge columns and the driveway has taxis at the ready with bellmen ready to help. The rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable. We stayed on a high floor with a great view of the mountains and North Vegas Blvd. There is a nice gym, pool area and a cafe/convenience store on the property. Because there isn't a casino in the hotel, it's a lot quieter and doesn't smell like cigarette smoke--which is a good thing. The only downside is that the location is about a mile away from the other major hotels and restaurants on the strip. However, the Deuce bus--which runs up and down the strip, stops right at the base of the hotel---so this wasn't a big issue for us. Between the convenience store on the lower level of the hotel and the CVS next store, we were able to buy the staples we needed--including snacks, breakfast food and wine. A great place to stay in Vegas with the conveniences of home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo property”
Reviews.Author: jmbg73
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Hilton Grand vacation suites on the LV Strip and we were very pleased with the property. We had a one bedroom suite which had a full kitchen, washer/dryer in unit and a jacuzzi tub for two, please note that the jacuzzi tubs are in tower one only, you need to ask at the check in desk for one if that is what you want. Our unit appeared to be recently updated with new carpet and furniture as everything seemed to be in like new condition. The Hilton is an upscale time share property and the units are nicely furnished and decorated. This is our second stay at this property and was able to get the unit for $109/nt for a 7 night stay, well worth the money. The parking situation has improved with the addition of their parking structure, when we last stayed there about 6 years ago parking was a nightmare. We did not use the pool due to the weather but it appeared to be well kept and a pleasant place to spend the day, if the weather cooperates. Everyone we dealt with at the resort was very friendly and helpful, this as always is a real pleasure. At no time did we get any pressure to do a time share tour. The only downside is the location, it is a good 15 minute walk to the Wynn with only Circus Circus and Riviera in between. During the daytime it is not bad, but at night the the walk just doesn't seem all that safe. There is the bankrupt Fontenbleau construction project across the street from the Hilton and the bankrupt Echelon construction project south of the Hilton, the Sahara recently closed just north of the Hilton, so the immediate area around the resort is a little bit sketchy. We had a rental car so it wasn't that bad but having a nice safe walk to something close would have been nice. The hilton property itself felt very safe and was in excellent condition so that is not a concern if you should go there, just be aware that a car is very helpful. By and large if you are a Las vegas veteran and want a quality place to stay at away from the strip this is an excellent choice. If this is your first trip to Las Vegas you might be disappointed as you are pretty isolated from the main action on the strip unless you drive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a little far from the action...”
Reviews.Author: ReneGarza
Reviews.Content: The studio that we chose was spacious and well conserved. The gym was crowded at morning and I had to wait for a walking machine. The neighborhood near the hotel its a little risky, I would prefer something near strip.

Reviews.Title: “Where is my receipt?”
Reviews.Author: j3ffyang
Reviews.Content: I checked out this morning around 4.15am to catch up my flight from Vegas to LA. When I asked for my receipt, I was told by counter that they were running "auditing" so they couldn't print out my receipt and also promised to send a soft- copy to my email in 30 minutes after "auditing" work is done. I took a flight from Vegas to LA, then transferred to Beijing for more than 20 hours. I still don't receive my receipt after checking my email. Where is it? I never experience this before: paid, but no receipt. Forget? Process? Can't believe this happened. It's terrible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: scottgriffith22
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property on the north end of Las Vegas Blvd (just north of Circus Circus). It is approximately 1.5 miles from where the newer casinos are located. I know this because I walked to my conference at the Sands Venetian several days. What is great about this hotel is that there is no casino attached to it. It is a timeshare, but I was never asked to see a presentation as I was staying there on government business. I upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the 4th floor and it was spectacular. It had a full kitchen and living room area as well as a huge tube in the master bedroom. This would be perfect for a small family with a couple of children as they have a hide a bed in the living room. There is a CVS a block away if you wanted to grab some light grocery purchases as well as there is a small cafe/store in the lower level of the hotel. The Stratosphere is a couple of blocks away as well. If you don't care for gambling then this place is definitely for you as they don't have a casino on property. There are some great views from the upper levels. I can tell you that I never heard any other people making noise as can happen in a lot of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good for non-gamblers”
Reviews.Author: ashc4918
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations in early February. The "hotel " is at the far side of the Strip which does have it's advantages in that it is away from the hustle and bustle of the centre and with it being a non- gambling hotel means that it is noise and smoke free. The cost of a taxi fare from the airport is between $20- $35 dependant on the time of day you arrive.Access to the Strip can be easily gained by the 24 hour bus service that stops outside and it only costs $7 for a 24 hour pass.The down side is that the surrounding area is a bit "seedy" at night and I would not encourage walking around outside late at night. The hotel is split into 2 blocks and is quite modestly decorated by Vegas standards.We were give a 1 bed room , although I believe the suites are more luxurious with washing machines and Jacuzzis etc.The room was light and bright albeit small by American standards. Bed was comfortable and the room had a fridge and satelitte T.V. Down stairs there is a gym and a mini- market which sold over- priced food and drink.The CVS around the corner offered better value for money. The thing that I felt was missing was an indoor bar to relax in the evening.There is a bar by the pool but it was far to cold to go there in the evening.We were encouraged (on the promise of free show tickets ) to attend a time share presentation .No pressure and would only take an hour...after nearly 2 hours we almost resorted to rudeness to leave ! Apart from that the the hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. If you are looking for a quiet hotel to escape from the madness off Vegas then I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time was had by all”
Reviews.Author: phyllion65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with a friend of hers was booked into the hotel and took the elevator up to the suite but as we opened the door, a heavy smell of cigarette smoke greeted us and my wife who suffers from asthma, was not even able to enter the room; we therefore left our luggage in the room and went back down to the Reception Desk, where we explained that we wanted a 'No Smoking' suite but the suite we were given was unsuitable due to the heavy smell of smoke. Shortly after that, we were given a new suite which was excellent and so we settled in and enjoyed a wonderful seven days in 'Sin City'. We found the entire staff with whom we came into contact with, were very friendly, helpful and professional. The suite enjoyed a 2-bedroom unit, nice kitchen, bathroom, 2 flat screen TVs with a Bose radio. Although the hotel is some distance from the 'strip', we enjoyed the walk, walked up on the right hand side and came back down on the left hand side - the entire strip, yes, great exercise - we also enjoyed the recreational and exercise facilities in the hotel. We just loved the location which was quiet and away from the hubub of the Vegas strip. From our room window, we were able to see the mountains in the distance and enjoyed seeing the Stratosphere lit up at night near to the now closed Sahara - good for photography at night.

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: Brenda B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I invited another couple to come along on a 4 day trip celebrating my birthday and our anniversary. This property was quite a distance to most places we visited, so we were glad to have a car. Valet service could have been a bit better, but they were friendly. We had a 2 bedroom unit, and nice kitchen but only used it for mixing drinks, and a few snacks.... the CVS next door has much more thn a typical CVS, so we were able to find snacks, cereal, and cocktail mixers as well as toiletries. We were there mid January and there was a cool spell and high winds....our whole unit had a loud wind whistling sound that woke us on the second day..we were on a high floor(was told to ask for that) and the view was limited , but nice. There is not alot to see now, unfinished, and abandonded projects sadly surrounded this place...It was too cold for the pool, but the husbands enjoyed the gym each morning. The only real improvment I could suggest would be a little more privacy in the bathroom, concerning noise . there was a large gap under the door, and the tile floors echoed any slight noise......elevators were nice and very fast, making our plans flow smoothly and popping in and out easy.....would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and amenities...relaxing retreat from action overload.”
Reviews.Author: KTColleen
Reviews.Content: All staff were very pleasant and helpful from the check in staff to the lifeguards, housekeeping to deli staff. I greatly appreciated that there was no gambling in the resort itself...it was close and accessible to the high energy excitement of the strip but offered peaceful respite. The heated pool and hot tubs were wonderful for recuperating from long days of sightseeing before taking in the evening shows. Tip...take the deuce bus...$7 for 24 hours gets you anywhere on the strip, to Freemont Street and to the North and South Outlet shops. It stops directly in front of the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites on the strip. Combined with the 109 bus (connection at Bonneyville or south bus terminal) it also gets you to and from the airport. The Deuce stops directly in front of the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites on the strip. Another tip...get your Cirque show tickets online and well in advance to get good seats...well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Grasslakers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Was on the north end of the strip, but convenient for work. The hotel rooms were huge, full kitchen, dining area, living room and bedroom. The hotel was clean and renovated. The full kitchen really means full kitchen, not your normal kitchenette. The showers were large and had plenty of hot water and pressure. A small eating cafe downstairs that was always busy. No free breakfast or discount for HHonors. Walking to the strip was a small hike for many, but an easy cab ride to the southern end.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to be close but separate from the craziness”
Reviews.Author: principalman
Reviews.Content: Don't go to this hotel if you like being right in the middle of the craziness of the vegas casino scene (and all the smoking)! However, if you like to gamble a bit but don't want to be immersed in it, this is a GREAT location. If you're a limited gambler, head for the Golden Nugget in old vegas, where they still run $5 blackjack tables and the vibe is a bit less over the top. Watch out for the sales pitch, as this is a time share set-up. Very nice room. The 2-bedroom suite is perfect for two couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SL611
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very reasonable prices for all the luxury you get. Rooms clean and high end. Great pool area. No downside to staying here. Easy walk to the casinos. Staff was wonderful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Low Season Blues”
Reviews.Author: CaptJimU
Reviews.Content: Excellent property. Rooms are nice but a little smaller than other HGV Clubs. No balconies due to the LAS suicide rule is a bummer. Feb stay meant that the pool rest/bar was only open on weekends. This meant sandwiches from the mini-mart during your time at the pool. Both the pool and jacuzzi's were great. Pool temp was perfect. They need to open up a smoking section at the pool where you can still dine and watch the action. Right now the only one is totally blocked off. As always with Hilton, the people make the property. Fun, friendly and eager to assist at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Far from everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Dave_SusanVienna_VA
Reviews.Content: As has been stated by others, this is a time share property. We stayed here because we got a special deal for listening to their presentation. Howeve, cab rides in Las Vegas are very expensive and everywhere we wanted to go was at least a $20 cab ride. The property is fine, but not a place we would choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckywhentraveling
Reviews.Content: This is a time share property. We stayed here because we got 2 free nights and some extras for listening to the presentation. Jeff gave our presentation and he did a good job but he was not too pushy. We had no intintion of buying and did not. That said, the property was very nice. It is not in the heart of the strip. It was about a 15 20 min. walk to the big casinos or a short cab ride. There is no gambling on property but that was ok with us. I liked the porperty but I wish it was closer to everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment - location not!”
Reviews.Author: bigdog_tboo
Reviews.Content: As a family of 6 we stayed here during Easter 2011. The 2 bedroom apartment was very good. A bit tired but clean and well furnished. There is a small shop in the Grand Vacations that sels the basics and also some hot food. There is a shop next door that sells a reasonable range of groceries and other bits and pieces. You can also book tours here. Only real gripe about the hotel was the location. Its up the old end of town near the older casinos. The old casinos are terrible. They still have the original carpet and staff (its not pretty seeing a 65 year old strutting around in a skimpy drinks girl getup). You will need to walk for 15minutes or so to go back up the strip into the main area. We left our booking too late and couldnt get into the other Grand Vacations which is located in the better part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great family option with no casino (yeah!)”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBriggs
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here with our 3 & 5 year old, and found it great for families. We had a 1-bedroom, and it was perfect. The kids slept on the fold out couch, we had the bedroom, and all was peaceful (well, except for the 3 yr old's normal 3am outburst). The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, we had both jacuzzi tub and shower (I assume all 1 bedrooms do, but am not sure about that) and the kitchen was a normal small sized kitchen. Downstairs, there is a small overpriced store (no issues - you pay for convenience) and a rec room with large screen TV. As it was Feb., we did not visit the pool. Parking was $8/day self service, or you can valet for a bit more. In short, if you are looking for a place on the strip and have kids, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “great family friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sammyh76
Reviews.Content: its our second time at this hotel, and the first time with our baby. Staff were great (with the exception of one of the concierge who was rude and gave us incorrect directions - but she stood out as the exception). We were there in December so it was a bit cold for swimming (which didnt stop our water loving baby!). We got upgraded to a 1 bed suite with full kitchen, jacuzzi and washer/dryer - fantastic!! wish we couldve stayed longer. yes, its a bit away from the hustle and bustle of the main part of the strip, but I like that - it feels a lot more relaxing and its easy to get around when you want to be a part of the action - and you dont need to go through a smoke filled casino to get to your room. Vegas is a lot more family friendly that I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location but clean rooms for okay price.”
Reviews.Author: nessren13
Reviews.Content: Not overly impressed. It is basically a timeshare hotel (trying to get you to buy one). Long walk to the main areas of the strip, although the bus system runs frequently and stops in front. The pool area was the nicest feature but it was too cold out to use it during our stay. Staff was friendly but nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel In An Old, Tired Area Of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: s&eBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed Feb 5-9. Tower 2 29th floor, 1 bedroom suite with Jacuzzi and full kitchen. We had an awesome view of the mountains and the Stratosphere. King size bed was very comfortable. There is a safe in the room.The hotel has concierge services which we used for dinner reservations. They will also help with tours or show tickets. We were approached re: the time share presentation, but there was no pressure when we politely declined. I guess how much pressure you experience depends on the person who is pushing the presentation. All the staff we encountered at the hotel were helpful, friendly and appeared genuinely interested in our well being.The MarketPlace on the first floor has some groceries,beer, wine, sandwiches, pizza and desert for purchase. Prices were 3.00 - 8.00 for breakfast items, 8.50 - 10.00 for sandwiches and 14.50 - 17.50 for pizza. We did not eat any of the items, so we cannot comment on the quality, but what we saw looked very good, with substantial portions. We bought breakfast items, snacks and liquor from the CVS one block down, which has slightly lower prices. The full kitchen has pots, pans and utensils for cooking. A coffemaker and toaster. Plates, silverware and glassware. There was even a wine opener! We did not experience any noise issues You can walk to the Stratosphere in 10 minutes.(it looks closer than it is). The area is kind of seedy, so be "big city observant" of your surroundings. We would not recommend walking around there late at night. Walking down the strip toward Circus Circus is a much nicer walk. If you don't want to walk, the valets will will hail one of the cabs which are waiting at the hotel. Interesting fact: you cannot hail a cab off the street in Vegas. You have to go to a casino or hotel taxi stand where a valet will hail one for you. A cab ride from the Hilton to the end of the strip will cost around 20.00 without tip. The Deuce Bus will cost 7.00 per person for a 24 hour pass. The bus picks you up right outside the hotel, but be aware, it drops you off on the opposite side of the street, and there is no traffic light or crosswalk. It is a harrowing experience crossing the road. It is also jaywalking, which can get you a ticket, so always use the crosswalks and cross the street only when the walk sign is lit. The only reason we cannot give this facility 5 stars is due to a housekeeping issue. We had one day of housekeeping service during our stay, This was suppose to happen on day 3. We left used towels on the floor,as directed, for pick up and left for the day. When we returned the only evidence housekeeping had been there was the water in the flowers had been changed. We spoke with the front desk, who said they would speak with housekeeping. We had expected housekeeping would come back to pick up the used towels and replace them with new ones, but that did not happen. The same towels were still on the floor when we checked out on Friday. Other than a major glitch with the shuttle service who did not show up for a scheduled and prepaid transport to the airport, we had a wonderful Vegas vacation and would highly recommend the Hilton Grand Vacations On The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Al L
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on night and the stay was both disappointing and irritating. Parking costs $8 for selfpark when other hotels with better locations have free parking and more amenities. Internet is agonizingly slow. This is simply unacceptable in this day and age. Who cares if it is complimentary when it isn't practical to use? Shower head is ridiculously inefficient with poor coverage. As a hilton gold member, they give me two free bottles of water. Like really? other hotels have two bottles of water for free... I moved to the Doubletree hilton by the Las Vegas airport and can write this review with decent internet speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rah9307
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a 1 bedroom for a nominal fee and it was very nice. The staff was friendly and found out it was my birthday, so the front desk gave me a coupon for a slice of cake from their Marketplace. I chose a tall 8 layer chocolate slice (enough for 4) and the clerk then gave me a free bottle of milk too! Bellman friendly too. Refreshing change for Vegas. No noise in the hall all night and doors banging from drunks. It was peaceful and spacious. Duece bus at front door and you are in the center of the strip in a few stops.. 2 blocks to the Peppermill Restaurant for a huge breakfast and we brought the leftovers back to the frig and microwaved before our flight out the next day. CVS next door for wine and snacks. . FREE WIFI too in the room! Stay here if you are done partying all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments, no casino walking distance to main strip casinos”
Reviews.Author: gmcc127
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 26th floor (not sure if this was an upgrade for Gold HHonors) large bedroom with jacuzzi tub. No casino which made everything a lot queter. Also had full living, cooking dining area with modern appliances inc washing machine and drier. Very good value. Close to stratosphere and 15 min walk to Wynn's. Recommend it for a more leisurely stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Just like being at home No Casino = No Smokey Lobby”
Reviews.Author: LindySez
Reviews.Content: I know, there is no casino on property. But to me that's a bit of a pro because it also means there is no smoke in the lobby. And I really don't need to gamble 24/7. It's a great property set at the edge of the strip with nice suites, it's just like staying at a condo, well, it IS staying at a condo. While I wish there had been a restaurant and bar there, but I'm not sure I would have eaten much more than breakfast there anyway. And if you get hungry late at night, the Marketplace has a little grocery store, deli and pizza place that are open until 1:00 a.m. and you have a full kitchen in your room, with stove, oven, micro, refrigerator...so heat up some of those pizza rolls! The rooms are large and well appointed. King sized beds, tvs in both the living and sleeping rooms, large showers, jacuzzi tub...and all for $149 per night? I'll take a taxi to go into the heart of darkness, also known as "the strip". You can walk to a few of the "older" casinos and relive an era gone by...Vegas style. The staff was super attentive, and we had only a short wait to get a cab...close to the airport (but not so close that you can hear the planes) and the convention center...since sometimes people come to Las Vegas to actually work in Las Vegas. LindySez: I'd come back. And I heard a rumor that they were putting up a new building that would have both a restaurant and bar (not sure bout the Casino)... OH and FREE Wi-Fi!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel like a Condo”
Reviews.Author: Shirley E
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel for families. Not so much for those 20-30 something's that are in Vegas to party. The suite was great. I especially loved the jacuzzi next to the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: benoir1
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day guys SuperBowl weekend here and loved this place. We had the two room suite which was perfect for us. It was a treat to have full fridge and stove in our room. CVS right next door to load up on booze and beer. Great staff, good gym and clean. Everyone complains about location but not an issue for us as getting a cab was simple and effortless. Highly recommend this hotel for a Vegas getaway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, loved hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: We got invitd to stay here as part of their promo for trying to sell timeshares. We are huge Hilton stayers so we drove out to Vegas and paid barely nothing for our rooms only having to listen to an hour presentation. In any case, the hotel was great. On the strip right next to Circus Circus so you will have to take a taxi to any of the main hotels. There isn't a casino in it and because of that you don't get any of the smokey smell. Our room was clean, comfortable (non of them have views) but absolutely peaceful. We had a full kitchen, large bath tub, seperate shower and 2 large flat screen tv's (one in living room and one in bedroom). We could not complain for a practically free stay and they gave us a $50 spa voucher (the spa at the hotel is one of the best i've ever been to). Only negative is that because they are at the end of the strip it did take forever to get a taxi (but it could've been b/c it was super bowl weekend).

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: keystonekop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here by invitation and the rate we paid for 4 days 3 nights was so low it was nearly free. We were met quickly by the valet, check-in was quick and easy, and the bellhop (Robert) efficiently moved our bags etc. to our suite. The suite was a little bit of a disappointment only because we had stayed the previous night at the Marriott Grand Resort on Harmon between the MGM and Planet Hollywood in a similar suite that was just a little nicer. We had no issues with the suite or any of the hotel amenities or staff. Paying $13/day for valet parking ($8/day for self park) seemed like a frivolous charge (free at Marriott which is closer to the action) but considering our suite rate it was still a great bargain. We had friends staying at the same time, they complained that they had no water pressure and the hot water wasn't hot. Our family staying there had the same complaint. The master bathroom in the suite seemed like it was a design after-thought and the shower an after-after-thought. Getting out of th eshower without two bathmats results in a very wet tile floor. The lights in the bathroom are dim and there are multiple light switches instead of the typical one or two. The light in the shower was very close to my head (I'm 6'3" tall) and I bumped it several times while showering. Something about electrical devices and water makes me nervous. Regardless of building codes I don't trust the light in the shower. The purpose of the trip was for a family member to 'upgrade' their 'vacation property deed'. We sat through the sales pitch with them and they did upgrade. Our friuends staying there own a Marriott property deed and suggested we do a little research before buying a property. Their advice was spot on and I did a little on-line searching and found a 3BR penthouse suite in the same building as their's for less than they paid for a 1BR suite. That made me glad that I resisted the sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: awomansopinion
Reviews.Content: I would in no way consider this place seedy!! It is away from the action but it seems alot of people like that as it was extremely busy the whole week we were there. The Marketplace was a little expensive but the food was really good. The pool area was large and lovely with a very nice bar that served food. After staying in several hotels during our 3 week stay we loved the conveniences of this Hilton. I would, however, have liked a small casino at least since otherwise you had to leave the property to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Nice set up, better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanEater
Reviews.Content: Had a two day stay here and was pleasantly surprised at the room amenities. Is a bit of a distance to the rest of the strip however the bus was easy to get to. Getting back actually works better if you get off on the stop after the HGV. No restaurant! A bit of a surprise for me. People friendly and mostly helpful. Work out equipment was good, pool was fun. Beds were uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “You are just a number here.. book a studio get a poor hotel room”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: I personally will not be back to this property, this trip to Vegas I have been looking for a Hilton Family hotel to replace the no longer Las Vegas Hilton. I’m a Hilton Diamond and I’m aware that the Hilton Grand Vacation properties have limited Diamond benefits. However as a loyal Hilton guest I do expect to be treated with some respect. Check in was slow and the agent did nothing to recognize my status, did not pay attention to my room type preferences in my profile. Asking if I wanted Non-Smoking room, well I booked a non-smoking room, and my profile list this as my most important preference. I also have it listed to be on a high floor and away from the elevators. I was put on a mid-level one door away from the elevator. FAIL! This is not hard, this is when it was clear to me I was just a number at this super large hotel. The name of this hotel is Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on the Las Vegas Strip.. I did book a “Studio” so I expected a small studio suite, but the word suite is blatant false advertisement. I was given a room, a small and poorly appointed room at that. The room (or as they call it Studio) reminded of a Hilton Garden Inn room, that was missing some things like a DESK, people do come to Vegas for work, no desk in the room?? There was a small round table with stiff chairs. There was a wet bar, AKA Microwave and college dorm room size refrigerator. The shower had a very old brown shower curtain and had a mildew smell. The room had a connecting door that allowed me to hear the conversations of the room next to me. Also the light from under the door was distracting in my dark room. There is nothing special about this place, and if they really want people to buy time shares and this is the room they gave one of Hilton’s most loyal, good luck to them. The food options at this place is also an example why so many Americans are fat. I booked a rate with breakfast and it was good for a Breakfast sandwich, small coffee and a small OJ. The egg sandwich was a “egg patty” plastic cheese and one little slice of bacon. Zero healthy options for me. So disappointing. FAIL! Now for the parking, self parking... they should be shamed for charging $8.00 per night. I have never ran into a hotel in Vegas that charges for parking. You also take your life into your own hands in the parking garage as the people who valet the cars speed up and down the ramps (in someone else's car). Shocking to see how these people have no respect for others vehicles and just reckless behavior. They must know there is an issues as they have cones blocking every corner parking spot in the garage, giving them a place to pull out of the road as they fly around blind turns.. FAIL! The location, is ok, the hotel is around nothing, besides the boarded up Sahara, the empty frames of half done and stalled building projects. Sure you can walk down to the action, but the other people on the streets are very scary. I can not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: tjksask
Reviews.Content: This is my third time share property and I would say that this is the nicest by far. Great linens in the rooms and fluffy towels were an extra bonus for us. The bus stops right outside the hotel or you can grab a cab at any time. The hotel is very quiet which is nice after being in the noise all day. If you did not want to attend a time share presentation then you just ignored the welcome package and the messages on the phone. The marketplace had a good selection of snacks and wonderful cheesecakes for a great price. Would definately return to this hotel except that we did not like Vegas. On another note, if staying here and getting a cab from airport, make sure they do not try to take you the longer route. Our cab driver said it would be faster but more expensive, didn't ask, told us then said "is that okay? Ended up being a $34 ride. We got a cab back to airport in which the driver went the direct route and it was $18.90.

Reviews.Title: “A faraway hotel...”
Reviews.Author: heyValera
Reviews.Content: This is an ex-time share hotel, so it is not a full-service Hilton hotel, as you would expect. No lounge, no upgrades, but on the flip side - full kitchen, good views and a couple of stores nearby to fill up your refrigerator :) Other than that - you can find much better deals somewhere on the strip - because those taxi trips back and forth will add up, even the monorail ain't cheap in Las Vegas, so your overall cost of even one-day stay will be much higher. The staff is efficient, the rooms are ok, check-out time is 10am (I believe the "super" hotels have it at 11am on average). Again, FAR AWAY from the "Strip"

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for my visit”
Reviews.Author: ImATravelinFool
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times and have had plenty of fun staying in the heart of the strip with the lights and fanfare. On this trip I was pleased to stay away from all of that on the north end of the strip towards the tower at the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites. Since I had a car and my business took me several places beyond the touristy parts of the main strip, the location was not a big deal for me. The suite I had was in Tower 1 and was very clean and perfectly appointed. It was more than a comfortable location to conduct a week's worth of work. Since I knew in advance that the suite had its own washer and dryer, I was able to pack lightly and only use carry-on's by washing my clothes mid-week. The full kitchen and refrigerator allowed me to grab some essentials at a nearby grocery store and keep my dining expense down while at the same time maximizing time available to conduct my business. I could wake up, have coffee and a light breakfast and be done with it, ready to go in the time it would have taken me to go out and spend twice as much money. The hotel has limited amenities regarding food/bev. It's not like your typical strip hotel with two large buffets and four high-end restaurants. Instead, there is one very basic pantry/coffee shop that has the basics with enough options to get by for all three meals. There is also a CVS right next to the hotel with a fairly large food/bev section if you need to supplement whatever the hotel doesn't offer with goodies for your room. If those options don't suffice, then you can always hop on the Deuce bus for $5 (one day) or $7 (24hrs) and ride up and down the strip to your heart's content, getting off at whatever hotel or restaurant strikes your fancy. I took a taxi on one day for $10 and the next day made it to the same location on the bus for the same price for half as much. I also drove to locations on the strip but that proves to be longer by the time you get into another hotel's parking garage and up to your intended final location. Because of its location on the north end of the strip, for those of you driving your own car, there is fairly easy access on and off the highway to access the airport or other locations, without having to creep through traffic on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Grim--certainly not "suites!"”
Reviews.Author: industryanalyst
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for HIlton Grand Vacations when I went for CES 2012 last week. It was quite a disappointment on many levels. 1) Location: location is awful. It's on the "wrong" end of the Strip, a cab ride from everything. Seedy individuals and prostitutes were a regular sighting when I ventured out to the bus stop. 2) Rooms: HGV uses a very loose definition of "suite." Mine was a Ramada Inn type of room, with a non-functional dorm fridge and microwave. Hardly a "suite." Walls were paper thin, so I heard all of the comings and goings next door. Kind of like having roomates., 3) Broadband: It's free, and worth every penny. Really a joke--I was unable to get much of any work done, as it crapped out regularly. Tried various floors and the lobby as well, no better. 4) Maid service: this is gross, but I'll share. My first day, while in the shower I noticed a rather large black hair on one of the walls of the shower stall (about 6 feet up). I'm 5'7, and blond, so it clearly wasn't mine. Over the course of my five day stay, I was curious to see if the maids would catch it. Guess what? They didn't. Yuck, what else did they miss? 5) Green = crappy features. The hotel's ridiculous "green" kick means you get "features" such as CF bulbs (one popped in the lamp while I was there), and low-flow showerheads in the bathroom. 6) The hotel doesn't care about any of this. When asked upon checkout how my stay was, I shared this feedback. The clearly untrained staff member in charge of checkout on my departure date didn't appear to think that any of this warranted any action. In short, a rather grim place to stay, and hardly deserving of the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations, not so nice location.”
Reviews.Author: CPECHO
Reviews.Content: While the accomodations were very nice, clean, staff very friendly and helpful, much better, larger pool and pool area than the HGVC at the Flamingo. Do not take a Strip view room, as all you will see is all the abandoned construction projects.Take a mountain view room instead. Really not near anything except for a CVS Pharmacy. Food at pool and food court was good. Average priced. Needed to take bus, or taxi to main part of Strip. Buses can be quite crowded at times. If the area ever gets developed, it will be nice. If you want to gamble, you're not near any of the popular casinos. Kind of dark and desolate at night. Wouldn't stay there if I was a female traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and elegant”
Reviews.Author: KOinDenver
Reviews.Content: Fully equipted kitchen with granite - awesome comfortable beds and pillows. There was a jacuzzi in the room but did not use it. Really enjoyed this property for comfort. The front desk clerk was really great. She was quick, professional, & friendly

Reviews.Title: “These are NOT suites”
Reviews.Author: SurferPete
Reviews.Content: This is a tired old hotel which is in a seedy part of town. If you want to enjoy the atmosphere and craziness of Las Vegas don't stay here. It's a cab ride to everywhere and there is not restaurant or coffee shop in the hotel. Only a terrible marketplace which sells the worst food imaginable. The rooms they claim are suites are just regular sized hotel rooms with a microwave. We checked out 3 days earlier and moved the The Hotel at Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacation Club next to Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Esighed
Reviews.Content: This is on the north Strip take the Deuce bus or cab to other strip hotels. The restaurant has good food and the beds are very comfortable. You can walk to Pawn Stars pawn shop to the north. The CVS next door has lots of discount coupons for shows and helicopter rides to the Grand Canyon. Don't buy tickets to any shows til you check with the CVS desk prices are very flexible esp. for the Le Rive show at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: Joel20_20
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great when you enter but the rooms are very small and not updated. It's also far from the strip. Had to walk a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Teamhoffmann
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the room for one night in the middle of the week. We got a king non-smoking for $71 per night. The room was worth far more than that. Nice view of the strip. Beautiful lobby area. Indifferent staff people out front. It didn't really matter at that price. The concierge was very helpful, but a little too pushy. The self-parking ramp in back was easy to access and fair empty the night we stayed. This end of the strip is a little more barren than the other end, but we ended up walking the strip for awhile anyway. Lots of little extras we didn't have time to explore in the hotel. Overall it was a beautiful room in a better than expected property.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Buia59
Reviews.Content: I really liked being close to the casinos and shows but did not want to be in the middle of the chaos in Vegas. This hotel did not have a casino. I really liked the kitchenette and the spa and the warm pool! Everything was within walking distance and the bus for Grand Canyon picked us up from the hotel. Very good service and friendly people and concierge.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve 2012”
Reviews.Author: Dashecky123
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this Resort; the rooms were nice and clean; however, try to get Tower # TWO, it has a MUCH nicer view. Parking was never an issue during any of our stays. On this trip we booked two studio-suites (which did not have hot-tubs in them) over New Years 2012. We also paid for one additional night. If you have HGVC points, call the hotel directly first, it may be cheaper to pay cash for the nights than using your HGVC or RCI points. The studio-suites have a DVD player, refrigerator, microwave, dishes, silverware, etc. Downstairs there is a store, pool table, rectcreation room, gym, and coffee shop. The business center cost twenty cents an minute for internet access; wireless access was free in my room. BTW, if you use points you will get free parking but you will not get daily housekeeping, which was expected. We did get a couple phone calls to see how things were going and to tell us about things in the area. The pool was large, 3.5 feet deep, heated during our stay and nice. The sun does not reach the pools until the 12 so it can be a bit cool in the shade; however, they have several jet world-pools that are very warm-hot until then… You can get food and drinks at the Waves Bar in the pool area; the Bar was closed on Monday. Outside alcohol and glasses were not allowed in the pool area but we worked around that ;-) LOL. The nearest Casinos are Circus-Circus is 1/3 mile to the right and the Stratosphere 1/3 mile to the left. On New Year’s Eve the strip is shut down to traffic between 5PM and 2AM. CVS is right next door to the HGVC and is open until midnight; there is an Albertsons Food Store 1.35 miles down Sahara Blvd at the corner of Maryland. They have a city bus stop in front of the hotel that will take you downtown or down the strip; $20 for 3 days, $7 for one day and $5 for two hours. There was a bus that runs down Sahara Blvd which we did not use. The taxi will take you anywhere… We have stayed at several the Hilton Grand Vacation Club Resorts over years and this was the quietest. As other reviewers have stated, this HGVC hotel was great because, at the end of the day, you come back to a nice quiet place to lay your head down and relax.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, USA
Reviews.Title: “The Old vacation condo pitch, with a few twists”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I went out there knowing what we were getting into, however, I guess we were a little niave that we might get a day or two to complete some of our own due diligence regarding the offer. Well, the otld BUY RIGHT NOW or lose thousands of incentives, without the benefit of even reading all the contracts was the order of the day. So we do not buy real estate or vacation plans for 10's of thousands of dollars that way, Heck I do not buy mellons at the grocer that way. So I guess if you go there with that attitude and make up your mind not to be convinced otherwise, the stay was ok, a little out side the central stirp area, south, near the old Sahara, most of the big casino properties this far south on the strip are closed down and in foreclosure. Staff was great, very helpful, not pushy and the Hilton Brand quality was maintained. However, since this particular property is not a casino/hotel, resturants had to be found elsewhere. No full service resturant was available onsite. Now a word on one Airline Ticket Consolidator, OneTravel.com, I was a little naive here also. I thought they were going to provide the best price, and also some ongoing support between the time I pruchased the tickets, (june, 2011 and November, 2011). I did not get a price that was reflective of such an advance booking, I did not realize that until other specials came out during the time we were waiting to travel. Anyway, I guess that is the point here. I should have waited some before purchasing. Anyway, I had tickets on Air Tran, USAir, and United for the round trip. Also, I recieved NO added value from them with regards to trying to refine my trip with the airlines, seats, etc. I will most likely go back to booking directly with the airlines, like I always have done in the past. I would, however, love to hear other experiences with these companies. Maybe I have other thing to learn regards how I interface with them. One more comment, Las Vegas Taxi cab drivers are mostly crooks!!!! They all say they are from Ethiopia, may be true. However, the first cab we traveled in, went around the block avoiding the Stirp right where our destination was for about 15 minutes. I had a GPS application running on my Droid phone and could see the circles we were going in. What should have been a $10.00 ride was up to 23.75 on the meter. WHen I confronted him, he said "... no pay, no pay, you no pay..." meaning the meter cost, and after some angry words he gave us a verbal price of $12.50. This happened 3 times!! three different cab companies. The only difference was whether the driver was rude or apologetic, the result was the same. My rules, check with the Hotel staff to see if you can walk, then if not, ask them how much the cab SHOULD charge. Be prepared to FIGHT for that price, And threaten to take id and call LV Taxi Cab Commision. WHEW! Now I have told somebody. This interaction was the most stressful part of the trip until I realized what was happening. Be your own advocate. Thanks for the opportunity to vent a little.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, but not walking distance to most casinos”
Reviews.Author: Neilrater
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to meet the continuing high standards of the Hilton hotel chain. This is a good hotel if you plan a long (over 3 days) stay. Recommend paying extra for the suite with the kitchen so some of your meals can be prepared at the hotel. Great excercise facility. For going to the casinos the Circus-circus is two blocks away but for the others the bus picks up on the street outside the hotel. It is called the Duce bus and runs every 12 minutes or so. (operated by Las Vegas transit). Costs $7 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Surfchic55
Reviews.Content: This place is really great! Affordable, comfortable, & convenient. We had a 1br king room and it was perfect. The kids slept on the sofa sleeper and we had our own bedroom with bathtub. The bathroom also connected to our room making it easy to get ready. This is a great place especially when traveling with kids. There is no casino and no smoking. There are game, workout, and laundry rooms. It is a great location, its a way to be on the strip, but not have to deal with the craziness of being in the heart of the strip. The bed was comfortable, everything was very clean, and the staff (from the person greeting you before you check in, to the parking security) were awesome and so friendly! Also, having a full kitchen with refrigerator was perfect and the washer/dryer in our suite came in very handy. It really was a great stay and we would most definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “If it were only closer...”
Reviews.Author: Gagal
Reviews.Content: LOVED our room here. After our two night stay in one of the over-rated, over-priced hotels, this was quite a treat. Large rooms and lots of amenties. It was too cold to swim but the pool still looked inviting. We had plenty of room to spread out. It was a little surprising when you turn on the lights and get this really low lighting. This is a green resort so they use the small florescent bulbs which take a while to turn on. It was really nice to have refrigerator, coffe maker and microwave to use. Shower was a little chilly because of the green factor but hey, it was only two days. The biggest draw back is the location but you can get the bus right outside the door and a day pass is only $7. It was definitely a quieter area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Location - not so much!”
Reviews.Author: Pookie0621
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Definitely a class hotel and time share. Loved the room and the pool area. The downside is that it is quite far away from the "action" area. Right beside Circus Circus but that is it. I would not stay here again only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: jmmay71
Reviews.Content: Nice property, very clean and well kept. Short driving distance from the heart of the strip where most parking is free. Stayed in 1bdr suite with great kitchen area including washer/dryer. Booked the day of stay and still got a great weekend rate. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, but location just OK”
Reviews.Author: jfulginiti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. My in-laws own a timeshare here and let me use their points to come to Vegas with my wife and two friends. The rooms are spacious and inviting and have all the comforts of home. The pool and the hot tubs are great - just wish they were open later. The only downside is that although this property is right on the strip, it is on the north end (Stratosphere and Circus Circus) which isn't really near any of the newer hotel/casinos. You will definitely feel like you are not in the heart of the strip. Every day, we had to take taxis to and from more central hotels (Caesars, Palazzo) which got very expensive. Considering traffic, it cost probably over $12 each way. We are going back to Vegas in February and are staying in the HGVC behind the Flamingo. Even though we really enjoyed this hotel, we are excited to be staying in a more centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great look and leave hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryAlbertaDaveP
Reviews.Content: Great place for tourist (non gambler) types for great value in a limited service hotel. The hotel has two levels of service, cheapskates on the discounted rate (like us) get to park on the higher floors of the parkade next door (no biggie..I didn't pay for valet) and higher rollers (and payers) get the full experience (valet, bell service, concierge etc.). This time share hotel is obviously experiencing low occupancy and has discounted their rooms to attract clients. The rooms are top quality.. quiet, well appointed, great beds...although the bathroom and shower could have been larger and more attractive. At the north end of the strip, it still requires a taxi trip to the main shopping and entertainment areas. Good value for people like us who frequent Hilton Garden Inns, Holiday Inn Express and Hampton Inns on the road

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nog57
Reviews.Content: I decided to check into this hotel since I was bringing my whole family with me to Vegas to celebrate my birthday. I had reserved 2 two bedroom suites to accomodate us all and they were very nice in getting the rooms right across from each other. Though far from the hustle & bustle of the strip, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Aside from having no casino in the hotel (one of the reasons I picked this), this was the perfect place for people with kids. The place was clean, the staff friendly & helpful and the mini market they had was so convenient if you needed anything during the night. The suites were spacious enough for all of us (15 in all) to gather every night & talk about our eventful day. I would definitely recommend this hotel & definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The quickest elevators on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Rokan72
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night and it was a good choice. The check in team were friendly and efficient. The concierge was ok when booking a show but not on the ball when it came to helping us book a Hilton hotel in LA. The room was good and had a mini kitchen area, everything was clean and we had no complaints. Downstairs there was a shop serving starbucks coffee, cake, hot food etc. The hotel has an excellent gym and there's a good size room with a pool table and computers for surfing the web, the rate was reasonable. The pool/bar outside gets a lot of sun. Food service outside was poor I thought, I waited almost an hour for lunch, I was sunbathing and so wasn't too bothered but ... The only problem with this hotel is it's location, it's towards the end of civilisation regarding the strip. There is however a bus service with a stop right outside, take the bus at night is my advice. Overall it was good value for a Vegas weekend, clean and tidy and a good place to relax. I would consider staying here again if I return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlavalon
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to Vegas for her 21st birthday and had a blast. The room was clean and very spacious, we had a 1 bedroom suite and the kitchen worked out great for us it really allowed us to cut down on spending too much on eating out. The jacuzzi in the bedroom was a great touch and the staff was very helpful and nice. I would have to say the only downside to the hotel was 1. the location : we just got $7.00 day passes for the bus and it was fine.... and 2. the fact that the curtains did not completely blackout the room, which isnt much fun in Vegas when you stay out late and would like to sleep in the next day. But I compaired alot of hotels in preparation for our trip and this was the nicest hotel suite I could find for a very reasonable price and I would have to say we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property although the location is not great”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: At this HGVC, the property is nice. It's not a Bellagio, Wynn, or Cosmpolitan but certainly adequate. There is no casino on site, so that's a big positive from my persepctive, as the entire property is no smoking although they do let people smoke too close to the front door. The major problem with this property is it's location. While it's great to not be right in the center of the strip, the downside is that there is nothing around. It was uilt when they expected lots of development on the north strip, none of which has happened. Across the street is the deteriorating shell of what was supposed to be the Fountainbleau hotel and casino. The only properties in walking distance are the Riviera and Circus Circus which only have lower-end restaurants and fast-food. While the monorail is only about a 10 minute walk, it's through a questionable area now that the Sahara and the casino across the street from it have closed. If you have a car, this property is probably fine, otherwise be prepared to spend a lot of money on cabs to get to anywhere decent to eat. Finally, since it is a HGVC, the room is only cleaned every 3 days or so. If you are expecting regular hotel service, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Might be ideal for some...me, not so much.”
Reviews.Author: Fzedlach
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here again (stayed here once before) and can't remember why I chose to do so. As others have noted, the location is not the best, especially when hungry, as there is nothing nearby other than Circus Circus. The parking expensive when most other hotels offer free parking. For guests, they make you park on level 4 or above of the garage, which adds an exhoribitant amount of time winding up and down the garage (unlike other garages, this one doesn't have a straight shot down, you have to wind through each floor).
