Check-in was friendly and quick. The hotel seemed to be secure, too. The room itself: PAPER THIN WALLS! I could hear noise all night long, truly disrupting my sleep. As a previous poster noted, the curtains don't close all the way, thus allowing some light in. The bed and pillows, however, were quite comfortable. The "studio" suite I had was quite small, even by most hotel standards. There is a nice flat-screen TV in the room. The shower has low water pressure, and bathroom amenities are few and far between (just soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner). My stay here signficantly dissuaded me from purchasing a timeshare here. You can and should do much better in Vegas, and for less, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for those who don't need to be "in the middle of everything"”
Reviews.Author: troy mcclure
Reviews.Content: Ok, so first off, if this is your first time in Vegas and you need to be in a nice casino often with restaurants very close, then maybe this place ain't ideally suited for you. On the other hand, if you are on a leisurely vacation, don't mind driving (you really need a car for this place-without one would probably be a real pain/very limiting) then this place is great. We stayed for a week through RCI timeshare exchange and had a 2 bedroom suite. It was VERY modern. Very roomy. Maintenance and housekeeping were both awesome. When our A/C had a problem, they came right away and replace the battery. We wanted extra few pillows-yes we are pillow junkies-they were there right away. ***Please tip these people well, they take excellent care of you*** Maid service comes once a week (If I recall on Tuesday), if you want more you need to pay for it. It was so convenient having the full kitchen, although we used it far less than we would have guessed. 3 t.v's (1 for each bedroom and one for the living room) was also great-but I really didn't watch even a half hour a day-hell it's Vegas and we were out all the time...and barely slept. The beds are very comfy. The soap and shampoo, etc. are awesome...bring some mouthwash or pick some up at the huge CVS next door. Never made it to the pool, but it looked nice. Never made it to Jacuzzi-but g.f. said it was nice. Used the jetted tub in the master-it was good, roomy but not awesome. There is a concierge if you need show tickets. The gym looked nice-but it's Vegas-we hiked out of town, and walked all over casino's and resorts...but I guess a lot of people used it. The store/cafe looked expensive and I didn't use it...but then again there are so many great restaurants, why would I eat at some cafe? For owners of a timeshare, parking is free, but I think it's $18 a day (could be wrong) to Valet, plus tip. We self parked. You will need to park on 5th floor or higher. Expect to park at least at 6 if it's busy...higher if it's very busy. This wasn't an issue for us, the elevators in the parking garage are quick. There is a recycle bin as you walk into building from parking garage. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but again, it would be a pain without a rental car. Bus is close, but I would find some deals through Alamo. On a busy week we stacked a Alamo Insider coupon and another coupon and paid $97.50 for a week. I couldn't believe it. Great deal, but you have to do your homework. For tips on Vegas read the forum on Trip Advisor Las Vegas...I learned a lot on there and saved a small fortune. My g.f. tried the spa. It was solid. If you have a car I recommend the following: ***Use I15 to get to most places on the South End of the Strip. For the Venetian (mid strip) and Downtown we just used LV BLVD. Mind you crossing LV Blvd is not for the timid. ***Budget at least 5 hours for Valley of Fire State Park. Go in the morning if you can. It was one of the nicest places I have been to in the U.S. ***See Cirque de Soleil Beatles LOVE. WOW!!!!!!!!!! You can sit anywhere and like it. ***Venetian Grand Lux Cafe (also one in Palazzo) was the best place for reasonably priced sit down food. Expect $20pp for a great meal. A little more if you order something fancy or go hog wild. They have great small plates and we would order a few then split an entree. ***M Resort is a bit of a drive down I15 but the buffet was awesome and a tremendous value at lunch. Sunday brunch was $35 but had a lot more. Free beer and wine (and cider on Sunday's) as well as free Cappuccino. ***We did a fancy dinner at Triple George downtown very close to Freemont Street. Service was excellent and we found a coupon/cheap gift cert. on Restaurant.com. They make great fish and steak. ***We also went out to Red Rock Canyon at dawn. It's a 13 mile loop with some great hikes. I would do this before doing (not in the same day) as Valley of Fire as Valley of Fire is more beautiful, imo. Ok, hope those tips help. Oh yeah, we had no kids, but if I had to bring kids to Vegas (I wouldn't) this would be a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located for our LV trip.”
Reviews.Author: orlando_fan_62
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay in apartments rather than hotels, the Hilton was ideal for us. Location wise it's right in the middle of the strip (we had a car) so easy to reach most locations. The property was of a very high standard and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, so-so location...”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: My family of four enjoyed this property. The staff was very helpful. The room was nice, though the sofa bed was lumpy, according to my girls. One thing I did NOT like about this room was the curtains don't close all the way. This allows light from outside to shine in, a pet peeve of mine. I had to use a sofa chair to hold the curtain closed. They did have a very nice work out room, pool & hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mobi136
Reviews.Content: we like the timeshare at the hilton. a studio wa just right for us and allowed us to have coffee and make meals to cut down on the cost of eating out all the time. The view of the mountains was absolutely beautiful. We were down the street from CVS and circus circus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but not the best hotel experience...”
Reviews.Author: cmkovacs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was very nice. The kitchen was very well stocked for basic needs. There was a jacuzzi in the bedroom which was a treat. We were on the 19th floor and had a beautiful view of the mountains. Washer and dryer was in the suite. Now for the not so great issues. Although it was fixed as soon as I reported it, there was no hot water in the shower and the water pressure was very low. Beds were not comfortable. I had to get my key card recoded 3 times. The sofa bed was not made, I had to put the sheets on myself (never have had to do this at any other hotel). The front desk staff was okay. Overall nothing impressed me about our stay here and nothing exceeded my expectations, which led to my very wise decision to NOT buy a timeshare here.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice enough but no amenities, no restaurant, nothing”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: It's really hard to tell what clientel this hotel is trying to reach, as it seems to be trying to cater to everyone but succeeding at none. For the business traveler, the smoke-free, casino-free setting is a plus (and it's by far the least rowdy hotel I've ever stayed in in Vegas) but the wi-fi sucks; despite being free, it's entirely too slow to try to work, and there's no comfortable workspace or desk in the "studio" rooms. For the budget-concious, the microwave and fridge mean less meals out, but the expensive parking means you need to either take a taxi to the store or shop in the (very expensive) mini-mart in the basement. For folks with kids, you'll have to book at least a basic suite to get more than one bed in the room so it's no longer cost-effective. And for me, not having a restaurant or bar is the deal-breaker as these are minimum amenities you would expect to find at a property bearing the Hilton name. Even moreso in Las Vegas. This would be more tolerable if the property were closer to any real dining options (the closest hotel/casino is Circus Circus which is not known as the culinary epicenter of Vegas) or if the hotel offered a free shuttle to its sister properties in Las Vegas. But it is a bit cut off from the rest of Las Vegas so one's choices are to either microwave some ramen noodles, get a $2 hot dog at Slots-o-Fun, or spring for a taxi ride. That said, the room at least was clean, and the bed quite comfortable; we appreciated having the mini-fridge to keep beverages cool (and glad it was not one of the automatic mini-bar ones like you see most other places in Vegas) and we didn't get a lot of hallway noise. So it wasn't all terrible. Just really not a good fit for someone looking to take a break from cooking and grocery shopping while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice facility overall - no casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: ftoader
Reviews.Content: The truth is that I stayed at this hotel for two nights (almost free) because I got sucked into a timeshare presentation. The facility was very nice and the suites are very spacious - not that you really need this type of (large) accommodation when in Vegas. You get a nice kitchen area with pretty much everything you need (basic though), living room / eating area, and a nice bedroom with a big bath and tub. Everything looked pretty new and well maintained. Reception area is a little bit confusing. No casino at this hotel and that makes it look so much different than most of the hotels in Vegas. There are some shops and cafe on the ground floor. Timeshare presentation area is a pretty big production area (go figure!). Although the hotel is on the strip, is quite up North and there is a bit of walking down the strip where the Vegas life is. Parking is at cost (I believe around $8 per day) that is so unusual for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: cosifan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a two-bedroom sweet with a kitchen for 4 days over Thanksgiving. It was locate relatively close to the strip (about 5-10 minuet drive) and also close to the monorail stop. I especially liked the fact the hotel doesn't' have a casino which is a rarity in Vegas. My kids liked the heated swimming pool and the game room with a pool table as well as a ping-pong table. The only negative was that they don't have housekeeping services for less than 7 days of stay unless you are willing to pay. It was a bit of pain to call for everything from new towels to dishwasher detergents although they were very prompt. I will definitely consider coming back in our next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Close to strip AND downtown”
Reviews.Author: sasakidalem
Reviews.Content: Weren't quite sure where it was located when booked, but knew it was close to the strip by mapquest. Area might not be the best to walk to the strip, however, there are options to get down there very quickly. I like the downtown as well so it was great to be in between. Self Parking ($8/day) isn't the greatest as there's a parking garage where the 1st 3 floors are reserved for valet ($15/day). The hotel wasn't very full, yet you had to drive up to the 6th or 7th floor to get a space where the elevator was not a 40 yard walk. Then you walk about another Food in the Market downstairs leaves a LOT to be desired, but your room has a microwave & fridge. If you take a 1 or 2 bedroom there's a full size refrigerator and stove as it is a time share property. Convenient to airport (5-6 miles) but take Paradise rather than go through the strip!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY, Location OK, worth the price overall!”
Reviews.Author: SecretBeer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been Hilton property owners for a few years now. We have two small children and enjoy traveling. So, visiting "the city of sin", we really had to plan ahead and find the amenities we thought were required on this trip. As we visited the Hilton website we noticed that the hotel is first and foremost FAMILY FRIENDLY with in room washer and dryer, full kitchen, a small shopette, Starbucks and free parking. Not too mention that its walking distance from Circus Circus which kept the kids busy for an entire day. As great as it sounds there are a few draw backs to staying here. If you came to LV looking to party, club, mingle then the location may not be for you. The nearest night club is 1.5 miles away and walkable. The nearest show is nearly a mile away and walkable. The Circus Circus has a buffet but its not nearly ad good as the larger hotels. Bottomline is the hotel is FAMILY FRIENDLY! If you are single or dating the I would suggest renting a car as parking is free at all the major hotels. We, even with the two children, saw a few shows, ate at three buffets and visited all the major hotels. And, we are extremely happy with our Hilton experience.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip .... off the strip”
Reviews.Author: GlennLittle
Reviews.Content: Let me make this brief- this is where you stay if you have your family and don't want them exposed to gambling, smoke and drinking. The pool and outside facilities are great. There is a small eating place downstairs where you can get something quick to eat. In addition, downstairs there is also a sort of limited convenience store downstairs for drinks, food items and vacation items. The rooms decently sized and very clean for a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton treated us right!”
Reviews.Author: Shookster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a couple of friends with us to Las Vegas for her 50 something birthday celebration. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which offered us two large bedrooms and a large living and kitchen area. The rooms were nicely appointed and provided us with privacy to enjoy ourselves while at the same time enough room to party and celebrate my wife's birthday! Check in was simple and our room was ready for us upon arrival. The service at this resort is top notch and all you had to do is ask for something to receive it. We had a full kitchen which allowed us to cut down on our food costs while spending more on our nice dinners out. The pools are small, but there was plenty of room for guests and we had no trouble getting chairs in the shade near the water. The pool bar was nice and food was prepared right at the pool in the kitchen so we didn't have to go anywhere to catch a light snack or full meal. We stayed a full week at this resort which is a little long for staying in Vegas, but made the most of it by enjoying the sun and pool during the day and the strip at night when it cooled off. This hotel does not have a casino and is not situated in the hustle and bustle of the strip, but is close enough to the main drag so getting there is not a problem. This hotel has a small store and grill on the bottom floor which made it nice when you needed something small or wanted to get coffee or a snack. We would recommend this hotel for those who want to be in Vegas, but not directly under the lights and noise of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Last time at this Hilton property...”
Reviews.Author: mileslg
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this resort Nov 7-11, 2011. Although, not my first choice in Vegas, we, like other reviewers, agreed to attend a timeshare presentation at this location. We have stayed at many Hilton hotels and figured this would be just as good, or we hoped, better than other Hilton properties. Our first impression at check-in at this hotel was awful! I called in advance to see about an early check-in since our flight arrived at 12:30 pm & advertised check-in was at 4PM. Was told that it shouldn't be a problem to check in early. Upon arrival at the hotel at approx 1:30pm, we were told there weren't any rooms available. I explained to the woman at the front desk that we were promised a penthouse suite (which I had in writing from Hilton & showed her), she looked confused & went back to another office & after about 5 minutes finally told us that they didn't think there were any of those rooms available. We found out later that any room above floor 25 are considered "penthouse" rooms???? Since rooms weren't available at check-in, the front desk took our cell phone number & indicated they would call us as soon as our room was ready. We explained we had dinner reservations at 7PM & wanted to shower & change since we'd been flying since early AM. She said that they would contact us BEFORE 4PM. This was fine with us, so we stored our luggage with the bellhop & decided to kill some time. Hadn't heard anything by 4pm, so we called the resort at 4:15pm & spent 10 minutes on hold before we hung up. At 6PM, we still had not heard anything from them & just went back to the hotel. The front desk replied "sorry, we've been busy & didn't have time to call you." Really???? Not a good first impression! Although the room was o.k. - just a standard hotel room, the temperature control was not working properly. We had it set to 65 degrees, but it was still hot & stuffy in the room. The bathroom was small & supplied with only two bath towels. It was necessary to buy bottled water to drink or for the in-room coffee maker, as the water from the tap was horrible & never got cold. The "kitchen facilities" consisted of a coffee maker, toaster, microwave & small fridge. Keep in mind if you are staying at this property there is no restaurant on site - just a very over-priced deli/convenience store in the lower level. Walking to the nearest casino and/or restaurant was at least 10-15 minutes (the Riviera). In our 3 days on this trip, we probably spent about $200 on taxi fare. I know we could have traveled cheaper by bus, but the time wasted with long lines, waiting for it to arrive & stopping every block, it was much faster using a taxi. The pool area looked o.k., however, the weather was too cold to use the facilities. I guess if you're going to Vegas & want a quiet, out of the way place, this may be ideal. However, if you want to gamble & be around great restaurants, I would certainly NOT recommend. This would be the last place I would ever consider purchasing a time share. I know we won't be using this property again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Garry J
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this resort. We lotally loved it. The rooms were awesome, the service first rate and the pool was an truly and Oasis in the desert. Best of all it has no slot machines. We would likely recommended it. Its a break from the mayhem of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Will never come back”
Reviews.Author: OreoToby
Reviews.Content: The parking is very inconvenience, you have to walk through a long outdoor path to get there. The bathroom sink drains water slowly, so you need to be very patient when using it. The heater makes very noisy and blows wind right to rhe bed so we couldn't sleep well. There are two iHome units in the suit, which was nice. Unfortunately one of them is not working. I called the hotel operator on monday morning and was told she's sending an engineer to fix it. It's Thursday afternoon now, and no one ever showed up. The HGV club call center lady lied about the gift we would receive, and we found a different story when we met the salesperson. We're glad we backed out earlier enough. And we feel very luck we didn't purchase any HGV plan as this is definitely not the right club we should join.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel and would also use for a family vacation (no casino)”
Reviews.Author: RM30139
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel to use for business or vacation in Las Vegas. No casino means there are no crowds and no smoking, yet it's easy to get to the Convention Center or the Strip. Very quiet, great rooms and comfortable beds. While there is no restaurant service (except at the pool - weather permitting) they do have a deli with groceries (since all the rooms have microwaves and frig) and if you are a light eater the deli food is very good. Exercise room is first class AND open 24 hours! Game room by the exercise center is great for kids and the outdoor pool area has BBQ equipment if you are so inclined. Third time we've stayed here and the quality and service is always excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Okay - Location Not Okay”
Reviews.Author: susie056
Reviews.Content: I really can't say too much about this hotel other than don't stay there ...it is in a terrible, somewhat dangerous, area ... The "non-condo"/standard rooms are tiny and the hotel is surrounded by empty lots, foreclosed apartment buildings. and structures that were abandoned mid-construction. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere and is a few miles away from the center of the strip where "everything is happening" and, therefore, you either have to walk MANY extra miles each day (in an area that I said leaves much to be desired) or you have to take lots of cabs (which are quite expensive in Vegas) ... Also, since the hotel is really off the beaten track, you have to wait for a cab to show up because the cab drivers go to the more popular hotels first. It really suprised us because, on the whole, we have always enjoyed staying at Hilton resorts. There's no restaurant (other than one at the pool). The hotel is fairly clean - but I would not say immaculate. So all in all - I really like Hilton as a chain ... but we were very dissappointed in this Hilton location.

Reviews.Title: “Always our first choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BritBoyInFL
Reviews.Content: We may be a bit biased as we own timeshare here. But, we love the fact that we can find peace 'n quiet in the craziness of Las Vegas. Easy to go get too everything, quick to get away from everything. Prices in the onsite cafe are a little too high for my liking, but hey, they're offering a convenience instead of heading outside to find coffee/snacks/drinks etc. We love the suites as they provide all the facilities needed to be self sufficient when you just can't stand another buffet :D Perhaps our only complaint is that the wifi is not the fastest and doesn't stay 'online' all the time, which seemed to coincide with the TV Audio going out ? A quick change of channel seemed to always bring it back (Room 22517). Also, TV service has NO HD channels (Hello, this is 2011 !) Shop around for prices, as King One Bedroom suites can be had for $100 (NOT Friday/Saturday).

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: kmroeder
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton on the strip for a weekend getaway with friends. For us, it was a good choice because it is not in the middle of the other casino hotels/resorts. It was about a 1/2 mile walk to the closest casinos (Riveria and Circus Circus). It also had a CVS pharmacy and a McDonald's close by. The rooms were average size and were very nice. The rooms featured a decent size fridge, a microwave, toaster, coffee maker and a kitchen sink. Very convenient if you are trying to save money by making some of your own meals. The hotel was quiet. And we appreciated that. We heard very little noise in the halls or from outside. But it did have its limitations. There is only a deli/convenience store for food in the hotel. We had one meal there - sandwiches. The sandwiches were good, but over priced ( but what do you expect in Vegas). It served coffee, danish, fruit, convenience foods and you could purchase wine and beer in there too. But if you wanted a sit down dinner or were looking for a real breakfast, you had to leave the hotel. The parking was also inconvenient. The garage was in the back of the hotel and required you to walk a distance from the garage to the hotel and it is not a covered walk. It was a pleasant enough stay and the rooms were nice. If you are looking for a hotel near all the excitement, this may not be for you. But if you don't mind walking to get to the casinos and you want some quiet, then this could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: SueinCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a second time two nights recently. We knew the hotel was at the far end of the strip and had no casino, but stayed because we met up with friends who were also staying and we got a great rate on an expensive weekend. We had a 1 bedroom with a full kitchen. It was a huge room with a large living room and separate bedroom. The room was very nice and we really had no complaints about it. There is a CVS next door, which is convenient for picking up snacks. It was really nice having a frig to keep some cold drinks. There is a shop downstairs that sells food items, but we did not go look at it either time we were there. I really prefer staying on the strip and at a hotel with bars and a casino, so don't think we will go back any time soon, but it is a nice hotel with some convenient features. I would say the walk is at least 15 minutes to the first hotel worth visiting (Circus Circus is very close, but we did not spend time there). I also have stayed more often at the other end of the strip, so don't know the hotels near there very well. Cab rides can be expensive too if you end up at the opposite end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: tempdragon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two-night stay at HGVC at Las Vegas. We attempted to check in on a Friday at 3:45 PM and the room requested (2 bedroom non-smoking) wasn’t ready yet. The desk clerk stated only smoking and handicap rooms of the type were available for check in. I decided to wait and she offered to contact housekeeping to put a rush on. She stated she would call me on my cell phone when the room was ready. At 4:30 PM, there was no call back, so I decided to follow up. It should be noted normal check in time is 4:00 PM. Got another desk clerk and he offered to move some of the rooms around, so we could check in. (Nice touch) He also put us in tower one, which he said had been remodeled. The rooms were clean and everything appeared to be in good working order. The rooms were modern and had everything we needed for a short stay. The bedding was comfortable and the rooms were quiet. The staff is friendly and for Elite members of HGVC, they have an Elite lounge, where they serve coffee/tea and pastry items in the morning. In the afternoon, they offer soda and cookies. The gym was nicely equipped and there is a nice deli/coffee bar on the first floor. It has been a few years since I’ve stayed at this location and they have been able to keep up with the maintenance. Everything looks nice still. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for Non-Casino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation Suites on the Strip is highly recommended, but it may not appeal to every Vegas traveler. First, this is a timeshare hotel (although we were not solicited during our stay). All the well apportioned rooms have kitchenettes and king size beds, ranging from studios up to 3 bedroom units, which is great for families and wedding parties (there were LOTS of wedding parties during our stay!) The rooms are clean, modern and quiet, with free in room cable internet. There is no casino in the hotel, and the closest casino is located about a block away in the “well past its prime” Circus Circus (this will change if the massive Echelon project is ever completed). The Fashion Mall is a 1 mile walk, while Caesar’s Place is 1.6 miles away. The city bus stops right in front of the hotel. There is also no restaurant in the hotel, although it does have a small self-service market/café. Other amenities include a spa, nicely equipped Precor branded gym and a pool, along with a recreation room offering billiards and other table games. The staff was extremely efficient and professional. There is no resort fee, but parking is $8/day. If you do not mind eating and gambling elsewhere, and am looking for peace and quiet after the casinos, this is a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kasmcallen
Reviews.Content: I just spent my birthday weekend here and the accomodations were great. Even though we were in Las Vegas where you can eat for almost nothing, we brought food and took full advantage of the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Not for First Timers”
Reviews.Author: DiabloDeb
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this property to accumulate more points on my Hilton Honors, it was newer and on the strip opposed to the other available Hilton properties. I've been to Las Vegas over three dozen times, not a big gambler so not having a casino in the building was not an issue. Our room was on the 21st. floor (there are 29 floors in all). The room was very nice, we had a 'one king bedroom suite' in tower one (which is facing the entrance is on the left). The kitchen was well appointed with tableware, utensils and appliances. The refrigerator has an ice maker that makes a very tiny amount of ice and it also very noisy, luckily there is an ice machine available on each floor. There is also a washer and dryer located in the kitchen. There is a desk adjacent to the dining area table that you have to pull a chair from the dining set to sit at. There is also high speed internet that is included in your stay and they give you the wifi password at check-in. One downside, not a big one, but internet service is intermittent at times and you always have to retype in the password each time you go on the internet. The living room is open to both the dining and kitchen areas and all share the same thermostat and it has a large window. The sleeper couch was very firm and comfortable as a couch, never tried it as a bed. There is a nice large, flat screen color television that swivels so it can be viewed while in the kitchen or dining area. The bedroom has a smaller flat screen TV and it's own thermostat and its own large window. There is a large Jacuzzi style tub that is open to the bedroom and a good size closet with ironing board, iron and extra linens. There is lots of drawer space in the dresser and it has a nice alarm clock as well. The bathroom has a shower stall but the water flow is not that great, not a pressure problem I think it is more a low flow shower head and no amount of twisting the head emits any more water. The bathroom has plenty of fresh towels, hair dryer and soaps. There are two doors to the bathroom, one opening into the bedroom and the other door opens to the entry of the unit. The main entrance is on the second floor, the first floor has access to the pools, gym and the marketplace. The marketplace serves fresh salads, sandwiches, pizzas and coffee. They also sell wine, beer, sodas and water as well as snack foods and candy. There is also frozen meals you can purchase, ice cream, frozen desserts and fresh items such as eggs and sausages that you can take back to your unit and prepare. There is also a small gift shop within that has a few items. While he Hilton is very clean, the staff is very helpful and polite and the elevators move incredibly fast there were some notable cons to the stay. Check in is not until 4 in the afternoon which is later than most hotels on the strip. Check-out is at 10 in the morning which is one to two hours earlier than most hotels on the strip. There were no 'Do Not Disturb' hangers for the door and housekeeping starts knocking on the door at 9 in the morning. Wouldn't be a problem if I was home getting ready for work but on vacation that is early, especially when you stay out late . . . it is Vegas. Overall the location is not all that great. Across from resort behind the now closed Sahara is one of the monorail platforms but it is not a safe nor is it easy to get to. If you walk up the strip further there is one at the Las Vegas Hilton, which is not on the strip and requires you to walk down a street that doesn't have too much foot traffic. Also there is nothing between the resort and Circus Circus along Las Vegas Blvd. and we encountered a few undesirable people along the way. So you are pretty much stuck taking taxi cabs to get around and it adds up quickly. Our ride from the airport to the resort with tip was close to $30. A few pointers on taxis, make sure you know the layout of the Las Vegas strip, you can print out a map and take it with you, one that shows all the hotels. If you travel up the strip and you want to go to a resort on the opposite side, choose a resort directly across from your destination then just walk across, saves you 5 to 10 dollars to do it this way since they don't have to go the back roads and loop around then backtrack to get you there. Same is true when heading back to the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites, take a cab from the opposite side that way they go straight down the boulevard and turn directly into the entrance. The Marketplace within the resort is convenient and the food is really good but it does tend to be a bit pricy. If you walk out the resort to the boulevard and turn right there is another condominium complex next door and they have a CVS that is much cheaper and it is a short walk. The price was average or fair, but many hotels along the strip are offering incredible deals to stay. I was rather shocked, I had originally booked my stay for Friday departing Sunday, which is the peak time for higher pricing then I switched it to Thursday departing Saturday, usually that Thursday would be the cheap fare at neighboring resorts but my reservation actually went up in price.

Reviews.Title: “Why go to Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: WhereeverIgoThereIam
Reviews.Content: The reason I went to Vegas was for my mother, 73, who likes to gamble. I'm not sure this was the best hotel for gambling. It is on the North part of the strip and you really need a car to get to any of the well-known casinos but you have to pay for parking here. The room was nice, it was a two-bedroom suite with a kitchenette. The pool was somewhat disappointing. The fountains were not on but the surprise was the drains in the bottom of the pool stuck up and jagged so it hurt our feet. I don't expect a missed detail like that at a Hilton. I love the Hilton brand of hotels, they are always clean and nice. This one just isn't in the right location for me the next time I take my mom back to Vegas we'll stay closer to the gambling action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience August 2011”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: I previewed a timeshare through Hilton Honors and stayed for $99 nightly in a standard double queen room. I didn't come to Las Vegas to gamble, so the fact that the property did not have a casino was not a huge issue for me. Everything was top notch, and casino dining/entertainment was extremely close. This is NOT in "the heart of the strip", but you can definitely take a nice brisk walk to the Fashion Show Mall area from the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our 8 day trip to Vegas. We travel to Vegas a fair amount and we have stayed at most of the casinos on the strip. If you have a car this is a fantastic place to stay. I would be a bit hesitant to stay here without transportation. The hotel is on the north end of the strip and there is not much within a short walking distance from the hotel. Taxis always seemed to be available and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel if you do not have transportation. The hotel is very clean, nice and a quiet getaway after a busy day/night on the town. In our 8 nights we never heard any other guests inside our room (we did have an end room). We stayed in a one bedroom room and it was very large with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, bathroom, Jacuzzi tub area and bedroom. The bed was one of the nicest beds I have had at a hotel. There is a washer and dryer in the room and we utilized it a fair amount. We were left 3 messages on our phone about a presentation for the time share and we just did not respond. We did stop by the welcome desk and were given a bag with some coupons that we did not use and were asked about setting up a time for a presentation. We told them we were not interested in listening to a presentation and that was the end of it. We never felt pressured to attend the presentation. If you are looking for a great place to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip this is a great place to stay. Just a couple minute drive and you are at any hotel on the strip for a fun evening out. I would highly recommend this hotel. We will be staying here on the majority of our future Vegas trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet place close to strip”
Reviews.Author: Lisa A
Reviews.Content: Great alternative to the loud, busy casino's. Stayed in 2 bedroom...lots of room. Pool was nice and clean, plenty of chairs. Restaurant by pool had good food. There was a small store and deli inside hotel, but we went to CVS next door most of the time. Nice parking garage so you don't have to worry about car.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hideaway”
Reviews.Author: bartonbeachhut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first trip away since having our family and we were a little anxious about the hotel having read some of the reviews, especially the time share element. Upon arrival front desk was very quick and efficient and we were in our room within a few minutes. The room was lovely and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We had no issues with the cleanliness either. The view wasn't the best but we didn't travel 15 hours to spend time in the hotel admiring the view! The pool was lovely and we had some food from the bar which was reasonably priced and good. We also used the Market Place for some breakfast items which although was a little more expensive had a good range to choose from. We also tried the lemon sponge cake which was delicious and well worth trying. We used the deuce bus to get around $7 pp for 24 hrs. The stop was just outside the hotel and we did have to negotiate a rather busy road when we got off the opposite side but it was okay. We tried the monorail on one occasion but wouldn't recommend it. The stop is quite distance away and it stops at the back of the casinos so quite some distance to get back to it. We had a fantastic night at Downtown Las Vegas and would definitely recommend it - it was great fun and a totally different experience to the main casinos. The deuce bus takes you straight there. We also visited Red Rock Conservation Reserve which the concierge gave us details of. We had a fantastic day and did a small walk (1.5 hrs). The views were stunning and definitely worth it to escape for a while. We took our own lunch and drink in as there is no where to get food. We would definitely stay at the hotel again should we ever visit Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: javajive2
Reviews.Content: I had reservations about making a reservation with HGV because I had read reviews that this was time-share. And true enough, right after check-in (front office check-in staff were friendly and speedy), I was told to step aside to another counter where another gentleman started with friendly questions and offered a bunch of complimentary restaurant vouchers etc (which I never used anyway) and then tried to sell the time-share. He wasn't overly pushy but I had to turn him down twice. So try and skip that counter if you have a chance. Apart from that, our experience at the hotel was just fine. It's located on the far north end of the strip. There is construction going on right across the hotel but a CVS right beside the hotel too, which makes it incredibly convenient to get necessities and snacks. So it's a lot more quiet since you're not smack in the middle of all the activity. I loved the room we had picked because it came with a full-service kitchen which was even well-equipped with cooking utensils, serving plates, cutlery and everything you need to cook. So we made ourselves a little breakfast in the mornings over the stove and made use of the handy oven and dishwasher too. I even did a small load of laundry since the room came equipped with a washer and dryer! The rooms were clean and housekeeping was efficient and friendly too. Overall, a good stay. I would not hesitate to recommend HGV except for the fact that it's just a little inconveniently located on the far end. Downside: Although the most economical way to get around and to the heart of the strip was to hop on a bus (The Deuce) outside the hotel, a courtesy shuttle to the main strip would have been much appreciated since the Deuce was ALWAYS packed. Even a courtesy airport shuttle would have been great.

Reviews.Title: “Altogether an Enjoyable Location”
Reviews.Author: Flagman32
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for one week with friends. We had two adjoining rooms – they had the bigger/better one as we were free-loading on their timeshare points! Despite having the smaller room it was plenty big enough for us with super large bed. Room very clean when we got there and cleaned to high standard during our stay. Reception and staff were good, managed to avoid the timeshare sell – its easy just give them a very low annual income – they lose interest fast and I ain’t that proud! Coffee shop/store has just enough for emergencies and there is a CVS store almost next door which has a good range. The only downside is that it is someway from most of the ‘action’ on The Strip, however there is a plus side to that in the fact that it is quieter and cabs are frequent and not expensive if you don’t feel up to the walk. Also because of the current recession building work has stopped on the new large complex across the road so the views out of the windows aren’t so good. Altogether an very good base for our first visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistent...always very good”
Reviews.Author: skiguy33
Reviews.Content: I stay here on a regular basis when I am in Vegas on business. It is always a very good experience.I am not a gambler so staying at a casino is not of interest. This grand vacations property has wonderful amenities - great outdoor pools, exericise facility, deli/market, game room. If you are looking for a hotel with restaurants, a casino and night life this is not the place. If you enjoy hitting the town and then coming back to a tastefully appointed quiet hotel with wonderful amenities then this is the place for you. Tip - if you are not into timeshare stay away from the sales pitches. They will not badger you if you make it clear that is of no interest.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad .. Not Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: blkdyltf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the HGVC in October 2011. The one bedroom suite was large with a full kitchen and a washer/dryer. The layout of the suite was nice and the bathroom was large with a walk-in shower, there a spa sized tub (which did not have a whirlpool jet) in an alcove in the bedroom. The decor in the suite was a little less than what you would expect from a Hilton hotel and was rather outdated. Worse I felt the sofa and chairs to be uncomfortable, and the bed to be too soft and saggy. Yet the staff in the hotel were pleasant and helpful. Housekeeping was excellent, the maid did a terrific job. As some posters have mentioned the walls apparently are thin as you can hear people in the next room. Twice I was awaken by the loud sounds of my neighbors making love (..I guess it is true that Las Vegas is the honeymoon capital of the country.) Still I would likely stay here again, if I could not get a nicer hotel at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good property but watch the time share pitch!”
Reviews.Author: BiztravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: A good value property on the strip although a little away from the action. Pool area very good, with free BBQs and various whirlpools. Studio room was fine although small. Low noise factor at night as mainly families and older folks staying. I had to ring a few times to get my HHonors benefits, and follow up on the points after the stay. Please bear in mind for those outside the US that this is a time share property, thus many people coming and going to see 'presentations' - and we received 3 separate telephone messages encouraging us to pick up 'our welcome gift' and to 'inquire about a vacation plan' which was annoying given we were fully paid guests and HHonors Diamond VIPs. Rather than using the more expensive 'Marketplace' Deli downstairs, go next door to CVS pharmacy where you can buy food, wine/beer, souvineers, sandwiches etc - usually about 50 - 70% cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton GVS”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasBride_1015
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Check in and check out were a breeze! No pressure to join timeshare and full kitchen complete with utensils and cooking necessities. Washer and dryer in room, even though we didn't use them for our weekend trip, it was a nice amenity. Family friendly with no casino and non-smoking rooms. The jacuzzi tub was a huge hit with our 5 year old. Water pressure in shower wasn't wonderful and the toilet made running noises, but with 2 doors to close the bathroom, the noise was remedied and not heard throughout the room. The pillows left something to be desired. The room really does accommodate a max of 4, but that's exactly what we had so it was great for us. We had to call downstairs for towels and bedding for the couch bed and HGVS was quick and attentive! The "gift shop" had way more than I had expected- freezer foods/contact lens cases with solution/ half gallons of milk/ and delis for cook to order warm meals. It was quite a way from the actual "strip" and is the number one reason to rent a car when staying there. Lesson learned! Not surrounded by a lot other than construction, so reason #2 to rent a car without having to walk through that. The temp control was not unified throughout the room... the kitchen/living room/sofa bed room was warm, the bedroom and bathroom were cold and vice versa. Tip- call down for extra blankets to help offset.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: hotwog4all
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip in September. Being that it was a Hilton I was impressed with the grand drive in and undercover area, the lobby/foyer area, and how everything was set up in there. There is a separate area for check in, concierge, and tour desk. This way you don't have to wait behind 10 people checking in to get information regarding tours or ask the concierge to arrange something for you. I was in one of the 1 bedroom suites, which is quite large and has all the amenities you would need to be at home away from home. The kitchen is roomy and has a full size refrigerator, hidden washer/dryer combo in the kitchen as well. This leads on to the dining area and lounge. It is designed for no more than 4 people and would be quite suitable for 4 people on holidays. The bathrooms are quite large and the bath tub which is large enough to have to "regular" sized people sitting in it side by side is in an "annex" type room between the bathroom and bedroom, and is open enough to be viewed from the bedroom and v.v. - now this can have many connotations attached to it but we don't need to go there! Now, as I was there for a work related trip, I had the opportunity to view other rooms and I viewed the newly renovated rooms as well. The decor in these is quite a bit more modern, the bath tubs are also jacuzzi style as well as opposed to a soaking tub. Amenities in the hotel are not to be missed. Below the foyer is the cafe where you can pick up a breakfast sandwich for $7 - basically what you would have for breakfast on a plate but in a sandwich - very good idea and you don't have to sit there and eat but you can go back to your room with it. Just outside of this is the gym which is quite a large set up as well - plenty of equipment to choose from and open almost 24 hours a day. Behind the gym is a long hall way which leads to the lifts down one, and the day spa along the rest at the end in the most quiet of areas. Across from the lifts is the door/exit to the pool area. I am a fan of lounging by the pool and this was amazing - lots of deck chairs, a bar that also serves food, and all can be charged back to your room. I am not a fan of staying at one place more than once, but will consider HGVS again in about 10 trips to Vegas and staying at another 10 different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Peterkawaa
Reviews.Content: pool was excellent lots of room, the lites in the room were dim and confusing, great work out room and t.V lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Handicap room had excellent features!”
Reviews.Author: mumsie2u
Reviews.Content: We reserved a wheelchair accessible room at this property in Tower 1 and found it to have excellent and easy to use features for someone confined to a wheelchair. This room was a 1 bedroom unit with a fully equipped kitchen, living room, dining table, seperate bedroom with King bed and a roll in shower with a shower stool to transfer to. Mirror in the bathroom was low enough to see from my chair. Closet bar was low and could be easily reached. This was one of the few roll in showers where water didn't splash out all over the place during the shower. There was a security peep hole in the lower position in the door to the main hallway. The only real challenge was that the door was very heavy and we needed help with it every time. At this hotel, the handicap rooms do not have a washer and dryer. That is the only thing I would say is a real negative. Handicap folks also like to wash their clothes!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families. Not a great location unfortunately.”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerKK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bed suite, they do not have rollaways so we had to get creative to make the kids beds as we didn't want them sleeping in the lounge area, as it defeated the purpose of the living space. We managed though. The location feels remote & a bit dodgy. It's basically the last hotel on the strip just before stratosphere and we didn't feel comfortable walking the area at night, or even in the day with the kids. Esp on the Riveria side of the road. Just walking from the hotel to circus circus was fine though. We usually started the night there with a few drinks and got a taxi to the Bellagio area, which cost between $7-15 depending on traffic. It's hard to say how I feel about this property. The location is a major let down but it's clean large rooms and super friendly staff might make it worth a look again. With kids & a car it made it ok for us. For travelers without a car I'd probably give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great place ! Too far from the action.”
Reviews.Author: CruzinRob
Reviews.Content: Great clean very nice place. A little bit of a hike from the action on the strip. It's not close and you will need to take a cab or bus. Cvs next door is great to pick up groceries liquor etc. Rooms are real nice. We had a 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen. Excellent pool and fitness facilities. We did the time share condo thing which was a bit of a pain in the butt. Just say no if your not interested and it's all good after that. It was real nice actually not having a casino in the hotel. No noise or smoking which was Great. Check it out if you are in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Plus and Minus Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: pauljames403
Reviews.Content: Invited to Vegas wedding so looked to save a buck on accomodations for a somewhat unplanned Vegas trip. Since the wedding was on the weekend I knew that while you can find some decent midweek deals,the traditional casino/resorts can be expensive for a Friday or Saturday. As regular Hilton traveler I had accumulated quite a few points so decided to spend them on this trip. Ended up wanting to stay a few post wedding days as well, so booked 5 nights at the Hilton LV Grand Vacation Club.This is a fine property with more plus than minus, but I will try to lay out both in fairness to the hotel, but also in fairness to my fellow TA travellers. First the location, as this is often front and center for Vegas visiters. The property is on the strip, but a long way down, almost to the Stratosphere. If you are without a car, this could be an issue. Walking down to the high traffic areas like the Wynn/Encore/Fashion Mall would be a hike. Probably at least 20-30 minutes. Down to the Ceasers/Flamingo/Bellagio another 15. There is a bus stop right outside however, and you can get a daily pass for $7, but somehow getting all dressed up to go to dinner and a show, and then taking the bus doesn't cut it. If you have a car this is no issue. We were at MGM, Planet Hollywood, and Ceasers within a few minutes, and parking is free at the casinos. Worth a mention here that parking is not free at the Hilton GVC. $8 a day for self park, $13 for valet. Add a dollar or two for a tip each time you get your car as well. Not mandatory, but it's the right thing to do. I didn't tip leaving the car, just on pick up. I would highly recomend the valet service. The self park garage is fairly close, but back and forth would be a pain. It was great to just pull up to the front door and leave the car. Further, the valet crew was above excellent. Never waited more than 5-6 minutes for the car and they were always pleasent and professional. This goes for the entire staff as well. Front desk, pool, housekeeping, concierge, everyone was very friendly, very helpful, and professional. Security was also friendly and plentiful. In, fact I was surprised at the level of security. I have stayed at a number of strip resorts and found more security here than anywhere. At the door every night, in the hallways at random times, on the elevator, all over, and they were also very friendly and helpfull to guests. As far as the hotel itself goes, we had a studio king and while very nice, it was a hotel room, not a vegas suite. This is not the Hilton's fault as it was exactly as advertised, however it left me a little wanting for the Vegas magic and I wanted to point this out. They have 1 bedroom suites which I saw, and they were huge, with seperate living room/bedroom. Pay the extra, it wasn't much, I would have but they were fulll the first two nights and we did not feel like moving after that. I should have done more research and pre planned. That is why I mention it here. There is also no casino here, (which I knew) and that also kinda takes away from the Vegas feel. We have done Vegas a bunch of times so not a huge deal, however I would recommend something else for first timers maybe. Final point on the rooms, don't take my comments as a negative on the room itself, it was fine. Clean, great bed, modern flat screen, even had a fridge and m/wave. One more point on the hotel is the pool. Nice size, lots of area for sunning and swimming, several hot tub/jacuzzis, and a pool bar/restaurent. Drinks and light snacks (burgers, nachos, chick fingers) were very good and quite reasonably priced. (was surprised at the prices here). If you are a sun lover, plan on the afternoon rather than morning as that is when the sun hits the pool area. Final point on the property would be that this is one of Hilton's "Vacation Clubs" .... which is code for time share....I got absolute zero presure to sit in on a TS sell. Yes I was asked at check in, and the girl took all of about two minutes to tell me what I could get by attending, and then said thank you when I said no. Don't worry about this aspect, they were not high presure on that at all. (Maybe if you take it they are...don't know bout that) Overall, a great hotel and I would highly recommend, but take into account the location and lack of "vegas" type ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis at the end of the busy Strip”
Reviews.Author: whetstoneview
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from all the big themed hotels and has no casino. It is great to get away from all the crowds of the huge hotels on the Southern end of the Strip. Check-in was slick and efficient. The hotel is modern,spotlessly clean and spacious. We were with friends and were allocated a suite with two separate bedrooms and a living area between them. Each room had king beds and one had a jacuzzi. The bathrooms were good, one had an excellent walk-in shower. Soap and shampoo were provided and replaced once during the week, along with a linen and towel change. Facilities were good with televisions in each room and very comfortable seating. Each room had coffee making facilities with a small supply of ground coffee. The crockery, glassware and cutlery were in short supply considering the fact there was a dishwasher which you were unable to fill before running out of equipment. There was a washing machine and tumble dryer with detergent supplied. We were on the 22nd floor and had a great view of the mountains outside Las Vegas. The gym is well-equipped and modern. There is also an attracttive outside swimming pool with a cafe. The Marketplace had a small deli and shop which were a little expensive but convenient. There is a CVS pharmacy nearby which had a good stock of groceries and alcohol at reasonable prices. Fresh food was in small supply making it difficult to cook in the apartment.We also used Wahlgreen's which was a little further away but had a wider choice and was even cheaper. We had breakfast at Denny's which was about a ten minute walk away and this set us up for the day. Eating out can be as expensive as you want. There are food courts in a few of the hotels where you can choose from Chinese, Italian, burgers etc and eat very cheaply.We used the Venetian which had a good selection of cuisine. It is possible to walk the length of the Strip but it takes quite a long time. However, you're on holiday, and there is a lot to see en route! Taxis are readily available as well as the Deuce bus and the monorail. The nearest casinos are at Circus Circus and the Riviera but they are both quite old and a little tired. The Downtown area is in need of a new lease of life as some buildings have been removed and the infrastructure is limited. The Stratasphere is,quite literally,a beacon of glitz and glamour this end of the Strip. The two towers of HGV also add a golden sheen to the skyline. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel if you wish to have a little distance from the hectic and more crowded part of this singular city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great People”
Reviews.Author: RobMurphy19
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the HGV except the ready access to a restaurant in the Hotel. We did attempt to eat at the pool cabana, but it was windy and just to cold to sit out there. Would recommend for the accomadations and facilities, but we got tired of ordering from the Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST SPOTLESS PROPERTY; CONVENIENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: motorcitymike53
Reviews.Content: Checked in Wednesday night and stayed until Sunday AM. The hotel is 2 towers with a round, two story lobby that is conected to both. Everything is located in the round lobby including access to parking, a well stocked store, an activity lounge including wide screen, pool and ping pong table; Fitness center, front desk and concierge. The room was spotless and modern. Even the comode was quiet when flushed.The staff was friendly and professional. The maditory timeshare presentation was cordial and we were out the door with our promised "gifts" at 90 minutes on the dot. The parking is a bit funky with the first 5 floors as valet; so you can get dizzy going past all those empty reserved spaces. Also the location is near construction and the begining of the "older" area of the north strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Service”
Reviews.Author: plncpa
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at both of the other Hilton Grand Vacation Properties in Las Vegas and liked this one as much as the other two. The service at check-in was great and they went out of their way to accommodate our special request. We were trading our timeshare week and wanted to stay one day additional on each end of our week. We didn't want to change units so they got us into the same unit for our entire stay. I've read other tripadvisor reviews that said check-in was slow but we didn't encounter that. The rooms have a very similar layout to the HGV at the Las Vegas Hilton but are newer. We stayed in a two-bedroom suite with two separate bedroom units each of which has a king-size bed, one has an in-room jacuzzi, large shower and bathroom area with a full kitchen, dining area (accomodates 4), living room area with TV and pull-out couch inbetween the two bedroom units. The pool area is very nice with cabanna's, restaurant, wait-staff, etc. The service was top-notch throughout our entire stay. There are a lot of children out at the pool area but overall it was a good time. We like to walk in Vegas so it wasn't an issue for us but the couple with whom we were staying found the location inconvenient. The closest larger casino is Circus Circus and if you want to go any further it's a cab or bus-ride. There is a CVS Pharmacy and another gift/sundries shop about a block or 2 blocks away where the prices are much less than the on-site deli/sundries shop. However, the on-site shop is very convenient and we got good service there. I did have a pedicure and manicure at the spa. It was nice and less expensive than the Encore but I'd go to the Encore again versus revisiting this site. Just got a little more pampering and the actual spa was more all-inclusive at the Encore - steam room/sauna, cold plunge pools, etc. Overall, very nice property and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: sweetttea33
Reviews.Content: I must say that the property itself is very nice. We had a one bedroom kingsize suite with a queen pullout sofa which was cool for my group size of five. The gym was great but got crowded in the early am hours. I didn't use any of the other facilities but everything appeared to be well kept. The location isn't desirable if u are looking to be in the heart of the action but there is a bus stop out front which will take u where u want to go. It's also next door to a CVS which I was at 3 out of the 5 days I was there. A McDonalds is close by as well and I have never eaten so much Mickey D's in my life but it was less expensive than the hotel food. Overall, I would only stay here if I wanted to be in an environment of calmness away from the excitement but why come to Vegas??

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, awesome amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Haley B
Reviews.Content: The suites are very nice- marble counters, mini fridge, microwave, etc. The pool was great and had a wet bar. It was nice being able to order food from downstairs. We got a pizza with lobster that was pretty good. The only con is that it's pretty far down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Big and busy”
Reviews.Author: KSB462
Reviews.Content: Big and bussling. Works well for Las Vegas despite being towards the northern end of The Strip and away from the central glam locations. Tourist bus service (Deuce) at the front gate so very convenient for travel up and down town. Good parking facility - self rather than valet recommended. The latter takes too long and is more expensive especially when you add on the tips required! Watch out for the Welcome Desk - they may try to rope you in to a suite time-share selling session. There was a small demonstation outside when we stayed alleging purchase was cheaper via the web.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect:)”
Reviews.Author: Purplewitch83
Reviews.Content: POSITIVE • a family hotel • room was great. Spacious and complete (kitchen, laundry.. You name it!) • free wifi service was excellent • staff were friendly and helpful • away from chaos indeed • big bathroom • love the pool and the jacuzzi in the room • nice amenities, generally • worth the price    NEGATIVE • no free breakfast • I found a used utensil in the couch • no shuttles so make sure you shelve a few bucks for taxis (beware of unscrupulous taxi drivers! Ours insisted that there was only 1 hilton in Vegas so he can go around and earn more!)

Reviews.Title: “nice room but needs a nice resturant on site”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very nice and you are able to cook if you have the basics, but this property needs a nice resturant especially for breakfast. The pool grill is fine for a bite in the afternoon or evening, but the breakfast selection is poor. The pool area is nice and the rooms are comfortable. It's a little bit of a hike to the main strip so be prepared to walk a few miles or pay for a cab to get down to the main area of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Tower One”
Reviews.Author: MAPTraveler2
Reviews.Content: The facility is decent, and clean with a nice fitness gym. The pool area is small for the number of rooms in the building. The to go breakfast plate is not much better than McDonalds. The Starbucks Coffee is good. The to go dessert selection looked great. The "king size suite" had a microwave/refrigerator/sink ktchen area which is nice to save some food $ or keep some snacks close, however the room was actually a room smaller than some of the standard rooms I've stayed at other hotels. The bed was very comfortable, and Tower One had a refreshed, and pretty decor. Beware of the orange scent that might be used in the room; it's cause for watery eyes and headache. The facility is at the far end of the Strip, and daytime views aren't worth looking.

Reviews.Title: “Still Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristLady
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel and I still love it. The room is a good size and having a separate living room from the bedroom lets me sleep in while my husband has his morning coffee and catches up on the news. I love the full kitchen and the washer/dryer. We again rented a car and this time we used our GPS to find a grocery store. We bought breakfast items, snacks and a bottle of rye. This way we were able to relax in the morning and have breakfast while we planned our day. After a night on the town we would relax in the room with a drink. Valet parking is $13 a night and self parking is $8. We chose the valet and let the staff do the work of moving our car about. Well worth the extra $5 a night. After a long day just pull up, hand the valet your keys, then go off to your room and relax. The pool area is very nice. I spent my last day there swimming and reading at the pool. They have a restaurant/bar at the pool which, while not cheap, was still very enjoyable. Small issues - the maid ran the dishwasher when it only had 2 mugs, 2 spoons and 2 bowls in it. I found that a waste especially in light of it being a "green" building. I left notes after that stating I would wash the dishes by hand. Also, there weren't any recycling bins which surprized me since I'm used to seeing them everywhere. They have a coffee maker in the room and provide coffee, but nothing for a tea drinker. I brought my own tea bags but without a kettle I just boiled the water in a saucepan and then poured it into my mug. Not elegant but effective. If I'm ever back in Vegas, this is the first hotel I will look up.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but way down the strip”
Reviews.Author: LinlithgowTravelscot
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the other two properties in Las Vegas , I decided to try this one (mainly due to the Falmingo price being over $1000 for the same dates !) . The room , a one bedroomed suite in tower 2 was absolutely fine and I found the staff to be on the whole friendly and attentive . I had occasion to deal directly with the manager and he was extremely helpful . There were some staff at the front desk , who appeared to be purely involved with the timeshare aspects and clients ( end of desk on the right) - they were less helpful and certainly not interested in answering minor queries . The pool area is very nice , the biggest of the three properties in Vegas but can get very busy . However, the big drawback is as everyone has pointed out is the location . Since the closure of the Sahara Casino , its kind of in a wilderness unless you are prepared to walk or use a cab/ bus or drive to the nearest casinos . The closed off Sahara and the surrounding unfinished building sites tend to lend an air of desolation which is a shame considering the property itself is very nice. Whilst I was not bothered by the walking there were a fair number of down and outs using the Sahara as a place to congregate , which could worry some people . Just a suggestion (and I am not the first to state it ) why not provide a shuttle to one of the other Hilton properties - even a small charge and i think it would pay its way . Finally - to the Las Vegas city council - why not allow part of the Saharh to be used as a temporary proper shelter for the homless people until it can be sold on . It would improve the image of the whole area ?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but inconvenient location.”
Reviews.Author: patraveler0302
Reviews.Content: We were invited to stay at this location for a 2 night pkg to attend a "showcasing session to preview this Hilton property". In reality we later found out it was basically a timeshare-type pitch or as they call it, a "vacation ownership" offer. The location was easy to find and self-park was easy, but you had to pay a nightly fee to park the car there. The suite was clean, beautiful and very roomy. Very nice, fully-equipped kitchen with higher end cabinets & granite countertops as was the very pretty bathroom, which had a shower stall and oversized tub. The bed was very comfy. The lobby area and pool were also very nice. The location on S. Las Vegas Blvd. is kind of dumpy though and there is an abandoned, partially constructed resort & high rise across the street, and the location is far away from the nicer sections of the Strip, so a rental car is a must. We were not interested in purchasing a "vacation ownership" after sitting through 2 hours of presentation. It was then that the tone of the session quickly went from friendly & social to kind of pushy & rude even though we had been told from the beginning that they understand that not everyone will be interested in making the purchase.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and facilities are Great - Service is NOT”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Many option in Vegas. We opted for a 1 bedroom suite (less than $200 on a 1 night Saturday stay!) - The room was awesome! Well decroated, large, well equipped, great bathroom and "jacuzzi tub" . Truly could not ask for more for a room. The service is poor. Pool and dining options are terrible, slow and poor attitudes from the very start. The valet pull in area($13 day) unable to call ahead for your car- must present ticket to counter, inconvenient- however the staff here was pretty good (of course tipping is smart with this service) - Waiters by the grill and pool area- Very slow and rude. Waited 20 minutes without a hello or water! Then told by our server she would be a minute and we waited another 5 and moved to an open seat at the bar. The waiter/bartender was better if it werent for his terrible and slow kitchen holding him/us up! He had to ask for my order several times and 15 minutes after my partners came up! The check out staff- Bill is confusing, especially if presenting for corporate reimbursement- I asked for a copy showing only what was charged during my stay and she was not polite and not helpful even after waiting for a few minutes for her to re-do the bill. When she came back - she had presented me with the same darn paper she left with- with a smile! (Sarcastic and Rude!) Waste of time!! For an off strip, non gaming hotel that is among dozens of competitors you would think the staff would be better hired and trained. Certainly more polite. I really liked the room and its price. However the attitude of most of the staff will probably force me to look around before considering returning to this one...

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Rhondaroo23
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and new. Great pool area very pretty. Expect to spend $30- $50 per day for taxis's just to get over to the other Hilton and ride monorail to other casinos. Would like to see this Hilton to have shuttle to other Hilton property which has a casino and is a monorail stop. That would help save on $$$$ for taxis. Nice stay very freindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, away from the chaos but still on the strip”
Reviews.Author: JCSekhar74
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and both times I was very happy and impressed. They have excellent service, the hotel staff went out of their way. The rooms are very clean and I never heard people behaving in a rowdy or loud manner. It was very peaceful, the front of the hotel is not crowded like the rest of the hotels on the strip. This hotel is located on the south strip, so you can walk to all the casinos however this Hilton does not have a casino, which I think is why it is peaceful. The pool area is fabulous, they have many pools and hot tubs. Overall, this was a great vacation experience in Vegas and I would go back here again. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Papapaul-16
Reviews.Content: We are just back from our 6th trip to Vegas, we are owners at this HGVC so expect the best, it is now 7 years since we purchased so the place is starting to look a small bit worn but not enough to put us off going back, the rooms have lifted our expectations of what we are now looking for in a holiday, everything you would require is here fully fitted kitchen, washer/ dryer, Bose sound system if you take a RCA cable (male at one end and the twin fitting at the other) you can connect your Walkman / MP3 player to get wonderful sound in the appt, Twin Jacuzzi in the very large bedroom, dining table etc. there is a CVS right next door under the Sky building to stock up on breakfast / Beer as this keep your cost down and stops you putting on too much weight (except the Beer), the pool is very good although the monstrosity that is the Fountainblue stops you getting the sun prior to about 10am, if you get a lounger at the right hand side next to the large Jacuzzi you get the sun from about 11am right through to 6pm, and it is a bit quieter than round the pool. All in a good place to goo no casino and no bar if the pool is shut so a lot quieter than some of the hotels which suits us just fine.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a really clean hotel, this is the one for you!”
Reviews.Author: LefthandedLucy
Reviews.Content: The entire facility sparkles. I never saw even one insect the whole week we were there. The pool is clear as well. It is located at the end of the strip, but is still in walking distance of the loud, smokey hotels with gambling up the strip. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom, full kitchen with living room and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place-lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: intrigueace
Reviews.Content: I recently went to this property because I was offered a really nice deal after staying in another Hilton property. The catch was I had to attend a time-share presentation, which turned out fine and I actually ended up buying one. I had a one bedroom suite with a friend and it was fabulous. Beautiful room, kitchen that was bigger than mine at home. Bathroom was really spacious. We were right next to the elevator which we thought would be a problem, but it was completely fine. The property is at the tail end of the strip but the bus was only $7 for the whole day and it was completely fine. We would just take it to the Wynn and walk the rest of the way. There was a CVS right next to the hotel which was a lot cheaper than the store inside the property. The only issue with this hotel was all the kids. Why anyone in their right mind would take a child to Vegas is beyond me. But the hotel almost catered to all the children. We couldn't even sit out by the pool because there were so many kids running around. I would likely not stay at this property again just because there's much sexier properties in the heart of the strip. But for the value of this property and the fact that I did end up buying a timeshare, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the end of the Strip, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: HeritageSoftail14843
Reviews.Content: This was at least the 10th time I have stayed at this location since it was built. The rooms are nice and suites have full kitchens, separate sitting room/dining room, and are extremely spacious. Paying for parking is relatively new, and most hotels in Vegas do not charge to park, but other than that I always enjoy staying here. The pool is large and you can usually find a place to lay by the pool with little effort.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MustaphaEido
Reviews.Content: after long travel i arrived to this hotel and stayed there in one night . i had a room with a kitchenette , it was a very clean and nice room overlooking the Vegas strip on the 32 floor . I loved my room and the air condition was perfect , the hotel staff were friendly and helpful and they also gave me a booklet of coupons ( which I didn't use ) . The hotel is elegant and in a quiet area in the hectic Vegas .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jo Ann W
Reviews.Content: This Hilton property was very nice. We had a 1br unit and it was spacious with a full kitchen and livingroom with a queen sofa bed. The staff was very friendly. The walk to the garage was not very convenient and definitely should be covered. There was only a cafe onsite, so you had to leave the hotel for a meal. The hotel location is at the end of the strip, but that didn't really bother us. Also, there is no casino onsite. The pool area was nice and the bar was busy but the drinks were good! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but a bit out of the way on the location.”
Reviews.Author: rcw198
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and all the staff I encountered were very friendly. My only problem is that while it is on the strip, it is at the far end of all the action. It is also surrounded by a few very large construction sites that have been abandoned. This has you walking through an area that is a bit less than desirable when heading to where the action is. Also depending on your room the view will be quite dismal. It is really a shame that this beautiful hotel is in the location that it is slightly off the beaten path and surrounded by such blight. As for the value I really can't speak of this due to having received my accommodations with reward points.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: kofekat
Reviews.Content: Pros - Rooms are beautiful, clean & well decorated. The kitchen in the 1 bdrm is wonderful. The staff is friendly & efficient. Cons - Water pressure is ridiculously low. Takes 1/2 hour to rinse your hair. No covered walkway between the parking garage & the hotel. Not good when it is 115 degrees outside or pouring rain. Pretty far north on the strip. No walking to the main attractions & no hotel shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel. End of the strip. Concierge desk outsourced and not helpful”
Reviews.Author: NH_Road_Warrior_01
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful 2-bedroom suite (1 bedroom suite connected to a separate hotel room with the door in the middle). Nice, large family room, comfortable king beds, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, tvs in each room. We stayed for 3 nights over the Labor day weekend (Thurs - Sun). The concierge desk was abysmal though and simply couldn't help out. We made a tee time with them (after waiting in line for 45 minutes). We were then told to come back to get the confirmation.
