Well, later, after waiting again, they didn't have one. They then said they would leave it at the Front desk. Later that night, we went to the front desk to pick it up. Of course, they had nothing there. Since our tee time was going to require us to leave prior to the concierge desk being open (8 AM - 8 PM), we were a bit irritated. But, the front desk manager for the evening shift (Greg) saved the day by telling us he'd leave a message on our phone the next AM. At 5:40 AM, he was able to contact the course and get us a tee time. Apparently, the concierge never made the reservation, but had charged my card. Greg should be applauded for his attentiveness. We later found out that their concierge service is some outsourced group. So, we can't blame that on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there before, wll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Ana R
Reviews.Content: We had a family event in Las Vegas and we chose the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites because they have one bedrooms. The are very nice, with a full-size kitchen, washer and dryer and a jacuzzi tub. It is very clean. The only negative is that you have to pay to self park whereas other hotels in Las Vegas do not charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: theneecesDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay that included Labor Day weekend. The accomodations are ok - we had a 2 BR unit as we had friends join us for part of the stay. I will start by saying that the prices at this hotel are over the top - $5.50 for a beer in a can at the pool - $6.95 for a gallon of water --take a short walk to the CVS next door and buy what you need - water was $1.99 there. It's just too expensive at the resort. I'm not opposed to paying for things when on vacation, but I found this to be worse that NYC prices. Maybe that's the norm, but it seemed a little excessive. It was too hot to walk far - so be prepared to have lots of money for cabs...or you can take the bus, but that's even gone up - $7 for a 24 hour pass. We utilized the bus a couple of times to go to Freemont Street and found they had plenty of room though, not as crowded as past visits. If you like to get out and walk to various casinos and restaurants, this is not your place. I would stay somewhere more convenient if you do not have a car. As I said before, the rooms were clean and had plenty of room --found the staff to be friendly and helpful. They had a shuttle bus sitting there at the resort, but this is only to pick up/return visitors coming to/from the timeshare presentations - they should offer this to guests- to at least take them to the other Hilton to catch the monorail. Apparently, if you aren't looking at a timeshare, you are not a priority. I will not stay here again, simply due to the poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with honest employees”
Reviews.Author: jgtaylor_11
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay but not quite as top quality as I was expecting. However, my husband left a bottle of medication and it was turned in by housekeeping and mailed to us. We didnt think we'd see it again. They should be very proud of their employees, any other hotel and he never would of seen his pills again.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we own now.”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworld32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because they offered us a great deal. We just got married and never thought about buying a "timeshare" This was so different. We love to travel and making this purchase really made sense to us. Can't wait to take our first trip as owners and stay in Hawaii. As far as the property, everything was great. The pool was nice and we loved having the kitchen to keep our beer and wine cold. The spa is amazing too. Everyone working there was really nice. Especially the girl that sold our ownership to us. She was very patient with our questions and we never felt pressured. We definitely plan to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and a Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: InFreqTrav_mkg
Reviews.Content: Had a delightful stay at the HGVC on the Strip. This was the North most hotel on the Strip. With kids, we needed a non-casino property which was kid friendly and this was just that. Clean rooms, great staff. They walked us through with the options for entertainment, told us about the mode of transport to use. They were not at all pushy and open. Would love to go back to a HGVC property The feedback on TripAdvisor were very helpful and steered us towards this property.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Going to Vegas with Dad - Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: jgmiller
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip with my dad to vegas and this place did not dissapoint. My dad has a timeshare with club intrawest so we were able to get a one bedroom accomodation using his points. There was a king in the bedroom and a pullout Queen sofa (very comfortable for a pullout!) We stayed here for two nights for Labor Day weekend and I enjoyed my stay thoroughly! The rooms were clean with nice accomodations. This is a great place if you want to stay in a nice place and not be surrounded by the Vegas craziness for the entirety of your stay. The market was reasonably priced for a Vegas resort and the pool/spa accomodations were nice as well. The staff was great and was very helpful throughout the stay. The location is a bit on the northern end of the strip, but walking to the middle of the strip is not too bad. Overall, I was very pleased with this resort and would recommend it for people who want to be on the strip but maybe not have a casino on site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: GotuwanPankshin
Reviews.Content: A true luxury experience. This was my first time at the HGVS. On arrival, checking in was slow, but the charm of the front desk staff made you so welcome. My suite was very nice, new appliances, the beds were so comfy, I loved the Jacuzzi. If you have a famly and looking for a nice quite place for a great vacation in vagas and still be on the strip?, this is it (No slot machines and a strictly non smoking facility. The pool is amazing, really huge, I loved the poolside bar, so relaxing in the evening. Now for the downer, they do not offer a complimentary breakfast, even for Diamond members (Most hotels in Vegas are practically throwing meals at you just to get you in the door), I stayed for 3 nights 30th AUG 11 - 2nd Sept 11 and I could swear house keeping did not clean my room. They will make the bed and replace towels but that was it, How did I know? I dropped a twix wrapper by the work desk and it was there till I checked out, they never replaced the coffee in the room and I had to call guest services to have them bring some up. Valet service was quite reasonable, 5 mins max wait time, you cannot call ahead to have you car pulled out before you get down. Aside all that, this is truely a home away from home. will surely be back with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Timeshare Property”
Reviews.Author: BT-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton for 1 week, Aug 20-27 in a 2 bedroom suite. Tried to check in at 2pm but room was not available...came back at 4:30pm and had no problem checking in. There are two towers, asked for new tower 2, no problem...on 11th floor facing Las Vegas blvd. Good security, need key card to enter building and use the elevators. Used RCI exchange, so parking was free in parking garage, otherwise $8 self-park, $13 valet per day. Free wifi was an added bonus and it was property wide. Staff at hotel very polite, professional and friendly...made you feel welcome. Our unit had fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, living room, shower with separate soaking tub (tower 1 units have a jacuzzi tub...or so am told), King size bed and pull out sofa, 2 flat screen tvs. Second bedroom was like a regular hotel studio room with mini bar, microwave, flat screen tv...full bath...high quality towels and bath amenities. Air conditioning in both rooms worked well. Minor pet peeves: mildewy smell from the shower stall possible due to no vent in the bathroom, not enough coffee packs (although if you find a housekeeping maid, she will give you extra if you ask) and some provision of salt and pepper packs would have been nice. Amenities of the hotel/timeshare property were quite nice...3 hot tubs, heated..a spa, an activities room, deli (way overpriced), 2 pool sections, unlimited pool towels by the pool, water misters during hot days, private cabanas for rent...separate smoking area...barbeques available for those so inclined, food and bar service with bathrooms right at pool area... This is an excellent property for family's with children...no on-site casino...away from the noise and traffic (although there was a bit of construction on Las Vegas Blvd in front of the hotel entrance) and not too many drunk kids running around. It is located just north of Circus Circus. There is a MacDonalds restaurant and CVS nearby which was appreciated, Would recommend to everyone...good value for the money and nice all round resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Hilton Grand Vacations on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Insatiable Nomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights before moving to a hotel on the strip. Check in was seamless, the room was spotless, and the beds were so comfy. The staff were pleasant and happy to help with any request. On the afternoon of day 1 they called our room to see if there was anything that they could do to make our stay more enjoyable. Very nice touch. I didn't need anything but I know that if I had asked for something they would have fulfilled it. The pool area is lovely with options for both sun and shade. The marketplace is convenient and open late - with enough variety to suit most any taste. I appreciated being able to buy a bottle of wine or a case of beer as well. The fact that the property is located at the far end of the strip was not a concern, in and of itself, we booked with the full knowledge that we would either be taking the bus or walking a long distance. The only down side is that there is a large dead spot of undeveloped property between the Hilton and the the strip and we did not feel safe walking there at night. Too bad because we like to walk in the evening when the temperature cools down. Note that check out time is 10am which is earlier than we would prefer. Most places are 11am or noon so would like to see Hilton consider this for the future. In summary, we liked the property and would recommend it - just go in with realistic expecations. It is a healthy walk to the strip and there is no restaurant. If these things are OK by you, then you will have a lovely stay. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice retreat away from the casino noise”
Reviews.Author: MissBette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC this week and after reading reviews, on this site & others, I was a bit nervous about our choice for accomodations. Some posts mentioned an expensive cab ride to the strip hotels. This was not the case. This resort is located just north of the Riveria and south of the Stratosphere, so it is conveniently located along the bus route. We purchased a 24 hour bus pass for $7 which allowed us unlimited on & off stops. I am told that a 3 day pass may also be purchased, but we didn't need one, so I never checked. Also, along with the strip, the same bus system will take riders to downtown (Fremont Street) and the north & south Las Vegas outlet malls. As to the resort, it is a typical Hilton property. Our room was a studio, rents for $89/nightly and had mini kitchenette which included full size coffee maker, fridge, sink, & dishes. The room also had a flat screen tv and granite finishings in the bathroom & kitchenette area, king sized bed, desk, and chair & ottoman. I thought the price is accurate for the accomodations. The pool is great. Although there were many people there, we had plenty of lounge chairs, and space to feel comfortable. The pool area also provides grills for folks wanting that experience, and two families were "grilling" while we were there. This is a time-share property though, so make sure that you are not expecting a full service restaurant and bar. The food available is a deli & marketplace which others have described accurately, and a pub food & bar area around the pool. I had pizza from the deli & my husband had fish & chips from the pool bar area. Both were good. We purchased can beer from the marketplace and took it outside to the pool, this is a more economical way to enjoy adult beverages. While the sign posted said no outside alcohol, that must reference from other locations, because the marketplace staff said that we could do this and no one from the pool questions us. Beer at the marketplace was about the same as we find in our hometown liquor store. Staff is helpful and friendly. Check in time posted is 4pm, however, I called ahead and we were able to check in at 11am. Check out time is 10am, and the night before our check out I asked for an extension and was given until noon. No problems. Resort is extremely attentive to security. We had to show our room key, after 10pm before we could go inside the front door. I appreciate their attention to this. Also, room key had to be used for elevator access. Some have complained about noise from other rooms, or thin walls. Our room was very quiet. We heard a child crying once while walking down the hallway, but didn't hear any noise in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Important things missing for such a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Sibel D
Reviews.Content: The floor plan was nice, and the quality of the suite was good, but it was lacking in surprising ways. The stove top had not been cleaned well. It was a glass top, so it wouldn't have been hard to wipe it down. There was a little chunk of soap with a hair in it left in the soap cubby in the shower. They didn't cut the hole for the refrigerator large enough so you had to yank the door open and force it closed which had left a mark on the cabinet next to it. The lights took a while after you turned them on to actually get bright and they were very dim at first. The worst thing about it was the Katy Perry shower which couldn't decide if it was hot or cold or yes or no (good pressure or not). The pool wasn't very impressive, but the bar at the pool was very reasonable for being in Vegas. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not so nice”
Reviews.Author: dlabrake
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is pretty standard for Hilton Grand Vacation Clubs. It's nice, simple, friendly and clean. Check in was easy. I arrived at 9am and my room was ready. I checked into a studio room and within 5 minutes I could hear the baby next door crying through the walls. It was as if they were right there in the room with me the walls were so thin. The check in person was friendly and gave me a new room. I stayed 2 nights in the new room and then someone checked in next door to me. I could hear their tv as clear as if it was in my room. I asked to switch rooms again. They accommodated my request and this time gave me a one bedroom room. Finally, peace and quite...until late at night. You could hear everything that was going on in the hallway. There were teenagers/early 20's folks up and down the hallway for hours, laughing, and carrying on. Once again, the walls/doors proved to be paper thin. Although the rooms are well appointed and I love the decor, I would not stay at this property again. I spend about 50 nights a year in hotel rooms and within the past 12 months this has been the worst for noise. You would think that Hilton would have built the place with the highest level of materials available but I think they missed the boat on this property. I'm a HGVC member and I've stayed at many of their properties that were build with higher standards. If you want a good nights sleep and you don't want to hear noise all day and night, then select a different property.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without the price tag”
Reviews.Author: JenniferTelford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 14 year old son. We were so impressed with this hotel. We booked a suite. This was immaculate down to everything layed out in the kitchen drawers. Nice touches such as soap powder for the washing machine and the dish washer. The furnishings were lovely, comfortable bed and good air conditioning. The bathroom had a great large shower. The communal areas are just as nice with an art deco theme. We were asked to attend a presentation for time share but politely declined and was not hastled in any way what so ever. We did take a walk around the pool area which looked great but didn't really have opportunity to use thid facility as we had other plans. The choice of groceries is limited in the on site deli but they did sell the basics such as drinks, milk, cerials, snacks etc. They also serve pizza's, salads etc. All staff were helpful and friendly. This hotel is at the end of the strip near the stratosphere and has no casino, bar or restaurant. We chose this due to having our young son with us. There is a deuce bus stop directly outside the front of the hotel and runs the length of the strip every 15 minutes. After being amongst the hustle and bustle of the strip all day, this hotel was a welcome retreat. When i next visit Vegas i will certainly book this hotel again. We only had one issue. This was lack of bedding for the sofa bed, however this was soon rectified after contacting the front desk. To sum up, we all loved this place and didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Wedding and 7 Hotels in 14 days”
Reviews.Author: OzzieExplorer
Reviews.Content: Hotel 5 was Hilton Grand Vacations on the Strip. At the top of the strip but before Stratosphere this is more of a timeshare establishment. It did have it's advantages - like a laundry downstairs. Also, was a great break away from the casinos. Across the road from the partly built Fontainebleau. There is no getting around the fact that the top of the strip is less 'desirable' than the lower end but it was a good stay. Would I stay here again? Yes but not before Paris/Bellagio and Stratosphere (though it did have a laundry). Tip: Avoid the timeshare sales people. Casino - no Food - Cafe downstairs, McDonalds down the road. Hotels we stayed in were: MGM Grand Paris Stratosphere Bellagio Hilton on the Strip Luxor Venetian

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Condo!!!”
Reviews.Author: cybrjunkii
Reviews.Content: The condo was very nice. Very new and very clean. front desk was very helpful and pleasant and the condo had maid service every day! BONUS! The Starbucks downstairs was very good. The only complaint I had was once you checked in they hit you up to go to a sales pitch for the time share. And they was a little pushy and then wasn’t very nice once we said no but other then that our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accommodations and services but far from major strip sites”
Reviews.Author: slsvend
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two-bedroom suite for three days/nights. Very nice accommodations, but no housekeeping for the 3 days. Very nice pool area. Massage therapists were wonderful--very attentive and well-trained. Only down side--even though we walked a lot we still spent $$$ for numerous taxis since the resort is located at the far north end of the strip. Other than location, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a new level”
Reviews.Author: yummieats
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king-size bedroom suite. They have a nice full-kitchen with all the cook ware that you would need for a home-cooked meal. There is also a washer and dryer. The best part of it is the Jacuzzi in your room! Buy your own fragrance and take a dip every now and then! The living room is nicely furnished and decorated. The place feels like a clean and cozy apartment! I would recommend staying here if you're looking for something other than staying in the casino or scummy motels. If you can splurge a bit over 100/ night on hotel rooms... this is a great place to stay! You will feel safe, comfortable and relaxed =)

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to have a quiet Las Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: Breannlisa
Reviews.Content: First off, we had a 2 bedroom suite which was larger than my house. Full size appliances, fabulous kitchen, great to make coffee and food. The room was great. The pool was also very nice. Overall, the whole resort was great but it is at the end of the strip between the cess pool Circus Circus and Stratosphere. Make friends with the bus called the Deuce. This is also non-gaming which can be a blessing. Keep in mind the food options are pretty limited too with a pool bar and little deli/coffee spot. If you want some peace in Vegas, this is your spot, you can walk to the heart of the strip if needed. I would not recommend it if you are looking for the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirror74
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the HGV on Strip. Had one bedroom suite. Very roomy, very clean, with anemeties you could desire, including washer and dryer and full kitchen. Free high speed internet. All little things have been taken care for (for instance, there was washing powder waiting for us, all kitchen anemeties, etc). If you want to have your peace from other hotel-casinos, and still enyoj Vegas, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wrong location, not a real hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fredontheroad
Reviews.Content: not a real hotel: it has neither a restaurant nor a bar, except for one at the pool which is outdoors only and closes at 10 pm (this is Vegas, 100 plus degrees in summer and bars don't normally close that early). the pool, while nice-looking, clearly not big enough for the place, when we were there, it was completely filled with people. staff, for the most part, not friendly at all. concierges overworked, and it showed; ours was unable to get us a reservation for six at Benihana (also in a Vegas Hilton) and never left the promised voicemail in our room. we did it ourselves, with one phone call. they charge for self-parking, no hotel on the strip these days assesses this charge; we've tested this at Caesar's, Luxor, Mirage, Bellagio and Tropicana. worst, location is at the wrong end of the strip, nearby are only construction sites and one defunct casino, the Sahara. rooms are noisy (probably no insulation in the walls) and: attended a time-share sales presentation which was an experience in classic high-pressure sales tactics, with nothing whatsoever in writing, not even a business card from any of the three people trying to sell us a $120,000.00 share ( financed at an outrageous 17.5%)

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cathywildwest11
Reviews.Content: As owners in the Hilton Grand Vacation Club we were invited to stay 3 nights at the HGVC on the strip for a special pricing. We added and paid for 2 additional open season nights for a total of 5 nights. The check-in was long and it took us about 2 1/2 hours to finally get into a room. The first room they gave us they said was newly remodeled but it smelled so strongly of some cheap floral spray that we couldn't breathe. The second room smelled of smoke which they told us to hang out in till thy could find another. The final room was dirty floors had not been swept or mopped in God knows how long . The fridge was emoty but unclean also shredded cheese, ketsup spilled etc. Scary. We asked for a maid to come up but while wating I had to clean the refrigerator because I had to put away the items we brought with us. Nobody seemed to care. It is sad because the location is well enough away from the strip to relax but close enought to be in the activity if you want to be. The market downstairs in overpriced and so is CVS. There is an Albertsons to get more reasonable groceries if you have a car. Do you think for all we pay for membership that a water filter could be installed? We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious But Average Accomodations With Alot Of Sales Pitches”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsForever1
Reviews.Content: We are owners, having a two bedroom time share at this locale on the upper floors. The accomodations are quite spacious. They could not though be deemed "luxurious", but rather average "C+/B-". All of the necessities are in place and intact. However the space feels very hotellike and not at all homey. The furnishings feel sterile, of medium grade quality and staged. The views from every room are magnificent and having the capacity to cook a meal such as breakfast in your own space is terrific though. The minimarket on site is fantastic with a variety of choices that you can prepare yourself in the kitchen as well as prepared (and good) sandwiches etc. You can have breakfast delivered to your unit. It was a relief not to have the clanging and banging of a casino and multiple restaurants on site. Its great that they are located on the strip, however it is at the very far end and makes walking to the other major attractions on the strip quite a hike, nearly to the point of painful in summer. Despite already being owners, we received two phone calls prior to arrival wanting to set up a one hour "chat"/translate sales pitch. We already own! We politely informed them we needed simply a quiet and restful weekend and would prefer to be on our own. At check in we were asked again if we wanted to speak to a representative during our visit. What for? It was becoming slightly intrusive. Each day there was a message on our phone from staff asking what they "could do". We were certain they were more sales attempts. It became somewhat incessant particularly due to the fact that we already owned a share. All in all very spacious accomodations with great views. Average, sterile furnishings. At the far end of the strip. Great market onsite. Wonderful fully stocked kitchen. Overwhelming and intrusive attempts at sales "chats" when we simply wanted a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, worth the trip to the north end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: TexastoVegas
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation hotel location is just past Circus Circus, so not bad at all as far as the strip goes. This hotel is very nice, clean and quiet for the most part. I agree with other reviews the walls are way too thin, as you can hear people in the room next to you watching tv or listening to the radio whenever you happen to be in the room. THe noise from the motorcycles going up and down the strip was actually the worst. This really is the only complaint I have other than there is no vent in the bathroom. We stayed in Tower 1 in a suite overlooking the pool and we could see the sun setting in the west and Trump Tower in the distance. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have slept on in a hotel room & my spouse is 6' 3" and he had no trouble fitting in the bed; the entire room was spotless. Most people have said that you cannot get a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, which is not true at all. We paid for a round trip fee of $26.00 for 2 at the airport shuttle area (take the Gray Line shuttle) and were dropped off at the hotel lobby and picked up us as scheduled in the same spot. Just specify Hilton on the strip and it is on their list of hotels. We were actually the 2nd stop from the airport since they looped around the strip; they actually stopped at the other Hilton off the strip first. We also bought the Grayline Deuce pass for the strip for a 24-hour period ($7.00 per person, worth every penny--you can pay as you get on, just have exact cash) and the bus stops right in front of the hotel, Grand Hilton Vacations, or right next door at Turnberry Place, by the CVS. On return trip going north, you will have to stop across the street, but we just walked across at our stop. The Deuce does stop more than the other shuttle, but you want the Deuce for your stop here. Also, you never know when you might want to stop and get out and look around since there is so much to see at each stop and walking is so far between each stop. I would stay here again, but do not ever do it through a time share - the staff for the time share are pretty ruthless and make you feel really bad if you don't vacation much. We just got a good offer for the weekend and knew we would have to go to this. They are required to meet with you for 2 hours no matter what-- that's what are rep told us-- and since we do not travel very much at all, she got very short and mad with us for basically wasting her time. Be prepared for some ruthless young sales reps who will do and say anything for a sale. We were let go after 45 minutes, so we felt lucky to get out of there after that amount of time. I cannot believe that Hilton pressures this kind of sales behind their name, so just be careful when you accept a too good to be true offer.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure mixed with buisness”
Reviews.Author: DOWN-UNDER-JOE
Reviews.Content: very conveninent location with great service. Las vegas on a whole is a magical place to visit. rooms are quite spacious but i did not like the carpet. shower head is awesome and the view and on a whole good hotel. not right on the strip but away from the jungle of the lights. Great hotel because it distances itself from the noise and lights when you just want to relax at times. will stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: goingplaces58
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from the living room area of the one-bedroom we've rented for the last three nights. We leave tomorrow. Strengths--roomy, has in-room laundry facilities, internet access (though weak connection), two televisions. Weaknesses--in purported effort to 'go green' light fixtures have dim lighting (bathroom is actually a bit dark), no fan or vent in bathroom so all remains steamy and wet for hours after a shower, skimpy on housekeeping services (we had to wait until nearly 11pm to get sheets, blankets for the pull down sofa sleeper), one small "alley-like": entry, very aggressive marketing sales pitch for "renters" to buy into the vacation club, coffee shop and convenience store sells items at 3 to 4 times fair market prices, upholstery on sofa and living room chairs is old; urine stains on sofa bed mattress . Overall, we're disappointed and will definitely not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Room, We will definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Aurora6105
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, loved the room. Nice to have a small apartment like feel instead of hotel feel. Only complaint was my 17 year old son definitely did not like the hide a bed mattress. Too uncomfortable. He slept on the sofa instead, but still did not sleep well. Other than that everything was great. Staff was all very friendly. Everyone said hi with a smile. Service at the pool was awesome. We will definitely stay there again on our next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: PackerFanatic
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at this property in Las Vegas. The reviews we'd read were overall quite positive and we weren't disappointed. The one-bedroom suite we had was immaculately clean and very tastefully furnished. We traveled with 2 children, so having a full kitchen and washer/dryer in our unit was fabulous. Upon check-in, staff was friendly. Even though this is a time-share property, there was only one brief pitch made inviting us to a sales talk. I agree with other reviews that this property is a distance from most of the Strip action in Vegas, but the Deuce bus easily transports you down the Strip from a stop just outside the hotel. The atmosphere in the hotel is quiet--a nice break from the rest of the strip. The pool was extremely clean, nicely designed, and never crowded. For our wishes and needs, we couldn't have a chosen a better place to stay in Las Vegas. I'd definitely return to the Hilton Grand Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back to this property”
Reviews.Author: LauraGreiner
Reviews.Content: This property is supposed to be a secured property. We were in a 1 bedroom suite. The dishwasher leaked all over the kitchen floor. The toliet had to be flushed a minimum of 2 times after each use. You have to have a room key to get into the pool. We took our backpack to the pool that was full of water, room key & my husband's $300 RipCurl dive watch. While we were playing water volleyball, a guest stole our bag. We contacted hotel security. They refused to discuss the issue poolside. They didn't want anyone to know of the theft. They escorted us to our room with a new room key & had us search our room for the bag. We were treated like we were thiefs. We were told they would look at the security cameras & call us within the hour. I never heard from them. I had to contact them the next morning. I also had to contact housekeeping & check with the pool staff to make sure no one picked up the bag thinking we left it behind. The security officer told me there are no cameras in the pool area. However, there are cameras going in & out of the pool. He claimed their was no evidence of the bag entering or exiting the pool area. Well if they actually looked at the footage they would have seen the bag on my husband's back entering the pool. They did nothing but handle us. Then they tried to sell us a $42,000 timeshare with a $2000 a year maintenance fee. Needless to say the answer was NO! I will be hard pressed to stay at any Hilton property ever again after the treatment we received. I would NEVER stay at this property again. We stayed 2 nights at the Imperial Palace on the strip in a sweet & it was a lot better experience for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - away from the heart of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: D_Auterson
Reviews.Content: Excellent property with large, clean rooms and lots of amenities. Beware that the location is the SOUTH end of the strip. We took a taxi to the Mirage (not much -$10) which is the heart of most activities. If you want to be away from the craziness/crowds = great. If you need access + walking distance = pretty far. We found it just right.

Reviews.Title: “A Fair Place to Stay for Families”
Reviews.Author: niteflite
Reviews.Content: This property is located on las vegas blvd, aka the strip, but it's pretty much at the end, or even beyond the end of the strip. A walk to the heart of the strip is about 15 minutes which isn't so bad depending on your preference. There are two towers here, and it seemed like they are building another. Inside the building it's pretty basic. Amenity-wise not too much is offered. There is a small lounge with ping pong and a pool table. There's a little market selling some food and drinks and whatnot. The gym is medium sized and adequate. There is no indoor pool which is not so convenient when it is 110 degrees outside and the sun is scorching. The rooms were regular hilton fare. Philips flat screen tv, comfortable bed. The kitchen and appliances were modest, meaning no stainless steel. Service overall was okay at this hilton. One good thing being away from the action is that it's kind of quiet. there's also a CVS in the next building. Although there is no gambling here, you can walk over to circus circus or across the street to riviera. also since you're at the end of the strip you'd hit very little traffic driving to the supermarkets, route 15, and the off strip casinos and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the maddenings crowds!!! But still fun!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLake
Reviews.Content: This is a great place and away from the hub of Vegas! My husband and I spent 2 weeks here and just relaxed, enjoying a couple of shows, and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: BusyFamily_77
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas for a basketball tournament. We were invited to stay here with friends who have a timeshare at the resort. It was great to be able to come back to the suite, make some food and just relax. The property is very comfortable and the kids loved the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Get Away”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingMartins
Reviews.Content: We enjoy Las Vegas but don't enjoy the smoke and crowds in the casino hotels. The Hilton Grand Vacations Suites was excellent. Our condo type room was very clean and well appointed, looking out over the swimming pools. We had an amazing jetted tub and separate roomy shower. The workout room was very well equipped. Parking was easy. Our stay here made our entire Las Vegas experience delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Not really your Hilton environment.”
Reviews.Author: Cav0903
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a timeshare property with the Hilton name. Staff (all) very rude, unprofessional and not interested in meeting the needs of the guests. Concierge service is a joke. Front desk line always busy and housekeeping never responds. Hotel does not acknowledge or recognize the Hilton Medallion program and books award rooms at the most awkward and undesirable spots on the property. There is no restaurant on the property where guest can have a nice breakfast or dinner. The pool area is saturated with not your typical Hilton guest with heavy drinking, noise and obscene language. All signs of a timeshare property giving away free nights to anyone that will listen to their presentation. When back in Vegas, I will avoid this property at all costs. Additionally, the location is at the farthest end of the strip and the cost of transportation to and from the good spots on the strip will cost you a good penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility-Quiet Retreat by the Strip”
Reviews.Author: big9crab
Reviews.Content: The facility is excellent, very well maintained with all the amentities, located very close to everything and yet it was a quiet haven at the end of the day for parents and young adult child alike. The service was excellent, the people very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here”
Reviews.Author: jbidder
Reviews.Content: I love this property. I would have given it 5 stars but had a few minor run-ins during my last stay. However, the manager, Mike was great and I ended what started out as a rocky stay, on a high note. Always ask for renovated rooms when you stay here. Tower 1 currently has them. My issues this trip were: 1) Toilet had a "funny" odor when flushed 2) Thought I had bed bug bites - I did not and they were wonderful at checking the room with a device and removing all covering from the bed. It turns out that I had a heat rash. 3) I moved twice from the above and they offered me nothing. Well, I was moved to the top floor and they did fill out an incident report but I called back to tell them the bug bites were a false alarm. I am happy at how they handled the situation had it been. This is where I stay after a few days on the opposite end - Aria, Bellagio, NY NY, etc. I love to come here and rewind, go to the spa, wash my clothing and simply relax by enjoying the cable tv, spa tub and dvd player. I love this place and will visit whenever I am in Vegas. You often need a break from the dirty casino's and here you can enjoy a quiet trip, game room and work out if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wolfdenTexas
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas this summer and really enjoyed the Hilton Grand. Excellent location, the rooms where wonderful and the ammenities were great. The pool area was nice our two kids 11 and 14 really had fun at the pool and the game room area was perfect with all they needed to pass the time. We are looking forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Highly Reccommend”
Reviews.Author: Debbie-in-Florida
Reviews.Content: We were here 7/10-7/17, room 22404, a one-bedroom suite. Our check-in person was Kevin. He gave us great advice on getting around, where to shop, etc, as this was our first time in Vegas. We declined the time share presentation and he upped the incentives. When we still declined, that was that. No pressure. He was just as friendly and helpful after we said no. What a welcome difference from other time-share resorts. Room was immaculate. Decor was retro, not our taste, but very comfortable. Kitchen was large and well equipped. My only nit-picks were I lacked a pitcher, a colander ( I cooked) and covered containers to store food. Loved being able to launder our clothes as it meant we could bring less and not have to pay baggage fee to airline. The Market Place IS convenient and the deli is reasonable for a resort. However, if you plan to do any eating in, a small box of corn flakes is $7, a Swanson Pot Pie is $5. The CVS next door is somewhat cheaper but still more expensive that home (Miami area) If you want to stock up, take a cab to Albertsons, $8. TIP: WHEN YOU ARE DROPPED OFF, GET THE CABBIE'S PHONE NUMBER FOR YOUR RETURN TRIP AS CABS DON'T HANG OUT THERE. A bottle of rum we paid $26 for at CVS was $16 at Albertsons. We used the bus, the Deuce to get around. If you want to go south to the main strip, you catch the bus in front of Circus Circus to the right of the hotel. Returning, you get off at Circus Circus and use the push-button cross walk. If you want to go downtown, you go left, use the crosswalk, and catch it in front of the sadly closed Sahara. TIP: WE WENT DOWNTOWN TO THE FREEMONT STREET EXPERIENCE. IF YOU DO THIS, MAKE SURE YOU GET A DOUBLE DECKER DEUCE TO RETURN. WE GOT ON ONE OF THE SLEEK, SINGLE LEVEL BUSES AS IT WAS LABELED FOR THE SOUTH STRIP. INSTEAD OF TAKING US BACK TO THE HOTEL, WHICH HAS A SOUTH BOUND STOP RIGHT OUT RIGHT OUT FRONT, IT TOOK US TO PARADISE AND WE HAD TO WALK HOME IN THE DARK. There are deals everywhere on activites. The concierge was very nice and helful, but there should be extra staff there, we had to wait in line quite a while. You will be handed coupons on the street. Food and drink are cheap downtown, $2 beer, and the Freemont St. Casino advertizes a $7.95 prime rib. On the strip prices are much higher, some outrageous. You will need plenty of water. The convenience store by Circus Circus had 2 bottles for $1, and street vendors sell it for $1. I was desperate for water and paid $5 for a small bottle in a casino. Be prepared. We loved the pool, comfortable chairs, plenty of shade. The Waves Bar and Grill had very good food at reasonable prices, awesome hamburgers. Drinks are a little pricey. Service was excellent. In a one week stay, you get one free housecleaning, day four. This worked for us. We encountered the housekeepers, Marta and Rafaela in the hallways and they always asked if we needed anything. These friendly ladies kept us supplied with anything we needed, shampoo, paper towels, etc, with a smile. What others have said about the location is true, if you want to be in the heart of the action, go elsewhere. It is also true that there is an eysore of a failed construction site across the street. However, we preferred to be in an area that was not choked with crowds and noise. Our view was partially a parking lot but we could see the mountains in the distance and at night the lights were pretty, the lit-up Stratsophere was in view. If you have this view, watch carefully and you can see people bungee-jumping from the Stratosphere in the daytime. Our biggest gripe on this trip was the fact that on the main part of the strip, there are seemingly hundreds of people in orange T-shirts trying to hand out cards that tell you that you can have a "girl" come to you in 20 minutes for a price. There are also trucks that drive up and down the strip advertising this with illustration. Be warned if you are bringing curious kids. I think the city should stop this sleazy practice. ONE LAST TIP, THERE ARE 4 HILTONS IN LAS VEGAS. MAKE SURE YOU SPECIFY HILTON GRAND VACATION CLUB ON THE STRIP WHEN YOU ARE OUT AND ABOUT. In summary, we loved this hotel. Every single staff person we interacted with was outgoing and made us feel welcome. We compliment the management and reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Facility”
Reviews.Author: TomM55
Reviews.Content: Nice respite from the casino atmosphere; Marketplace Store was a great amenity for short and long term guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Family-Friendly Place on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: B_Pope
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3-night stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations (HGV) on the strip. We met friends there (a couple and their two kids) and had a great time! There are several things you need to know about the place, but they are not necessarily bad things. First, HGV is a vacation-rental club, somewhat like a timeshare. Our friends are members, so they got us in for a very good rate. Otherwise you can book on the usual hotel booking sites. Because we came in under our friends’ membership, we received a few extra perks that may not be generally available. And we were offered to attend a sales pitch, with the promise of a dining voucher good at a number of restaurants and buffets, but there was no pressure either to attend or to purchase. Everything was done very tastefully, and we used and appreciated the dining vouchers. I don’t know whether regular hotel guests are offered the sales pitch, but if they are I’m sure it’s not a requirement. It looked like everyone was treated with the same level of good service. You should also know that there are at least three Hilton Grand Vacations locations in Las Vegas, so be sure you correctly locate the one you booked. You should know, too, that this facility is non-smoking and non-gaming. We considered this to be a plus, since it made the location a calm, family-friendly oasis in the midst of the manic Las Vegas scene. The hotel’s amenities can best be described by taking you through our typical day. Sleeping in and waking up “whenever,” we would either watch television in our very comfortable bed, or open the curtains and gaze upon our northwest facing view (which included the Stratosphere tower). Once up we could either bathe in the deep tub between the bedroom and bathroom, or shower in the glass-enclosed stall. I would make coffee in the fully-equipped kitchen, and we would lounge in the spacious living room, reading, watching the other TV, or gazing at the view from there. One of the perks of the timeshare membership is a gold-member lounge offering coffee, juices, muffins, and breads in the mornings and snacks in the afternoons. Otherwise our 4-room suite’s kitchen had a full-size stove, refrigerator (with icemaker), and microwave for preparing breakfast or any other meal. Dishes, pans, and utensils are also provided. A dishwasher helps with cleanup. Before too long we would meet our friends and their kids at the pool. (Swimming in June in Las Vegas is best done in the morning, the afternoon being too hot.) The lovely pool, secluded from the nearby strip, had plenty of loungers in the sun and the shade, and dual 3-1/2 foot deep pools to cool off in. A bar offered drinks, appetizers, and lunch food at fairly reasonable prices. Several barbecue grills were available for use. We enjoyed napping in our suite in the afternoon, and going out in the evening. The 15-floor parking garage was available for self-parking (normally $8/day, but waived as part of our friends’ timeshare deal) or valet parking ($15/day). The garage is a short and pleasant enough walk from the hotel lobby, so retrieving the car each day was no problem. The tough part was remembering what level I parked on each time! Be sure to write yourself a note each time. After going out to eat and see the sights each evening, we always enjoyed returning to what we thought of as our little apartment. We could choose whether or not the cleaning staff would come in, and whether or not they would wash towels and linens, or leave them for the next day. All hotel staff, from front-desk check-in, to valet staff, to cleaning staff, were friendly and helpful. The extra touch is a dedicated hospitality person who helps with checking in and oversees the lounge, sometimes just simply providing good conversation and sightseeing advice. On the weekdays it was Barbara, and on the weekend it was Anne, two pleasant and caring ladies. We would (and likely will) return to the HGV when we are next in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “F A B U L O U S”
Reviews.Author: fabdiners
Reviews.Content: We swapped from the horrid HGVC at Flamingo and were delighted with the clean modern high standard accommodation offered. We had 4 fabulous nights there. It's a little further up the strip but we found this to be an advantage away from all the noise and the annoying people lining the walkways constantly "clicking" the call girl tickets in your face. Please LV do something about this!!!! We don't need this - I'm sure guys know where to source this "service" if required! Couples and families want to be left in peace to enjoy their time walking along the strip. The deuce bus tickets are cheap if you find it too long a walk but personally we didn't have a problem with it. There is a lovely cafe and supermarket on site for snacks and drinks. Staff very nice and friendly and suites are beautifully furnished and very clean. Nothing negative to say at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money on this one.. even if it is inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaMarie323
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 12 year old son for 4 days. Quite a few negatives for this place. First of all the TV is old fashioned.. no movies, games. Both TV's in suite were old and not easy to use (I am tech savy, worked for Microsoft) and could not figure out how to use the old style remotes. They say they are very green and then the maid runs only the coffee pot in the dishwasher!! This really upset me. I hand washed the dishes everyday and then the lazy maid runs only the coffee pot in the dishwasher... she never gave us clean washcloths.. the business center charges you to print out your boarding passes or use the computers at all. The pool is only open until 10pm.. in VEGAS??? They want you to attend the timeshare meeting, but the shows that they offer as an incentive to go to the timeshare meeting are all the lousy ones. When your neighbors run the shower or bath be prepared.. They woke us up everytime... sometimes at 4am! No, I would not stay here again.. It as not very expensive... now I know why

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - Little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: tecbss
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites because of the Hilton Honors program. Because I was there for work and spent most of my days in a conference, it was fine. The suites were nice and the pool area was relaxing, but not overly decadent like a lot of the Vegas pools. If I were planning a trip to Vegas with friends or significant other, this is not the hotel I would choose as it is a bit off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Piglet1981
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel- CLEAN, SPACIOUS, EXCELLENT STAFF AND SERVICE. The location is what throws it off- it is at the end of the strip and not really near much of the "center"...but worth it if looking for a family-oriented place in Vegas for an extended period of time.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: urban_kowboy
Reviews.Content: As you know there are many nice hotels in Vegas. Although this is a good property and I had a great experience, I couldn't give it all 5 stars because there are better hotels on the strip. I recommend this for just about anyone. It's that dynamic especially for Las Vegas standards. You have the revelers, family vacationers, honeymooners, college kids, and of course....gamblers. It has a nice pool outside with a bar that serves food. There's a nice size rec room where you can play pool. Good access to business resources like internet workstations, printers, etc. It's a resort so it comes with anything you believe that offers so it's hard to compare to a standard hotel. The food market has a nice selection of hot and cold food. It's not in the greatest location but it's not bad either. You will probably be solicited to buy some time share but it is a resort after all. If you don't have to be in the heart of the Vegas strip where all the lights are, then this would be a wise choice. Then again, I came here on a reduced rate so I'm not sure what the regular prices are. Good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Ughh! Rough Stay With Good Recovery!”
Reviews.Author: MarisaS39
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Vegas on biz. SHRM conference. Got to my room. Gross! Some gross looking stain on floor, and creepy looking bed. Got switched. Room number 2. Gross! Hair on couch! Same mess up bed! Got switched again. Room 3. This is where they win. They upgraded me to what I guess was the new tower. Newly remodeled. And a suite! With a Bar! Win! They started at 1 star and ended at 3. Phew! More for me than them!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Luxury...oh so de-luxe-ful!”
Reviews.Author: jptolman
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI exchange and another reaffirmation of why I joined (Worldmark) timeshare and why I have RCI. I think the stars were aligned when we were able to book this Hilton GVC on an RCI exchange and on short notice. It was a studio unit on Tower II's 27th floor with a mini kitchen (bar fridge, microwave, sink). We had an early flight into Vegas, arriving at the front desk at about 8:30am. They were able to check us in at around 10'ish. Normal check in is 4pm. TIP: They're happy to give you a pool pass while waiting and drop off your luggage at the bell desk so you're not dragging it around. There's plenty enough comfortable chairs in the lobby area, the deli downstairs, and the poolside bar/restaurant to keep you occupied or you can take a short walk to the Circus Circus/Slots-o-Fun or the McDonald's for cheaper meal if you're hungry. Resort amenities are AWESOME. I would take that bed home if I could. They have an on-site spa. The market/deli was convenient. The pool area had two pools and you can belly up to the bar for some food and drinks. The prices weren't bad on the menu either. You'd pay just as much at Applebees or other restaurant chains. The resort has 24-hour security and you can pick up a cab up-front with the valet. There are cabs a-plenty waiting for a fare. If you bring your own vehicle, they have secured parking in a multi-level parking garage behind the resort. Location was not that bad either. It is a little further north on the South Las Vegas Boulevard Strip across from the old Sahara Casino (it closed last month) and a block north of Circus Circus but the walk south wasn't bad. The weather, while hot, was actually perfect and actually mild for this time of the year in Vegas. The cab isn't worth it, in my opinion, unless you had to get someplace in a real hurry. If it's too uncomfortable to walk, ride the Deuce up and down the strip. It stops right in front of the resort. TIP: The Deuce bus (double deck and air-conditioned) is a great way to get back and forth on LVB 24/7. It makes many stops along the way from (old) Downtown LVB to Mandalay Bay. The best deal is a 3-day/72-hour unlimited pass on the city's bus system for $20 per person. We walked to the nearest ticket vending kiosk which was in front of the Fashion Place Mall to pick up our tickets. Buses accept exact change only and NO credit cards. Once again, you will get the lovely people in marketing trying to draw you into a timeshare presentation (other than gambling, that's the next big thing in Vegas) if you aren't a member yet. Lets face it, we are the reason why Paris can afford her furball purse-pet and other luxuries so please be considerate. If you don't really want to donate to the cause, just say no. They won't take offense though they will try and call you at least twice during your stay. TIP: On the other hand, if you have an entire day to spend (forget the 90 minute pitch–it never happens) and the fortitude to say no to their membership, you can get some great freebies out of it. OR save your precious minutes and just go to Tix4Tonight for half price shows. There's a T4T kiosk just down the street in front of Slots-o-Fun. Also, check out Groupon or LivingSocial online for some great deals in food, spa, and attractions. Would I go back again? Oh yeah! I just hope to land another RCI exchange there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: psc4106
Reviews.Content: It's a nice Hiltony place but I didn't find anything special or memorable about it. But on the other hand, there was certainly nothing wrong with the place.

Reviews.Title: “So-so suite but has everything you might need!”
Reviews.Author: suebhoney
Reviews.Content: Traveled and stayed with friends in a 2-bedroom apartment-style suite, plus 1 studio.This is a non-gaming property on the north strip, and it's located between the Sahara and Circus / Slots, which was fine for us but may not be for others. The rooms are great & impeccably maintained. The rooms & suites have everything you might possibly want or need, and the kitchen was well-stocked. All employees were welcoming & accommodating. The pool area was good but did not seem large enough for a property of this size. The only downsides to the property - (1) The parking garage was inconvenient and a bit of a walk, and valet would not permit call downs on cars; (2) the food down stairs was not good and lines were long for breakfast - skip it! (3) The spa was not up to snuff and mixed up our appointments. (4) There were only king beds available. Those negatives are things I can deal with. Would stay here again. I think it's a great value for a clean & well-kept place. I'm looking forward to trying other Hilton Vacation properties after my experience here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not so GRAND vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LDB2323
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton reward member and I was offered this room at a discounted rate/go for a timeshare presentation! When we check in I am told that the reserved room was for one King bed...and not the two Queens that I was assured to have! There were three of us, but originally there were to be four! I was told that I could leave if I wanted, but that my reservation was non refundable, so I would be out the money regardless! She gave me a business card to call and complain which was not cool! I upgraded to a room for a $25 fee per night with a living room and a pull out sofa, which was so ridiculous because I had to sleep sideways for the bed was too short! The room was nice, but I wasn't happy with my service! At the timeshare presentation the next day, I was rushed through which is not an understatement...8 minutes, which was just fine with me! I told them that I would not be interested in the property since my last two visits to a HILTON property were less than stellar! =(

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for a family”
Reviews.Author: mbr28
Reviews.Content: The Hilton on the strip was a good location for our family. The property is well maintained and our room was well kept and it looked like it had been updated recently. One complaint, our room did have a strange, mildly unpleasant odor which they tried to mask with a strong deodorizer, but after a few days we kind of grew accustomed to it. We had plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 kids in the 2 bedroom unit and it was really nice to have kitchen and family room. The pool was very nice too, not super fancy but clean and well maintained. The food from the pool bar was very good and they have a nice selection. The location of the property is not fantastic, the area is kind of seedy. It is located far from most of the high end resorts, so we had to take a cab when we ventured out to gamble, shop or have dinner. The people that worked at the resort were friendly and we really had no compaints about service. Not as glamorous as staying at one of the high end casinos, but a great option for families or large groups that want room to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel on north end of strip”
Reviews.Author: d_p_richards
Reviews.Content: Check in was painless and we were upgraded free of charge from a studio to a suite. Great full kitchen, nice size bathroom, lovely large tub in bedroom, awesome to have a washer and dryer in suite. Kind of stunk to pay a few bucks for parking, but not a big deal. Suite and hotel amenities were really nice - great gym, good pool / hot tub area. Got an extended check out without any hassle or charge, and all interactions with staff were good. At the north end of strip near, so a bit of a walk to the main action / restaurants, but not a big deal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little less than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: db2102
Reviews.Content: I'd like to give this 3.5 stars, but when my choices are 3 or 4, I had to go with 3... we stayed here for a discounted rate after agreeing to attend a 2 hour sales presentation for the Hilton Grand Vacations Club timeshare program. Had this been a just another Hilton hotel, I think I would've given it 4 stars, but seeing it was a Vacation Club, and the rooms were not cheap, I was expecting more. The hotel is located all the way on the north end of the strip, just south of the Stratosphere - so, the main hotels are quite a hike. Rent a car or use the public transportation - getting a cab was not too easy. You CANNOT walk to the heart of the strip from here. The lobby is big and bright and nicely done. Everything looks new. The staff was nice, but not overly so. Housecleaning left us a voicemail letting us know that they did not clean our room because the privacy sign was on, but that they'd come back any time if we called, which I thought was nice. The rooms are in 2 separate towers (both accessible via the lobby). We stayed in tower 2, and had a decent view of the strip, but mainly all you could see was the large lot across the street where a casino is being built. We stayed in a studio, as we expected. Thought it was clean, new, well decorated, I think it is smaller than several Hilton rooms I've stayed in at regular hotels. So, that was a bit of a disappointment. There were only 2 bath-size towels in the bathroom, which was annoying. The pool area was very nice. There's a poolside bar-grill, though we didn't eat there. At 9:30am on a Saturday morning, it was closed. Seriously? There is no other restaurant at the hotel. There is a "market", basically a glorified deli, but if you want real food, you either eat at the pool (though who knows when it's actually open), or you leave the hotel. Not only is self-park not included with your room (it's $8 a day), but the parking structure is a bit of a hike from the rear entrance of the hotel. And, the 1st 3 floors are reserved for valet, so you will either have to wait for an elevator or hike up/down stairs to get to and from your car. Just an FYI, there is no casino at this hotel. They do not advertise one, but I'm just reiterating this, as people may assume every hotel in Vegas has a casino. Overall, there was nothing fundamentally wrong with this hotel, and if it were just a hotel, I would've been ok with it. But as a vacation club, I was expecting a little more in the way of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but otherwise very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LLLady
Reviews.Content: Ok, so when Hilton called to offer us a cheap weekend in Vegas for a timeshare pitch, I was expecting much higher quality than this. Don't get me wrong, our one bedroom suite was awesome - full kitchen, washer/dryer, big tub & shower, very comfy bed. It's when you leave your room that the tackiness sets in. First of all, there is no restaurant or cafe - only a poolside bar\grill, and a mini-mart type store. The poolside grill has terrible food, do NOT go there! Then there's the little grocery store, which does serve Starbuck's at a snail's pace, but it has 2 cash registers only - for a hotel with 2 towers of 39 floors each. Result: insanely long lines for food or coffee, and an extremely slow staff. And Hilton is supposedly putting up 2 more towers?? Talk about being unprepared. Then there's the pool area - not bad, but waaay too small. It's a competition to get a lounge chair each morning, and there was only one girl taking drink orders. Our weekend can be summed up with a simple comparison: upstairs was the Hilton, the rest was the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “No special treatment for Honors members”
Reviews.Author: eljefe20
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a timeshare hotel. There is no executive lounge or floors. When we checked in, the marketing manager said she would "take care of us," but ended up giving us a regular room. Then she seemed incredulous we declined to waste 90 minutes of our vacation to sit through their presentation to sell us a timeshare. Over the course of our stay (6 nights), we received 5 voicemails of more sales attempts. The beds are really soft. The cleaning lady threw away our earplugs and bottled water on the nightstand! The walls are so thin we heard our neighbors too clearly and all the drunken guests in the hallway at 4am. It is not a bad hotel, but since we are used to special treatment, this is not somewhere we are likely to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and peaceful, and easy to get to the action”
Reviews.Author: Leigh621
Reviews.Content: Just got back .....Family trip with kids over 21. The Strip is busy and exciting, but when it all gets to be too much it was great to go back to our roomy accommodations and RELAX. Be sure to check out the downtown area. Eat at Main Street Station Pullman Restaurant downtown and don't miss the buffet at the Bellagio. (Lunch was more affordable and sumptuous). Monorail and Deuce bus are very convenient too. I fyou time it right, you can see the foundatins at Bellagio and the volcano at the Mirage from the top of the Deuce bus. There are multiple Hilton properties, so be sure to pick the Hilton Grand Vacation on the Strip. (the one adjacent the Flamingo is center strip, but we didn't stay there.)

Reviews.Title: “We booked a suite?”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the HGV in Hawaii, I was expecting a similar type of room as depicted on the hotel website complete with living room, kitchen etc. Our 'suite' was a regular hotel room with a small kitchen counter, not at all what I thought I had booked. Nevertheless, I am not going to complain because I liked the property, the price, the staff and the room was very clean and the bed comfortable. Having a small market on the main floor is very convenient. Would I stay here again? Yes, but not with the same grandiose expectations of a huge room. Would I buy a unit here? Absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “Old before it's time”
Reviews.Author: S1traveler
Reviews.Content: We decided to play the time-share bargain deal and agreed to a reduced rate stay for a 2 hour meeting with the Hilton time share folks. So not worth the reduced rates! If the people at Hilton are trying to get time-share users to buy in, they sure aren't showcasing themselves at this location! The hotel was built/renovated? in 2004 and it looks dated - like from the 50s. Now, maybe this was their decor plan, but it just looks out of touch. The room decor is in shades of 50's, well maybe 70's color palette and the furnishing is not comfortable. They are located at the end of the Strip - so don't plan on getting a cab too quickly! Also, plan on spending all your spare cash on cab fare up to the main part of the strip, or buy a 24 hour pass on the bus system called "Deuce" that runs up and down the Strip constantly. The pool area is the hotel's one saving grace. Shaded with huge palm trees, it has plenty of seating/deck chairs, and you can find quiet coves away from the kids playing in the main pool. This is definitely a family oriented hotel, so kids will enjoy themselves here. Don't bother looking out the windows of your room. We had a great view of an abandoned hotel construction site (about 4 blocks long, so don't think another room's view will be better!) and the runway of the airport. Other views are no more promising. Food was adequate at their cafe/convenience store. A grocery store is not close by - must take a cab, so if you're going for the kitchen amenities, plan for a road trip to get supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xpresdude
Reviews.Content: Was out of the way away from the newer casinos. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We were there for the vacation club overview. I can not compare this to other timeshare experiences because this was our first but I can say it was pressureless. After the tour and a short video, we were asked if we were really interested and we said no but we would like to hear how it works. After that it was a short survey then we received our promotional gifts.

Reviews.Title: “First Time, First Stay”
Reviews.Author: FitzD
Reviews.Content: This place is nice. First time in Vegas and the first at this hotel. We are members and were invited out to Vegas. Loved the room and hotel overall. The weather was nice. Ride to the hotel from the airport was not long. Cab driver not the best. My wife and I had a nice time. Used the Deuce for all of our travel needs, and even walked all the way down to the MGM Grand one day. This hotel is located on the North end of the strip between the Sahara and Circus Circus Casinos. Not too far from the Wynn Casinos. There is no restaurant in this hotel but there is a place to buy food if you wish. I cannot comment on parking because we had not car. The staff was helpful when needed, although we werent informed how to use the elevator with the room key. After a few trips up and down a helpful guest explained the procedure. Overall a good trip and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tnsna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort a number of times and have always found the place to be very homey. One time we cam from the Luxor and had been treated rudely there and we drove up to the valet at HGVC on the strip and they were so friendly talking/playing with my kids and over the top friendly to our entire group! Nice pool area with a nice pool side bar and grill. The views from the upper suites are so nice!!! Three bedroom units at this resort make it great traveling with large groups. Great restaurants within walking distance!!! the real difference is how at home we feel at this resort and that feeling is permeated by their friendly staff. All of the two bedroom and one bedroom units are very well appointed. (have not stayed in a studio) Flat screen tv's and bose sound systems as well. Very nice fitness center, gameroom and located right next to Circus Circus for the kids!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: spikeboy
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Death Valley for a few days & came back to Vegas & stayed at Hilton Grand Vacation Club for 2 days. Outstanding hotel & staff. The room was so big I felt like I was home. They supplied everthing. It was a fully equiped. Nice full kitchen. Wirlpool tub seperate from bathroom. Very quite. Pool area, store to buy some groceries, pizza & Starbucks. Price was resonable. Ther is a Whole Foods down the Street & several Trader Joe's near by. Hated to leave the room it was so nice. We love Vegas the only thing we don't like are the unfinished buildings. Hope they can refinish buildings soon. Red Rock Canyon is worth a visit. Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient and boring time-share with no services”
Reviews.Author: TioP
Reviews.Content: If you're OK with staying in a place that's far from everything with no amenities, this is the place for you! These are primarily timeshare units - the one bedrooms are OK, with nice kitchenettes that you will need because there is no restaurant on premises and nothing within easy walking distance. Studio units are not as nice as a Homewood Suites, pretty lame for a place that considers itself a premium timeshare. Geared towards families, so swimming pools are only 3 feet deep and crowded with playing children. Free wifi, but charge to use business center. Fitness center was closed for remodel, you could get a pass for another Hilton property, but very inconvenient. We visited on a promo - incentives turned out to be not exactly as described, could only be used at different Hilton properties. Staff friendly while they think you might buy a unit - after that, you become more or less invisible. Shuttle bus stops out front, $7 a ride, for two people it's actually cheaper to take a cab to the *REAL* hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A week exploring Vegas”
Reviews.Author: spaek
Reviews.Content: HGV is great because they're all the same. You know exactly what you're going to get. A clean room, great amenities, comfortable furniture. The best thing is the jacuzzi in the room. The location is a little far from the rest of the Strip, but we spent most of our time checking out other areas around the region.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: AAITIS1951
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located on the North end on the strip. The Hotel is located near the Sahara and Circus Circus. There was no full restaurant at this hotel. I was given some amenities to use as part of the trip. The amenities were more useful at the Hilton Hotel instead of at this location. The Hilton Hotel was approximately 1-to-1.5 miles from this location. There were no hotel buses (at least not mentioned) between the two locations. I walked there to be able to eat my breakfast, lunch or supper. The food was excellent at the Hilton. It was just the distance that was an inconvenience. A taxi cost approximately $7.00-to-$8.00 for each single leg of the trip. I was stiffed by one taxi driver driving in a circle to increase the fair. I tried to avoid using the taxi as much as possible. Mostly walked or used the buses for transportation. The cost of the buses was $7.00 for two days (exact change only). I learned this after waiting 20 minutes for a bus. I felt that the bus was the best way to go over several miles. You can walk a long distance to see much of the strip. Most of the shopping was away from this location. There was a CVS pharmacy and inexpensive gift shop (sodas, snacks, hats, T-shirts and etc) was approximately 2-to-3 blocks. There were some people (near the CVS pharmacy) asking for handouts and asking to use your cell phone for making a call. The same people were there each time after walking to visit the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Fun! Hilton Grand Vacations on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: J0yce53
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-day stay at a Hilton property on the north end of the strip between Circus-Circus and the Sahara (slated for closing in May.) It was our third trip and second with our college-age adult children. The hotel is a time-share property and our accomodations were a one bedroom apartment with a complete kitchen (stove, refrigerator, dishes, etc.) We didn't do a lot of cooking but it was nice to be able to keep things cold and cook if we wanted. There is a shop downstairs, but a CVS pharmacy is next door and carries almost everything you would need. The property does not have a casino and we had to sit through a time-share talk, but the room was quite comfortable for 4 people. The fold-out couch was MUCH better than ours at home. The room was clean and housekeeping was very good. There is an exercise room on the bottom floor and you can print boarding passes at no cost. I suggest using the bus system "the deuce" for transportation to other parts of the strip. You can get a daily ticket for $7.00 and a 3-day ticket for around $14. It goes up and down Las Vegas Blvd and runs until midnight. One thing about the north end- it's not as popular, so there are not all those guys getting in your face while flipping advertisement cards for "adult entertainment." Circus-Circus is great for entertaining kids if one adult will stay with them while the others play casino games. There are rides, carnival games and a high-wire act. Also, the table rates seemed to be better, according to my husband. We took a bus trip to the South Rim of the Grand Canyon via Viator. Be aware that this is a full day activity and a long ride. The bus picked us up at the hotel to take us to the actual departure point. We had to be downstairs at 5:45am, so be prepared to get up early! The driver, Paul, was very informative and tried to make our trip enjoyable. I don't think you can even describe the Grand Canyon. lt's one of those catch-your-breath experiences and well worth the trip! We saw an I-Max film that was informative while eating lunch- individual pizzas or burgers. Not gourmet, but OK-part of the fare. We got back into town around 9:30pm. We attended a Terry Fator show (ventriloquist with singing puppets.) It was great-couldn't stop laughing. It is also suitable for all ages. Get tickets in advance- it was full on Tuesday. Overall, we had a wonderful time and are looking forward to another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - good off-strip location”
Reviews.Author: sdp126
Reviews.Content: We are RCI members and traded for a 1 bedroom condo at this resort. The condo was very clean and well appointed. The king size bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed having a full kitchen and living room. Our only recommendations to the resort were to check the tv reception and look at the toilet that kept running (we kept having to open the tank and flip the flapper down). I would HIGHLY recommend. The STAFF is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home... comfortable, spacious & gracious service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkChuck
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, spacious with courteous professional service, the Hilton Grand at the north end of the Las Vegas Strip offers the comforts of home, just minutes from the action of all that Vegas has to offer. Suites have a grand kitchen, with full-size appliances, a washer-dryer, fantastic bedding, a beautiful swanky bathroom and a nice concession store and pool. Two caveats: It's one of the few joints where you have to pay for parking in Vegas ($8 a day). Also note that the Hilton's once killer views are now wholly obstructed by the unfinished Fontainebleau tower, which is a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: This was a RCI timeshare exchange & we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was the best accommodation we had for our entire US trip. The suite was luxurious, clean & everything was in working order incl the kitchenette & laundry. We had a car so the location wasn't very much of an issue for us as we drove everywhere. If you don't have a car, wouldn't recommend it here as it is quite far from where all the action is on the Strip. There's a drugstore in the next block which was convenient for picking up groceries, etc. The hotel's deli was convenient for picking up a pizza or two - not too expensive. The carpark is in an adjacent building so you need to walk across in an open walkway to get to the hotel proper. Also, I suggest you drop off your luggage & stuff at the hotel's lobby, do your check in & then park your car in the car park proper.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful staff, safe, nicely appointed, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: ah_bah
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hilton is near the end of the main part of the strip, close to the Sahara so it was a little distance, 10 minutes or so, to the newest hotels and casinos but we walked across the street and rode the monorail but we also walked home late at night with no problems. No gambling inside the hotel, and they check your room key to make sure you're a guest after a certain hour, making it feel very safe.
