Lots of families were staying here, Starbucks, gym inside, and helpful staff inside and outside to assist. Self-parking behind the building for $5 a day. Can't beat those Hilton mattresses! Priced well. Recommend as a choice for a hotel that is away from the hustle and bustle but still close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Meets the Needs of Many Travelers”
Reviews.Author: QOE
Reviews.Content: We were one of those couples who received a phone call about a great opportunity to visit Las Vegas. We were planning to go in January anyway so we took them up on the offer. We knew going in that it was a vacation club promotion but a couple of hours of my time seemed a fair price for the room. We've done many such presentations in the past. As vacation club properties go, this one is nice enough but the room, with the exception of the microwave in the kitchenette, could be any standard hotel room. It seemed a bit small to me. We were on the 32nd floor (Room 23216) with an unremarkable view of a vacant lot and the Circus Circus RV Park. My biggest gripe was that we were the furthest room from the elevators and it was quite a hike. In fact, the longer we stayed, the further it got! We were pleased to note that security seems high. We had to show our room keys to get into the building after a certain hour. I attempted to use the Business Center to print a file from my stick drive but their system doesn't provide for stick drives and none of the staff could offer a solution. There is a fee for both using the computer and printing a page. While everyone we interacted with was pleasant they just didn't seem to have the knowledge or experience to help us. The staff in the sales center were extremely pleasant, of course, and made an effort to make sure we were happy. The rest of the staff could use some training. We were disappointed with the Deli/Convenience store. The prices for a beverage were higher than the vending machines on our floor. At 9am we went down for breakfast and they had no scrambled eggs! The staff in the deli were rushed and highly stressed. The lines were getting very long. We settled for a breakfast sandwich that was nice but overpriced. The property currently has two towers and there are plans for two more. It will continue to grow and perhaps they will improve on things like dining options. Personally, I would rather stay in a casino hotel in case I get the urge to roam during the wee hours. We tend to stay out late and we like the "action" in a casino property. After two nights at Hilton Grand Vacations we moved to the Flamingo, as planned, for the rest of our stay. Being mid-Strip saved us on both cab fare and time. This property would be excellent for travelers wishing to avoid the noise and hubbub of the Strip as well as families with small children. Folks who enjoy walking won't mind the location and that area is much safer than it might appear. The police patrol frequently. We'll probably continue to stay mid-Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mickeymacc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean! Hotel room was cleaned and bed linen changed every day. There is no restaurant at the hotel but there is a deli/coffee shop type place that is open until late and the food is lovely. The pool area was really clean there are 2 pools and 2 jacuzzis with pool bar. The hotel is roughly a 20 minute walk from Ceasars palace but for those of you who are not that keen on walking you can grab a cab or there is a bus stop outside the front of the hotel. We had an excellent stay at HGVS and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Vegas - clean, comfortable, and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissExplorer27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Valentines weekend, and chose this specific hotel as it doesn't have a casino and would therefore be quiet. The hotel was indeed quiet, even though they were pretty full. It is absolutely spotless, and our bed was VERY comfortable. I like it when hotels put lots of pillows out, rather than having to rummage through a closet to find them. The en suite was lovely - lots of towels, very clean and modern, and more than enough space for my husband and I to get ready to go out at the same time. It would be nice if there was a mirror with even lighting, that you could do your make up in. The bathroom mirror (though huge) is quite far away as the sink space is pretty big, and the mirrors in the room have one side to the window, so it's light on one side of your face. That really is the only thing I can say about this hotel that's less than perfect! From other reviews, I can see that other people thought it odd to have to pay for parking - we visited some other hotels in Vegas, and it did seem pretty common. Living in London, it's normal here too. In Feb '11, it was $8 per day to park your own car, and £11 for valet parking. There was never a problem with either, but I'd recommend parking your own car as it's quicker to get it back when you want to go out. Taxis are available quite quickly - although the valets did jump someone in front of us because they tipped! We usually tip after service, not before.... and of course we didn't after this. Lots of people here seem to moan about location - I cannot imagine why! It's at the far end of the strip, and if you wanted to, you could walk to the action in about 5-10 minutes. There is a bus that goes up and down the strip all day, and costs $7 for a 24 hour pass. I think it's £3 for a single journey, but we only did the 24 hours. I liked the location, and we like to stretch our legs a bit, so it suited us. We knew that people can smoke indoors in Nevada, and this hotel is non-smoking, which is perfect. It is very strange to come from Europe, where smoking indoors (and in doorways!) is banned, to visit somewhere that smells of smoke everywhere you go! This hotel was non-smoking though, apart from a few rooms, and we were happy with this. You do get quite a few messages from the concierge about booking trips etc, but you can just delete them from the voicemail. Over here we are used to seeing the messages pop up on the TV when you turn it on in the room, so it's no more intrusive than that really. Both the gym and the pool are pretty good for a hotel. We are going back to Vegas for the next rugby 7s, and will definitely be booking the same hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “timeshare trap”
Reviews.Author: lynchbill
Reviews.Content: spent three hours at our "meeting" low pressure at first than attention span starts to falter after all the questions asked.then it's like "what am I doing here wasting my time when the "meeting was only supposed to be 90 minutes.after all the wonderful stuff they show and offer then they hit you with a sheet of your monthly payments and down payment which is outrageously overpriced for the average poor slob that attends,then your disgusted again that you just pretty much just wasted time here than enjoying your time to go out and do your own thing.this place is way out there by the stratoshere,in the ugly part of town and the wait for a cab is rediculous because they are only a hotel and not a casino.spent sooooooo muuuuch in cab fare.stay in the middle of the strip and spend more at the other hotels and you will save your self alot of leisure time,if that's more important to you.only reason we stayed here is because we got a phone call with a supposedly great room deal. will never again fall for the timeshare call.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, away from the chaos.”
Reviews.Author: FlyHigh314
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms! No stuffy Casino at hotel. Great for families. Convenient deli located at the hotel. Very close to Stratosphere Casino if you are looking for a casino to play at, but want a quiet place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “spouse and friend.”
Reviews.Author: claudia096
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you have forgotten something in your room at checkout, and expect to get it back!~!!!!!!!!! Checked out on the 11th. We originally were going to stay until the 12th. When we got home and unpacked, I realized I had left a brand new pair of shoes in the closet. I called today and talked to there security department to no avail. My feeling was they really could care less....I got disconnected from Joel (don't really think he knew what was going on (maybe he was new) Was called back to be told they were not turned in. WELL....The maids must have found them in the closet and decided they liked those new pair of black shoes They have disonest employees working for them and they might want to look into that!!! Checked in on 2/5/11 with spouse and a friend. Can't complain about the accomodations. We had a one bedroom suite and an ajoining studio with a king bed, frig and microwave. It fit our needs. The first bad experince was in the Deli, couldn't believe the prices. If we were in a Casino Hotel it would have probably been in line. BUT...... 30 DOLLARS for a bottle of 7.99 wine anywhere else was absolutely ridiculous!!!!! I think Las Vegas is trying to recoup the money they are not making on gambling and tyring to knickle and dime the tourists on everything else. Food is pretty pricey at all the main casinos. not to mention the drinks! NOTE: Don't go to a bar in any of the main casinos to buy a beer!!!!!! You will pay 7.00 a bottle. You can get free drinks (if your playing ON THE FLOOR) at the Wynn and Encore, BOT NOT AT ANY OF THE BARS. We have always enjoyed playing Blackjack at the baqr and having a beer...............NOT AT THESE TWO PLACES!!!! Also, get use to the airplane noise ALLl the time. Also, Also I havE NEVER stayed anywhwere where we had to pay to park. Never, will I stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lab804
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was near the Convention Center and because it did not have a casino. My part of the stay was for leisure--my husband stayed on a few days for business at the CC after I left. Parking was $8 per day self-park and $13 for valet parking. We chose to self-park and that worked fine. The kitchenette had a microwave, refrigerator, toaster and sink. The cabinets are stocked with plates, bowls, and glassware. Eating utensils, a can opener, and a cork screw are provided. There was food stuck on the plates so we washed everything before we used it. Linens and dish detergent are provided. There are very few electrical outlets in the room that are easily accessible. The outlet near the table would have been the best one for us to use for charging our two laptops and two cell phones but the cord to the tv was stretched over to it. We discovered that the outlet behind the dresser that the tv should have been using was not working. Our room was on the 26th floor (out of 27) in Tower One. The elevators could not have been more efficient. Of course, January is probably not a high volume month. The gym has quite a variety of machines and was very nice. There is a nice game area with a big screen tv, pool table, foosball table and ping pong. The first night we were there, we were awakened at 2 am by the people in the next room. We had adjoining rooms and the sound seemed to blare right through the door. Luckily their noise ended quickly and we never heard it again. The market in the lobby is way overpriced. We noticed a bottle of wine marked $26 that was selling at the CVS next door for $7.We were starving and tired when we arrived so we tried the "specialty sandwiches." They were disappointing and not worth the $11 price. If you want the real Vegas experience, you may be disappointed with the location of this hotel as it is quite a walk to the "action." If you like to walk, and you don't want to have to go through the maze of a casino to get to your room, you would probably be happy with this hotel. We received one phone call asking if we wanted to hear a sales pitch but they left us alone after we said "no." Other than the housekeeping staff not cleaning the dishes, the staff at this hotel was very pleasant and competent. I had to catch a shuttle to the airport at 4 am and the staff that greeted me that morning and made sure I met the shuttle were very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but far from the main strip”
Reviews.Author: dramz3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Hilton Grand. It is a very nice hotel and we recieved a REALLY good price as an incentive to attend a timeshare presentation. We knew ahead of time that it was located quite a distance from the excitement of the strip, so we rented a car, which we were happy we did. We did negotiate that they waive the parking fee, which is $8 per day. We stayed in a studio king room, which is basically a hotel room with a microwave, small fridge and a few dishes. It was perfect for our purposes. The gym was nice and the pool area looked very nice, but the weather was too cold to take advantage of it. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomidating. We called with a few questions and requests and all phone calls were handled in a very friendly and helpful manner. We stayed in Tower 2 and weren't impressed with our view, so if you care about the view out of your window ask to be placed in tower 1. As part of our timeshare promotion, we also got a $50 gift card to use at the Hilton Las Vegas Hotel, which is about a mile away. We were able to get two meals out of it, so we were thrilled! The timeshare presentation was pretty typical, nice salesman, not too pushy, etc. It was the first time we have actually considered buying into a timeshare, but ultimately decided against it. The biggest downfall of this hotel is its distance from the strip. If you are in Vegas to gamble and enjoy the main strip, this hotel is too far from the main action. Even with a car, it was a bit of a hassel to get from hotel to hotel. If it hadn't been for the good price and timeshare goodies we would have regretted our stay for the location alone. Otherwise, a great property, with great staff, rooms and amenities. Great for familes that don't want to stay in a casino and want to get the kids out of the Vegas lights.

Reviews.Title: “People at this place just don't care”
Reviews.Author: OCAR
Reviews.Content: All they care about is trying to sell you a timeshare. Calls all morning asking if my stay is going OK and when you bring up an issue they say they cant take care of it. Why even ask me if you are not going to address the issue. Then they have the audacity to ask you to buy a timeshare. Not only do they blatantly refuse to help but they act as if you are stupid for even asking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you like to sleep in heat and sweat all night!”
Reviews.Author: Tanyaaaaa1
Reviews.Content: Okay, first I have to tell you why I stayed in this hotel, because I know there is a lot of other people that are going to stay there for the same reason I did. I get a call at home asking me to take them up on their great deal of a low hotel rate, $50 gift card and $15 dollar gambling chip if I go there and sit through their time share presentation. On the phone I was told some lies. First, they told me that I was getting a deep discount; just a fraction of what the room is worth. I just looked it up on the hilton website. A studio on a Thursday (the day we arrived) is only $89, so I only saved about $20 from the regular price if I had to book it myself online. The other lie was that I was told that I could cash the $15 worth of chips in for cash. Forget it. You can't. This was my biggest gripe because I don't gamble so I kept asking him on the phone about that to make sure. I hate being lied to about this stuff. The gift card is only good to use at the hotel and casino on Paradise Road and not at the hotel on the strip. That was very annoying for me that we had to use it at a different hotel in a different area. I hated going through a casino just to use the gift card! When you get to the casino on Paradise Rd, you park in a garage and they ask for $30! Make sure you tell them you are staying at the HGVC so you can park for free. The time share presentation itself was not a high pressure sales pitch and they want to make sure it is not high pressured. Someone will ask you at the end to make sure. The biggest annoyance about the presentation is that we got up and down several times. My spouse had an injury before going to Las Vegas so this was very hard on him. If you have problems with getting up and down, beware. We were out of the presentation under the 2 hour time frame. I've read in some reviews that the walk from the parking garage is far. It's not. It's a short walk from the parking stucture to the hotel. It's outdoors. The space between the parking structure and the hotel is there for one of the two towers they will be building in the future. I would rather walk through empty space than through a casino. Some have complained that you can only park from the fourth level and up, but who cares? There is an elevator in there, so what does it matter? I don't think a hotel quest should pay for parking, but unfortunately that is more the norm these days. Parking was $8 a night. The room itself was spacious enough. It was new, so that was nice. The fridge was a good size. The micro. worked good. It had a toaster and a coffee maker that I didn't use. Studios don't have washer and dryers for clothes. Lighting was very poor. Opening curtains during the day worked for the bedroom area. The kitchenette area and the bathroom area was dark. There was extra wall lighting for the table area. The shower had low pressure, but I expect that in Las Vegas because of the need to conserve water there. However, the shower head had a large leak in it. It didn't drip down; it squirted like a fountain towards the ceiling and out towards the bathroom. I would always try to turn it so at least it would shoot towards the shower wall. The man at the sales presentation had me fill out a form about it, but nobody ever called to ask about it or to fix the problem while I was there. Maybe something would have been done if I told the front desk and something like that won't keep me from staying at a hotel, anyway. That's a small problem. The TV was a large flat screen on a pivotable stand. That was nice. However, we were annoyed that the channels had no information on them to tell us what the shows were that we turned to. So be careful if you have kids. You might change the channel to an adult show and not know it. The bed itself was comfortable enough. One review I read said the mattress was hard. The mattress has a pull over, removable cushion on top, so maybe his room just had the cushion missing. We asked for more blankets, a pillow and some more sundries. Room service brought it up pretty quick. The front desk even called back to make sure we got them. I was impressed by that. However, when the maid came in to clean the room the next day, I could tell that she just rinsed off the dishes with water and didn't wash them. The front desk people were pleasant at check in/out. The lady at the Concierge was not friendly, not helpful and even a bit rude. That is the desk where the friendliest people should be; someone who is out going and wanting to help! There needs to be a change there. Some reviews complain about the walking distance to the action. I never went down to the main section of the strip, but I was told that you can rent an electric wheel chair through the Concierge. So that's an option if you don't want to walk or get a cab. The deli downstairs maybe a little pricey, but what isn't on the strip? Or any hotel for that matter. You will be able to get something to eat there for $10. The only thing that my husband purchased there was a large size brownie for $2.50. That's not a big diffence than my grocery store in my hometown. I thought the food at the CVS store next door was overpriced too. Okay, so here is my biggest complaint. I stayed there at the beginning of January. The temperature outside was in the low 50's. I can understand the hotel wanting to turn the heat on, but when I walked through the lobby, it felt like it was 85-90 degrees in there. When I mentioned it to staff, the girls said they were also hot and sweating. I figured I would turn the AC on in the room and everything would be okay. Look at the picture of the studio room on the Hilton web site. You will see the vent on the top right next to the window. The air comes out fine, but the only place you feel it is over the arm chair and the table. While I was watching TV from the arm chair, I had to wear a sweatshirt and I was wrapped up in a blanket because the air was so powerful in that one area. However, you can't turn the direction of the vent at all. The rest of the room stays warm. I had hardly any sleep the two nights because I was so hot in there and I was sweating at night even though I had the AC set at around 66-69 degrees. When I got up to eat breakfast, I had to turn the AC off because it hit me directly over the table and I was freezing there. So basically the AC only can cool the area directly in front of the window where the arm chair and table is. If you get a room like this, ask for another one. They have ones where the vent is located on the opposite wall. It's still next to the window over the table and chair, but perhaps it will hit the bed more since it is at the foot of the bed rather than the head. I don't know, but its worth a try. I'm giving this hotel a 3 because of this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Quality... but with timeshare hassle...”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRusty
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before so knew what to expect.... Staff very friendly and efficient. Rooms very very clean, quiet, large and comfortable. However, being a Hilton 'resort' expect to get hassled. A lot. In person and on the rooms voicemail. It mared the stay to a point as you have to walk past the desk to get out (if you are in Tower 1). They are relentless, and a bit false... Having no slot machines is bliss - peace and quiet when you come back after a night out. The restuarant/cafe is good but pricey - as is the shop for provisions. 7-11 on the strip is far cheaper and walkable... And on that note, the strip is a walk away. A brisk walk but a walk nonetheless. I would take the reviews saying it is not safe with a LARGE pinch of salt.... It isn't as glitzy as the other parts of the strip but I never felt unsafe - just cold on November evenings!!!! Finally the parking. It is the only hotel (that we visited) that charge for both parking and valet parking. I found this really cheeky and disappointing. I mean, who is going to park there for any other reason that to stay at the hotel? Furthermore, they overcharged me and I haven't had a refund so check you aren't charged for valet when you are actually self-parking!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for travelling with teenagers!”
Reviews.Author: Keninpcfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our two teenage kids (18 and 16). We had a Suite with 1 bedroom and a hide-a-bed. There was a full kitchen with washer and dryer. This place was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, Courteous Staff, blah location”
Reviews.Author: pjstroh
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite here for one week in December. Essentially that amounted to a 1 bedroom suite with an attached hotel unit via connecting door. Plenty of space in the suite unit - the hotel unit was a little smallish. Still, everything was very clean and comfortable. Resort offers a nice restaurant counter and quick-mart for essentials. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. There are timeshare salespeople that tried to get us into a sales presentation but they left us alone after I politely declined on the first day. No harm, no foul. The only drawback to this resort is its location on the strip. It is at the far north end. Circus Circus, Sahara and Riviera are the only casinos within reasonable walking distance and all three of those places are low-end properties with sub-par eating establishments for the most part. The grand resorts on the strip will most likely require some other means of transporation to get to....although I did walk all the way down to Flamingo Rd one night. That was a hike ! All in all, I dont have any complaints about this resort. I just prefer to stay in the casino hotels because I like getting off the elevator and being in the middle of the action. If thats not important to you then this HGVC resort is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel even if at the bottom of the strip ...”
Reviews.Author: MarvMartSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and 2 preteen kids, and they enjoyed not only the hotel, but the room, which was spacious (Although next time I would book as 2 bedroom as opposed to a 1 bedroom). The on-site deli/shop is not too bad, ad we got a cab to take us to a supermarket where we bought food for the week. All in all a nice hotel, the only disadvantage is the location on the strip, but the bus stop is opposite the hotel, so it is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit - worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: chimp29
Reviews.Content: Stayed inApril 2008 and again Sept 2010 (had to cancel in April 2010 due to the Icelandic Volcano erupting and no air travel out of Europe - Hilton FULLY re-imbursed us!). Another wonderful stay - will be back again! Great to escape back to your Hotel and not have to walk through a Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long term with affordable pricing and luxury accomodations”
Reviews.Author: akamap93
Reviews.Content: Hilton Grand Vacations has been my vacation spot on several trips to Las Vegas. Although, it is a part of several timeshare networks such as RCI it is available for rental as a non-time share owner. If you are traveling with a family or just a spouse/partner but want more space and to feel at home..this is the place. The suites come with separate bedrooms complete with a door. A full living room with tv/dvd and full kitchen. Kitchen includes stove, full refrigerator, microwave. There is a washer and dryer in each unit also. Although, not many want to cook on vacation it does help to cut down on cost if you are staying for an extended stay to be able to have groceries and not eat out for each and every meal. This is a non gaming facility, but located on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far Away from the Action”
Reviews.Author: ericdrew
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation was a nice hotel but in a location that is too far from the action. Obviously most folks are there for the timeshare presentation and have been offered nice incentives. In our case the amount we saved on accomodation was sacrificed in cab fare. Excluding the cabs to and from the airport we spent around $50 a day in taxis ie. 2 round trips per day. It cost between $10-$15 to get to the Ceasars....etc. In addition the coupon incentives that are given need to be spent at the Hilton Hotel which is about a 15 minute walk and is dated and has limited food options.

Reviews.Title: “They are only trying to sell you time share !”
Reviews.Author: RED059
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed to stay at this hotel ( especially as there are 4 Hilton establishments in Vegas, so you have to say the correct title to get to your correct hotel). After a very long and eventful trip, the concierge just tried to sell us time share, we tried to ask about the shows in Vegas, we were told "you'll be lucky to get any tickets to any show...but ours are free, if you attend a small presentation". And that was it, no help, just flogging time share, then they would ring the room to see if we were attending ta presentation. The room and facilities were ok, but not what i wanted from a holiday, the cold weather, the snow that cancelled the Grand Canyon trip and the naff location made it a poor holiday, not what i paid all that money for

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a bad location”
Reviews.Author: J_n_G_n_AZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite. Very nice accommodations overall. The kitchen would be nice for a longer stay, but for a long weekend it we didn't take advantage of the opportunity. The two things we didn't like about the hotel was the lack of food and beverage shops and the location. One deli/convenience store on the first floor called The Marketplace was the only place to eat on the property. Not even a lobby bar. The location was toward the north end of the strip, north of Circus Circus. Very run down part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Just about on the strip...but not really”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: there is not too much about this hotel that you can say. The location is bad, Its supposed to be on the strip but its far far away. The rooms are ok.....although if u have an interconnecting room u will here everything from the other room. Internet is free. Breakfast is non-existent. They have some deli...but i would not call this a breakfast. Its a non-gaming property. I would never go to this hotel if I wanna enjoy what vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: WendyS542
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom King suite w/the full kitchen. The room looked EXACTLY like the photos on their website. It had a king bed in the bedroom and a queen sleeper in the living room. There was a TV in each with a DVD player in the living room. This is not the hotel for you if you want to be walking distance from the night clubs but Vegas has free parking structures and complimentary valet parking everywhere (we drove to Vegas from Sacramento so we had a car with us.) I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews about cleanliness, etc. The hotel and our room was extremely clean. We loved that this hotel isn't a Casino so we got to escape the smoke! There's also a STARBUCKS on the 1st floor which was convenient when we needed our midnite dose of caffeine to keep up with the two kids who closed down the Adventuredome at Circus Circus. HGVC is perfect if you are with the kids. Circus Circus is walking distance. We purchased the 2day Vegas Power Passes which included unlimited rides at the Circus Circus Adventuredome which is basically an indoor amusement park with 25 different rides including a water ride and full on roller coaster (2 loops and 2 corkscrews!). The power pass includes all kinds of tours and other rides as well (such as the Hoover Dam, Wax Museum, the coaster at NY-NY, the Eifel Tower, etc.). We definitely got our money's worth from the passes (http://www.bestofvegas.com/Attractions/Las-Vegas-Power-Pass-Ticket/). You get $10 credit per pass at the Planet Hollywood Restaurant for each day of the pass. That was $40 a day for our family of 4 which basically paid for dinner one night and dessert the next night. If you don't want to do anything but go to Circus Circus, you can also buy unlimited passes at just Adventuredome ($27 for above 48" in height and $17 for below 48".) We went to the timeshare presentation...very low-key and no pressure. They gave us a $200 certificate toward a future Hilton stay (we chose Embassy Suites). They also gave us a $50 Hilton voucher and $15 in chips for their hotel across the strip. We exchanged it for $50 credit toward the Spa. They were running a Fall special and I got a massage and pedicure for $139 and was able to use the $50 voucher making my spa trip CHEAP! WE HAD AN EXCELLENT time and would DEFINTELY stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a little ways from all the action!”
Reviews.Author: Copfamily5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our weekend at the Hilton Grand on the Strip. The hotel was nice and clean. Keep in mind this hotel is at the end of the strip near the Sahara and Circus Circus, a long walk to the major casinos and shopping. So plan on taking a taxi or renting a car. This was our second trip to Vegas and we wanted to spend some time away from the strip so it was not to much of a probelm for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a little far down"”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerMA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights over Columbus weekend at the HGVC on the strip. The hotel was nice, clean, simple. We got a ridiculous deal and it was my boyfriend first time in Vegas (my 6th) so he was happy. Rooms were normal sized - but seemed smaller than other hotels I've stayed in here. (ie. Paris, Treasure Island, Flamingo, Bally's, Venitian) Positives: Staff was very friendly - especially the bell staff/doorman Rooms were nice and had mini fridge Elevators were super quick Nice cafe/snack bar downstairs No casino - so no smoke filled hallways Pool was nice and food/drinks were decent and not overpriced Hotel was very quiet for sleeping and drapes darkened room very nicely Great price Negatives: - A bit far from some of the action. It was a good walk to the main casino area. We walked to Bellagio and had blisters ( and we're city people and used to walking) - Had to take taxis everywhere - When we checked in (granted it was very late) there were only two people at the desk and it seemed to take forever to check each party in ahead of us. I think 1/2 of that was that the parties being checked in were slow and inconsiderate that other people were waiting so I don't really blame the Hilton. But never the less - when you check in at your equivolent of 4am, you want you're room key and don't have much time for small talk. This could very well be an East Coast /West Coast thing but I don't think anyone minds efficiency at that hour. Overall we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: scooterchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed Halloween weekend on the offer of sitting through a 2 hour time-share presentation for the Hilton Grand Vacation Club - we had never participated in this process before - it was interesting and a great idea for those that travel 2 or more weeks per year - it's just we were NOT prepared to buy ON THE SPOT! To the tune of two to three thousand dollars on a $28,000 vacation club purchase ($485 month)...again, great value once paid off, but they were not happy when we wouldn't make the decision right there and then - we don't make those snap decisions when spending that kind of money - sorry! The room was fabulous, newly renovated, roomy and confortable - nice kitchen as well...the entire property was great...nice pool, great workout room and nice deli/store. it's alittle ways from the main strip (across st. from Sarah Casino/Hotel) however, we did walk from the Mirage to the Hilton GVC (about 1.3 miles) and it wasn't a bad walk (during the daylight). Overall, we would recommend this hotel for a stay and if you are in the market for a time-share, Hilton has a great offer with the HH Point system to go anywhere worldwide!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not free parking!”
Reviews.Author: cveye
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the strip but far enough to need a car. We were disappointed that the parking wasn't free b/c everywhere else in Vegas is for free! Overall, nice and quiet hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the strip with an off-the-strip feeling.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Sellers
Reviews.Content: This particular Hilton is on the strip, located near Circus Circus. I know, I know...a little out of all the action, right? The truth is, when you're on an extended stay and at the end of the day you're ready for some rest, this hotel is perfect! Seeing that it's not in the heart of the strip and does not have a casino, it's very quiet at night. I didn't experience any of the late night drunken fools screaming through the halls! When we were ready to hit the excitement, we went across the street and used the Monorail from the Sahara. The pool area was gorgeous, relaxing and had a tropical get away feeling to it. Our room was immaculate, had a decent sized fridge, dishes and a coffee pot that made it perfect to bring some of our meals. Over all, we loved this hotel and plan on staying there again the next time we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, not the best you can get in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sursin240382
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vegas HGVC on the Strip during a two week trip to the US. We got here after ten days in Alaska and Yosemite so were really looking forward to some luxury after the great outdoors. We had taken up a promotion for two nights, to which we tagged a third night. The overall price for 3 nights was $250, so certainly excellent VFM. The hotel is located right at one end of the strip near the Sahara, and about a twenty minute walk from the main action, starting with the Wynn, Encore and Treasure Island moving onto the Palazzo, Venetian, Caesar's and Bellagio (about 30 minutes walk away) The hotel is great for being in a quieter part of the strip, but is not well-located if you want to be in the thick of the action. The rooms are more of the apartment format with 1-2 bedroom suites and studios equipped with kitchens and living rooms. It has a food court which is incredibly overpriced, no restaurant and won't even provide a toothbrush without you paying for it! There are absolutely no freebies like in other hotels, the pool is quite small and the service is inconsistent. However the staff are polite though not terribly efficient or friendly, the location is not a deal-killer especially if you want to get some peace. It did not have a casino but I personally didn't mind since I was planning on playing at the more famous casinos anyway, and it means the hotel is less crowded when you get back at night. There is a monorail but single rides are surprisingly expensive and cabs are only slightly more expensive for a couple (the usual distance we travelled was between the Bellagio / Caesar's and our hotel) There were no benefits to being a Hilton Honors Gold member which was surprising since that violated the terms of Gold membership. But we didn't argue the point. Negative points to the staff member at reception for that though. The equipmentn the hotel is outdated (the handle on the drier just came off in my hand, the TVs are not flatscreen in this day and age) The really annoying thing was that the hairdryer shorted which caused a lot of inconvenience to my wife since it happend as we were just going out and didn't have time to ask for someone to come fix or replace it. We did go to the casino at the Las Vegas Hilton, a 15 minute walk away off the Strip. This was bigger with a casino and some pretty good restaurants (try the teppanyaki , I had the most amazing meal of my holiday here) However, the casino was like a morgue compared to the Bellagio or Caesar's. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel on one of Hilton's offers since the value for money is spectacular. But not really on any other count.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small room - ugly location”
Reviews.Author: gwlj
Reviews.Content: Read Tripadvisor reviews about this property before I went to Las Vegas; most are right on. If you want a room that is not smaller than most better hotel rooms, insist on a one bedroom suite. The "studio" that was offered us on the time share presentation deal was not really a satisfactory offering for someone trying to sell you something. The time share presentation was overall not a bad experience. The one bedroom has great kitchen, is very roomy and includes washer dryer. The staff and all other functions of the hotel were great. If you don't mind the distance from most strip activity then this might be the choice for you. CVS pharmacy next door is the best part of the neighborhood. Worst part of stay was the $8:00 per day charge for self parking. Try for a waiver. We moved to Bellagio with one night still left on our prepaid deal.

Reviews.Title: “I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: kittykat1960
Reviews.Content: The staff was so friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and luxurious. The king-size bed was the most comfortable that I have ever had at a hotel- the linens were so crisp and wonderful feeling. The suite had beautiful furnishings in cool desert colors and there was even a washer and dryer. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful with a glassed-in shower and the bedroom also had a large bathtub. I loved it and felt like I was treated like royalty. I can't wait to enjoy it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option on the strip without casino”
Reviews.Author: blu816305
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I only stayed for a weekend but the accomodations were very comfortable. It is at the top of the strip but not too far away from the main attactions. I recommend having a car. There is no casino in the hotel which is great for people who don't gamble and there is no lingering smoke smell everywhere like the other casino hotels on the strip. The service was very good and the rooms were HUGE. I had a full kitchen, separate bedroom, living room area and big bathroom. Great for a family. I thought the tub in the bedroom was a bit weird but maybe some people like that. The pool was a good size and the pool bar served pretty good food. The timeshare people weren't too pushy so it's was a great deal for about an hour and a half of my time. Free internet was appreciated also.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo for the money better than just a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: scarlett329
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 nite before moving on to my sisters timeshare elsewhere. I was very impressed with the hotel/condo. The kitchen was fullsize with granite countertops and the whole unit was decorated very nicely with a separate bedroom and bath. The downside as others have said is the location. The upside is that it is easily located right off of the freeway. It is within walking distance to Circus Circus and The Riviera and a CVS. I did not feel in danger at all walking from there at night. One person could easily LIVE in this unit fulltime so no complaints there. So for what you get the value and quality is certainly there. I paid $119 for 1 Saturday nite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & service for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gd_grrrl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times for business and each time the service both for the meeting and sleeping rooms has been excellent. Drawbacks are no casino and valet only parking at 8.00/night however that makes it perfect for a near smoke free experience and pretty inexpensive for valet... hard to find in Vegas. I would recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure, the 2 room suites have a wonderful spa tub, separate shower, kitchen and dining table for 4. Great rates for a Vegas suite. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: joecoolestkoon
Reviews.Content: my husband and I normally don't select this sort of place for travel, but we got a call from Hilton Grand Vacations offering us a inexpensive two night stay, provided we attend a 30-45 minute sales pitch. The presentation was friendly, but high pressure and TWO & A HALF HOURS LONG. we declined because we tend to be more adventurous and spontaneous, and we're big fans of traveling off the beaten path. I will say, in all my years of serious travel-including being in the travel industry for over five years-I've never had this happen: my husband went to sit in the jacuzzi for less than 10 minutes. When he got out his swimsuit was ruined. What had been dark blue was now a light cream-brown. We told the life guard and she said "Wow, that can't be good." She assured us she would get an engineer, who never did appear. And they never shut the jacuzzi down. We went over to warn a couple who had just got in before leaving the pool area. We went to the Concierge Desk and let them know. I mean, my husband just sat for a brief period of time in chemicals strong enough to bleach his only swimsuit for our vacation. We needed it for the rest of our itinerary. While the woman asked for our room number, no one ever contacted us to apologize or try to make up for the loss. The suit had to be thrown out and we had to buy a new one. In addition to the travel industry I manage a small business. I go out of my way to make it up to a customer if something goes wrong. I was surprised this didn't happen at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the strip but paper thin walls make sleeping impossible”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelGirl09
Reviews.Content: I was a bit fooled by this Hilton, which is a Hilton hotel but actually a timeshare, so I felt I was somewhat harassed (maybe too strong a word) by staff to get "cheap show tickets", which actually meant I had to listen to a timeshare speech! I had no idea this was a Hilton timeshare until the front desk advised me. It was good value at $89/night on the strip, albeit about a 10 min walk north of the Wynn, but my biggest issue were the paper thin walls. I could hear conversations from the rooms next door, in their entirety! Absolutely ridiculous and unacceptable. Feel sorry for the poor losers who bought timeshares there. Next time, i'll stay a bit further south on the strip, where no one will try to entice me with timeshare offers. Free wi-fi worked well but the business center is not free! Good swimming pool and good prices for drinks/food by the pool are some of the redeeming qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Only one problem”
Reviews.Author: stubenposters
Reviews.Content: The lobby's great, pool is beautiful, staff is friendly and the rooms (we stayed in a 1 BR suite which we obtained via a time-share exchange) were nice. The only drawback is the location -- in a depressing area (surrounded by run-down hotels and abandoned-in-mid-construction hi-rises) that's a $10 cab ride from the center of the strip. If you're a family with kids, it's perfect. Otherwise, if you're looking for a nice hotel, I'd suggest something further down on the strip -- you can always get a good buy in Las Vegas, especially when you include the $40 a day you'll probably be spending for cabs (that's two roundtrips to the strip).

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: larsondl
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Hilton on 8/19. The hotel was great. Everyone there was very helpful and friendly. I would say the down fall to this place is the location. It is quite a ways from the action of the strip so we had a to take a taxi every time we went out. That gets quite expensive!!! When we went to the presentation the next day we were really dreading it, but I have to say we were surprised at the way we were treated. It was not as bad as we had anticipated. The worst part is it take some of your time that you could be in the pool:) So in the end we would not stay there again, but only because of location. Once they get some of the new place built that are around it, it may not be so bad though.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelalot1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful for extended stays or for families. This hotel also accepts AAA so you can get a better deal on rooms. I love that the one-bedroom suites have full kitchens with plenty of space to spread out. This hotel room is larger than some apartments in NYC! The beds are comfortable with soft linens and you don't feel like you are sleeping with cardboard. The rooms are also equipped with safes so you can lock up some of your valuables. There is a marketplace on the first floor that sells cereal, packaged foods, slices of pizza and breakfast items. But if you don't want to spend a gazillion dollars you can go to the CVS store right next door t buy the same items at a slightly cheaper price. My only complaint and it is really no fault of the hotel was the loud father that decided his daughter was dressed a little to vampy for her age. I’m sure he was right but the whole floor didn’t have to know about it. It took a couple of calls for hotel security to come and tell the guy to cool down. But overall I feel the hotel is safe. I didn’t have a car so I don’t know about the valet, but there were always taxis waiting. Or you are in short walking distance to the Sahara if you want to jump on the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel do not honor commitments to customers”
Reviews.Author: carboman0
Reviews.Content: I have used Hilton Hotels in the pass for my travel stay. Because they did not honor the commitment to me, I will no longer do business with Hilton Family Hotel. In March I went on a Las Vegas Grand Hilton Vacation, 2650 south Las Vegas BLVD, promotion (no.57418275). I was promised a $200 stay at a Hilton Hotel. Twice I applied for the rebate and was denied for varies reasons that was never told to me before. I still get email to come back and promising me more gifts that they want deliver. This was very misleading and I feel that other people need to know how they do business. I feel that this vacation package for this Time Share also will not deliver what they promise. You could be stuck with a maintenance contact payment for life you can't get out of. Jesse Singletary

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fliegersternchen
Reviews.Content: I was two times in this Hotel. Very nice pool area, big rooms, very friendly staff, on the Las Vegas Strip and many attractions in walking distance. This hotel has no casino, which is very nice. Perfekt hotel for short or longer stay on the stip ! Transport from LAS Internatioal Airport apprx. 15min .

Reviews.Title: “Select Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdUrias
Reviews.Content: We were introduced to this hotel by Hilton calling our home with the prospect of selling us a timeshare which we already own from another source. I got a decent room rate for this two day stay ($89), but no one mentioned that I won't be getting points under my Hilton Honors program, nor the $8 daily parking fee. Front desk personnel had incorrectly keyed our cards, so when we waited 15 minutes for a available elevator, we had to wait for Security an additional 15 minutes to come up and let us in our rooms. We waited until we needed to leave the hotel to get additional room keys. It would have been a great idea to have more elevators to accomodate the guests on this property that has over 28 floors. Interesting variety of guests who stayed at this hotel, and I'm of the opinion that not all had an adequate credit rating to be considered for a timeshare purchase. This leads me to beleive that anyone can make a room reservation at this property! Timeshare presentation was an interesting process and the continental breakfast was nothing to praise! After the two hour ordeal the timeshare sales personnel had tore up the timeshare quotes in front of me and my spouse as a final "insult" for politely declining their offer. We gathered up our "freebies" and left. Never again will I participate in a Hilton timeshare presentation or stay at HGV property. Ed Urias Hilton Honors Diamond Member since 2001

Reviews.Title: “Chaos and Noise with Typical Resort Nickel and Diming as Well. All Without a Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Genghisdon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hilton Grand Vacation property for a three day stint for work in Las Vegas. I chose this place based on previous reviews, and hoping that the casino/hotels would be the places that attracted the throngs of people I was hoping to avoid. I was quick to discover how wrong I was when I checked in. While the check-in process was efficient, the main lobby area was MOBBED with people either who were similar to me in using the place as a hotel, potential timeshare owners on a free junket, or existing timeshare owners. This situation must be a pretty regular occurrence if you consider the property has two buildings with 29 floors each that all converge in the lobby or pool area. So it was quickly apparent my chances of a quiet weekend stay were shot. The room I got was by far a really nice suite - granite counter tops, awesome bed, and spacious. However, I certainly hope my room was not one they give to visiting potential viewers, as my view was at the parking garage and a huge dirt lot filled with construction materials. To be honest, I don't think there is a way to get a room with a decent view when you look at what surrounds the area around the resort - there's the bankrupt 68 story Fountainebleau on one side (nothing like staring out the window at a deteriorating, partially constructed mega hotel), the parking garage (my view), or the side of the Sky condominium tower. The pool area, as mentioned in other reviews, was ENTIRELY too small for the number of rooms and guests the resort supports. I walked out to an area teeming with people both in and out of the pool. Again, the view from the pool are was a depressing situation, as the Fountainebleau, Sky, Circus Circus, and facility air handlers all look down on an area that in meant to be a little more serene. The final piece of my experience (which made me check out a day early) was the fact that the longer you stay, the more "nickel and dimed" you feel about the place. Valet parking was $13 per day (Self Parking was $8), the Waves restaurant was skewering folks at $10 for a drink, and the Marketplace was charging 3 X the price of things being sold next door at the CVS. However, walking to the CVS was challenging, since the property is not in a very nice area of the strip, so getting hit up for change was a constant part of the experience. I am not the biggest fan of Vegas, but I think I will avoid the HGVC and all Strip-based operations when I come back.

Reviews.Title: “No return visit expected”
Reviews.Author: U646
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nights at this property. When we pulled in there was a group of obviously impaired young ladies hanging around outside and in the lobby carrying a case of beer. I thought this was a spring break hotel. This was a sign of a rather unpleasant stay. This property is a timeshare however it is clear anyone can get a room here. They seem to attract large groups wanting to party and make noise all night. The hallways are very loud and sounds carry. Between the young kids running down the hall yelling and the older kids drinking all night we found it difficult to sleep. The room itself is fine. The exercise room is well equipped and clean. The pool is too small for the number of rooms here. They really need to double the pool area. They have a Marketplace to buy food. The prices are very high. Walk to the CVS nearby rather than pay the jacked up prices here. Anyone who stays here should have a car. Very little is nearby. Don't expect free parking like all other Las Vegas hotels. Here you pay, even when you self-park. FREE INTERNET WAS A BIG PLUS!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: TRsacto
Reviews.Content: Being that it was 112 dgrees when I arrived a nice resort hotel was a welcome sight. The hotel is very nice with great excercise room, grill and pool complex. The staff was very professional and always acknowleded guests throughout the complex. The room was a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen and flat screen TV's in both the living room and bedroom. It was very comfortable. and with my car I was just a few minutes from the center of the strip. If I didn't already have a Las vegas time-share, I'd really consider having a place at the Hilton Grand. Very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CTRight
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two room suite for two nights. Our room was immaculate, with a nice floor plan and quality furnishings and bedding. It had a full kitchen, washer and dryer, very nice bathroom, and whirlpool tub. Check-in was efficient and every staff person we passed greeted us pleasantly. The pool area is lovely, with hot tubs, both shady and sunny areas and grills available for use. There is a convenience store/deli and game room on site. We did not mind the walk to the strip, but some may prefer to take a taxi. All in all a very positive experience. We loved the Bellagio fountain and conservatory.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the true benefits of ownership! Convenient to the strip without the hassle”
Reviews.Author: ohjames
Reviews.Content: The suites in this hotel are spotless, spacious, and well appointed. Each and every staff member here treats you as if they've known you for years! Friendly, amicable, and articulate - from the desk help to the cleaning staff. Take advantage of a cabana for around $100 (5 hours). They're well stocked and the service staff checks in often to see if you want drinks or food. Wonderful pool with lots of trees. Nice bar at the pool and attendants EVERYWHERE!! Downstairs is a coffeeshop/ grocery/ deli/ pastry section. The only complaint here is that we often saw the coffee shop fully staffed with people that didn't know how to speak english, or couldn't understand it well. it created confusion on more than one occasion (though not with us...we were waiting in line). This was going to be our only trip to Vegas (ever), but we may come back purely to experiance this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE”
Reviews.Author: texigator
Reviews.Content: When Hilton Honors called to me pitch this time share, I should have known better. I made the false assumption that they would treat their Diamond guests well. I was wrong. The room had a wonderful view-of a WALL. We stayed up most of the night on our first night in Vegas only to have the hotel call us at 9:45 in the morning to remind us of our 2:00 PM appointment, effectively destroying our much needed rest, which was restless anyway, due to a very soft bed that had box springs which gave it the feel of a trampoline. Then, the kids that were running up and a down the hallway highlighted the design that somehow amplifies the sound and projects it into the room. The property itself is situated at the north end of the Strip and really is out of the way from most of what the Strip has to offer. The charge for the self parking that was a hike from the hotel was a surprise. The unbelievably early check-out time of 10:00 AM is a special feature as well. The bottom line is, time share is a ripoff and this property is a time share. If you want to have a relaxing, enjoyable stay, there are many, many far better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service / Great Room”
Reviews.Author: kckorville
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom unit in Tower 2 on the 31st floor. 31st floor and above are categorized as 1 Bedroom Plus units if you are an HGVC member. The resort refers to all of these floors as penthouse level. We have stayed here on several occasions and the difference in these rooms from a standard 1 bedroom seems to be floor to ceiling windows, a Bose lifestyle stereo system with true surround sound system, a larger flat panel TV and an upgraded shower with 4 shower heads. Other than that the rooms seemed to be the same size. We had exceptional service on this trip. We hosted an early evening party in our room and housekeeping brought up extra glasses and even extra chairs for us to use in the room. Service was prompt and professional. As a result we hosted a great party. Facility was in great shape and room likewise was in great shape. We bought day access to the Spa one day and enjoyed the facilities. Day access is $10 per person. Pool area was busy but we always found chairs. They have cabanas for rent starting at about $125 for 3 hours. We did not rent one but they contain a TV, safe and fridge. The packages they sell include a few waters etc. Pools have recently been refurbished and were in excellent condition. CVS next door is open 24 hrs a day and has a good selection of beer and liquor. Prices at CVS are fair. Not as good as WalMart but way better than the store at HGVC. As others have said this resort does not have a casino and there is not one right next door. Sahara is closest to walk to but otherwise you need a cab or the deuce. Taxis are readily available at the resort and the deuce stops right in front of the resort. We don’t mind travelling to our destination for the evening and so a casino in the hotel is not a priority for us but it may be for others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you want to be away from the Main Strip noise!”
Reviews.Author: QFP
Reviews.Content: Awesome, perfect, spotless, friendly are just some of the words to describe this property. We've been here before and now that both towers are done, we absolutely loved it. Had our daughter, son-in-law and grandkids with us and the 2 bedroom was plenty big enough for us all. Beautiful pool, friendly staff from the moment you walk in. Loved staying here and will again. If you want to be right in the middle of the action, try and get into the Hilton Grand Vacation Club at the Flamingo Hilton. You can't beat the Hilton properties. They sure know how to do timeshare resorts right! Wish we owned one of them also but we already have enough. Traded into this wonderful property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: KayDye
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was looking for a quieter place for the family to stay, as we are not gamblers. I only stayed one night. The room was nice with a large sitting area, beautiful ceramic tile and a large bedroom with very comfy pillows and mattress. The jetted tub was very large and deep. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. There were separate HVAC controls for the bedroom and the sitting area. However, the road noise was so bad that I had trouble sleeping. I was awakened by it throughout the night. Our room was an exterior room next to the strip, maybe an interior room would have been better. The staff was very helpful and agreed to keep our luggage for us while we strolled around Las Vegas. This was okay for the price (which was a bit high for Las Vegas), but it was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices for the Money”
Reviews.Author: luggageinhand
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in a one-bedroom suite. The apartment itself was nice sized and the design was good. We were two adults so I took the hide a bed and my friend had the bedroom. Maybe kids could sleep ok on the hide a bed but it was very hard. Our condo was on the 2nd floor. The toilet would gurgle and spit out water all over the floor and the smell was horrible. Had to have maintenance come a couple times to put stuff in the lines but it just continued. They said it was very common in this building on the lower floors. Avoid the 2nd floor at all costs at this complex. You also have to walk through the entire Flamingo casino, the pool area and around the backside to reach the front of the condo. I wouldn't really call it a strip location. On the plus side the employees were extremely friendly and helpful. Would I stay here again... probably not with all the choices right on the strip for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some major problems there!”
Reviews.Author: Cresentina
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms that come with fridge, microwave, extended cable TV, etc. (the larger suites have a real kitchen). Would have loved to use our mini-kitchen, but unfortunately, no dishes, etc. were provided. Doesn't quite make sense... We liked that the whole place as non-smoking and didn't have a casino, so no smoke could drift towards the rooms. The place has a very pricy deli store, and it has an internet cafe that was also rather expensive. Also the pool was not heated despite the fact that their website said it would be. The area felt kind of shady and we didn't dare walking down the strip from there. Lots of construction going on around it, but I'm not sure if there's any place around the strip where that isn't the case. The worst part was that even with all room doors closed, we could easily follow conversations held by people in the hallway or the rooms next door... Overall, we felt that there were too many problems with this place to make up with its advantages. We wouldn't stay there again, not even for a very low room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Less Hectic”
Reviews.Author: TexasLovingVegas
Reviews.Content: Just completed an eight day stay at the HGVC Las Vegas Strip. I was a little skeptical about the location as the reviews I read indicated that the hotel was too far away from the "action". I must say I found the location to be perfect for me. I travel to Vegas at least every 6 mos or so. I did not miss the "action"! Because the hotel has a bus stop right out front I could get to the "action" anytime I wanted! The transportation system just introduce a new line called the Aces Gold, along with The Deuce (the regular bus line). The Aces only hits certain stops which gets you down the strip in record time! The hotel has a great pool, and fabulous rooms! I stayed in a king suite, equipped with a full size kitchen, washer and dryer and a jacuzzi bath tub! It's like living in your own little apartment, and I loved it! The small convenience shop on the first floor offered everything you could imagine for a really high expense. Go to the CVS next door. It's a little higher than most, but a lot cheaper than the store in the hotel. Keep in mind for those who like to gamble that this is a no gaming hotel. Each day there was always someone cleaning, checking on you, and fulfilling your requests within record time. The hotel is beautiful and the grounds are really nice. I loved the pool area! I just thought it closed too early...10:00 pm. Other than that I really enjoyed my stay. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed: It's just a hotel room with a toaster - not a studio...”
Reviews.Author: Jorton
Reviews.Content: I needed to be closer to the strip for a couple of days so I moved from the Hilton Garden Inn to this one. When I got to my room, it was somewhat smaller than the room I had just come from... and this was supposed to be a studio??? Although I have to admit, there was a nice toaster and along with the smallest of benches. There is a deli come coffee shop pizzaria sort of like a mini 7/11 but lacks a restaurant or bar. I would not have been surprised to see Mickey & Minnie standing in line behind me. This is not my cup of tea and would not recommend it for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay and even more disappointing lack of follow up on feedback”
Reviews.Author: skb1405
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in 1 bedroom suite which was very basic and was of a poor quality in all aspects - toilet not working on arrival, bedside lamps not working, no main light in bedroom, dishwasher still full, very slow internet and woke in morning with what appeared to be bed bug bites from the pillow across my shoulders, ears and hands. Checked out and filled in online form about our stay - received NOTHING in terms of email, acknowledgement etc from Hilton. Followed up with faxes to the HGV property itself and Hilton Customer Service Centre - still not one word of correspondence, feedback or apology. Disappointing stay and even more disappointing, no response from Hilton to online forms or faxes with issues raised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place to spend the weekend and relax.”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouseandme
Reviews.Content: We own in RCI and stayed for the weekend at this new property. It is certainly arranged different than the resorts in Orlando where we have stayed before. I have read some of the other reviews and would agree that it is not the best location (at the end of the strip) away from all of the main attractions. However, our room, a one bedroom, was quiet, comfortable and spacious. We had a full kitchen which we used minimally during our stay, a washer and dryer in the room (which we did not use). I was really impressed by the bed/bedding----very comfortable. Nice walk-in shower, which we agree we would like one similar in 'our next home'. The staff were all friendly and helpful. It would have been nice to have a full service restaurant at the hotel since it is located away from much of the 'action', but as I recall, there was no full service restaurant at the resort in Orlando either. We had a rental car and used the parking garage, very friendly attendants.

Reviews.Title: “vegas re visited”
Reviews.Author: tony4848
Reviews.Content: wanted a hotel without casino and this proved an excellent choice superb room only down side was location lot of building work going on around so the walk home at night is not recommended. taxis expensive due to traffic jams

Reviews.Title: “a bit of peace and quiet in vegas”
Reviews.Author: CatmanLondon
Reviews.Content: Shared a pair of adjoining apartments with family, although a bit 90 's dated they were well appointed and comforable for several nights. We didn't make much use of the cooking facilities as eating out is the thing to do when in Vegas but for folks on a budget or with small children full facilities would make cooking a straight forward experience. The hotel is away from the main part of the action but only a short walk from the Sahara and Stratosphere casinos so a quiet night/day sleep always ensued - very useful in the 24hr action of Vegas. There was also a decent pool and sun lounge area for guests tended by friendly waiters and servers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CleBear
Reviews.Content: This time share property was excellent value for the money. I have been to Vegas on business many times over the years, so casinos don't thrill me... the hotel is clean, well managed, the rooms are what you would expect from a Hilton. Overall, a nice property with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' get ripped off"”
Reviews.Author: ConnieLongBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at HGV with our cousins taking advantage of a Time Share promotional package thru Hilton Honors. All four of us have been to Las Vegas many times and have stayed in various hotels over the years. We are seasoned travellers. Unlike the other reviews I have seen, we thought the beds were fine, location ok and the walls quite thick enough to keep out he noise. Our complaint was that the deluxe studio is about the size of a ship's cabin and very dark with few amenities...only 2 wine glasses, a TINY bathroom without even a fan and the partial kitchen is a very small counter across from the bathroom. I don't see how anyone could live in this room for a week! However, my main complaint is with the Time Share program. The gal that hosted us was fine but the staff at the gift desk tried to cheat us out of our promised $100 gift certificate for a Hilton hotel and $50 worth of chips. Instead, she said we were to receive a $50 certificate to the las Vegas Hilton and $15 in chips to use there. I complained and after some arguing was given a $200 Hilton gift certificate...I had to select which Hilton property I wanted and was then also the $50 and $15 in chips for th eHilton. They tried to cheat our cousins as well but I intervened on their behalf. My husband and I own two time shares and have been to several talks and have NEVER been cheated out of promised gifts. This was a terrible experience...I recommend thinking twice before going the this property and if you do go, don't let them rip you off!!

Reviews.Title: “First class management, safe stop away from home!”
Reviews.Author: gracegarden
Reviews.Content: While on the road for 40-days with my kids, this planned stop in Las Vegas turned out to be a welcomed refuge. We are Hilton Grand timeshare owners in Orlando, so we were able to use our points, then Open Season, to reserve our time here on the Strip. Because I had been suffering from high altitude illness and dehydration from my days prior to arriving in Las Vegas, I arrived at the Hilton Grand very ill. Our first impression of the hotel was fantastic. We were greeted by Robert in Bell Service, who expertly loaded nearly an entire van full of luggage onto one cart and got us safely tucked into our room. Later that evening, we met Wayne, a fantastic security guard, who gave the kids sheriff's badges. The hotel is at a perfect location, walking distance to Circus Circus, a next-door CVS, and being on the strip, taxi rides are $10-20 to every venue you would need to go to, so we never had to move our car or worry about parking elsewhere. I asked for management to call an ambulance for me the second night that I was there, as I thought at the time that I was having a heart attack. I was at Caesar's Palace, sightseeing, when my symptoms hit, and I grabbed a taxi to take me to the hospital. The taxi driver claimed not to know the way to the hospital and took me to the hotel instead. When I arrived at the hotel, I immediately saw Robert, who called the night manager, Bob and Wayne was also called, which was very comforting, since both the kids and I "knew" them. While we waited for the ambulance to arrive, Bob, Scott, Wayne and Robert, took care of us, calling housekeeping to bring the kids a warm blanket and directing the ambulance to us. The housekeeper came out and literally tucked the kids into the blanket. While the paramedics checked me out in the privacy of the ambulance, Robert and Wayne comforted the kids, as did Bob, and then the paramedic advised that, based on my symptoms, that I go to the nearby hospital, but informed me that Las Vegas law mandates that children under the age of 16 have to be taken into protective custody if accompanying a parent in the hospital - they cannot just stay in my room. So, I made the difficult decision to have my teen babysit my younger child in the condo, while I was taken away in an ambulance. Night manager Bob, Wayne and Robert assured me that they would get the kids to the room safely, lock them in, and check on them throughout the evening. Evening turned into a very long night for me at the hospital, and fortunately, I was able to keep tabs on the kids via cellphone from ER. The hotel management called my kids every hour, asking them if they needed water or food, and they updated my husband by phone as well. I cannot begin to tell you how invaluable it was to know that the kids were safe in this unfortunate and emergency situation. I know there are many parents out there who leave their kids in hotel rooms or even at home alone all of the time, but I am not one of those parents. I have never left even my teen alone much at home, much less a hotel in Las Vegas, but if this had to happen, thank goodness it was someplace like the Hilton Grand. We were treated like VIPs the entire time we were there, and even after I returned to the hotel room in the early hours of morning, both Wayne and Robert called at least once a day to check in on us. Wayne brought the kids Easter candy and a special gift for my youngest, and I discovered that in this big world and sometimes less than desirable reputation of Las Vegas, there are some incredibly honest and caring people. We had to extend our stay at the Hilton Grand so that I could recouperate before moving on the road, and we were comfortable and very at home. The kids enjoyed swimming in the pool, loved the convenience of the marketplace, and spent some time in the game room. I enjoyed catching up on laundry in the in-room washer/dryer and cooking a few meals in the full kitchen. Although we did eventually get to enjoy some of the sights and sounds of Las Vegas, the hospitality, honesty and impressive customer care and genuine interpersonal communication is what I will remember most about Vegas because of the care we received at the Hilton Grand. As far as the rooms, decor, etc., everything is much more beautiful when you find out you are not having a heart attack and instead severely dehydrated, but the beds, sheets and towels are top of the line, housekeeping brought us anything we needed (extra blankets, extra towels, extra toiletries, pillows, etc), and the concierge and front desk had every answer we needed at their fingertips (show times, etc.). This is a first-class hotel, and it appears to be fantastic shape, and I didn't see any problems with the furniture, bathrooms, etc. Nothing was in disrepair, fading or otherwise. I wouldn't hesitate choosing this hotel for its convenience and upscale ambiance, but overall, I highly recommend it because the management and staff are among the finest people that I have met in a long time. Thank you, HGVC.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: beautyofsoul
Reviews.Content: Was a group of 15 people and booked four suites and got a good deal. The rooms were spacious and room service was exceptional. This is on the corner of the strip so end up walking a bit to get to the places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - away from the madness”
Reviews.Author: tonyk17
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week here, through a timeshare exchange. As noted by others this hotel is not on the main part of the Strip, but that's no bad thing. The quality of the hotel and rooms was very good, we had a 1 bedroom suite and an adjoining studio which was ideal for our needs. As we were there on an RCI timeshare exchange I don't have a cost for the rooms, but all I can say is that the equivalent rooms in a hotel on the main part of the Strip would have cost us a fortune. Outlook from hotel not great, lots of unfinished hotels, but that was OK. Visited lots of hotels on the Strip, a short bus ride or walk away. HGV is about 1 mile from the Wynn and about 2 miles from The Bellagio, a nice walk after a big breakfast at the Peppermill. If you stay at the HGV I would recommend the Peppermill for breakfast, a great Vegas diner. Deuce stops right outside the hotel for an easy way of getting to the action, and Downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody, as long as you aware that you are a mile or 2 away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, terrible location, no amenities”
Reviews.Author: CrLmJmOr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days/3 nights at the HGV Las Vegas Strip. What a mistake. Should have realized I guess that a condo based hotel wouldn't be ideal in Vegas, but now won't forget next time. Rooms are fine -- even nice. Kitchenette, 1 bedroom, nice bathroom. Beds are terrible, particularly the hide-a-bed. Don't get a one bedroom and expect to sleep someone on the hide-a-bed, not even a child. Big problem however is the location. It is on the "Strip" in the same way that Alaska is in the United States. Way down by Circus Circus and The Sahara, with absolutely no amenties anywhere. Want to eat? Better plan on walking 15 minutes, getting a cab, or buying groceries and cooking in your room. Want the quintessential Las Vegas buffet? Forget about it -- only restaurant is a lame little deli/store that got our order completely wrong both times we used it. Casino? Again, get a cab or walk 15 minutes. See the "real" strip -- Bellagio, etc? 15 minute cab ride or the horribly unpredictable and slow "Deuce" bus -- another thing to avoid (drops you off across from the hotel on the wrong side of 6 lane Las Vegas blvd in a construction zone with no crosswalk or light). Seeing or doing any of the key sights in Vegas is a huge hassle from this place. Stay at a real hotel is our recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Las Vegas to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: havefuninthesun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Spring Break week in Las Vegas. My husband had booked us at the Hilton Vacation Club on the strip close to the Stratosphere and Sahara Hotels. Our room was a spacious 2 bedroom unit with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, comfortable beds & furnishings, and the 2nd bedroom had it's own mini kitchen and bath. My teenage daughter was comfortable having her own area in the unit and my teenage son just loved sleeping on the sofa. The room had large picture windows overlooking Circus Circus and in the background the mountains. We had a car and used the parking garage at no extra charge since we were RCI members.
