Everything was great. We felt like in an apartment with plenty of space for all. The Hilton staff was very nice and attentive. Our kids enjoyed lounging by the pool (heated) and also used the activitiy center pool table, ping pong, big screen TV, and foosball table. My only negative was that we could hear a baby crying in the next room over from the master bedroom around 3:00am the first evening. We saw that those people had moved out the next day and heard little disturbance from any new neighbors. You may want to take earplugs with if you are a light sleeper. Also, beware that the area surrounding Stratosphere beyond the Las Vegas Blvd can be very dangerous to walk around. We spoke to a police officer and he said as long as we walked together and stayed on the strip we would be safe, but pointed to side streets that we should avoid. There is a great police presence in Las Vegas, you will see them with their yellow jackets and bicycles all over the strip and in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: CMMlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Great service, love the washer and dryer in the room. Comfortable bedding and pillows. Unfortunately, could hear guests in the room next door talking, but earplugs cut out the sound for me. Our shower was a little odd. It made a strange ringing sound and at its hottest it was not very hot. Deli food left us wanting more and better quality. I would recommend venturing outside Hilton for dining. It was nice to be separate from the overwhelming area of the strip, but it's good for you to know that it's a bit far to walk to the center of the action and a cab ride is usually $8-12 depending on exactly where you want to end up, route taken, and traffic. For the price it was very decent, though personally, if I could afford it I would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Lally
Reviews.Content: What we loved best was their great pool area!!! This is a great spot at the end of the strip. We rented a car and the location at the end of the strip made it easy to drive in and out of the strip area, avoiding the traffic jams in the center strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value... But Beware of Call Backs from the Timeshare Promotion”
Reviews.Author: jennitravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first stay at the hotel back in August of 2009... We booked our trip after getting a call from Hilton offer discounted rates to do the tour. Reluctantly, I booked the 2 nights stayed with my credit card, and was promised several gifts once completing the tour. Weeks after booking, our trip was confirmed by a timeshare representative who added a 3rd night for free since we were driving out. The hotel was nice. Check in was easy. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite because we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary. The pool was pretty. We private rented cabanas and hung out by the pool most of our trip. We went on our 2 hour timeshare tour. We did not purchase but were still given the "gifts" we were promised. In January on 2010 I received a call from Hilton asking if we would like to come out again. Since construction was complete, they invited us to once again do the timeshare tour for discounted rates and gifts. So I decided to book the 2 night for my husband’s birthday. Weeks later, I called to confirm the reservation, and notify them that I never received the confirmation letter in the mail. During the call the representative realized that we had been on the tour 6 months prior. She placed me on hold and came back to explain that we didn’t qualify for the tour because we need to wait one year before touring again. She placed me on hold and returned to advise that we could stay at the hotel for the discounted rate, but were note eligible for the tour of gifts. I didn’t try to cancel, as we already had babysitters setup for the trip. I was however discouraged to learn about this little scam they are running. Remember, they called me to have us re-tour. Upon check in during March 2010, we were referred to a marketing rep. She was very nice and offered to upgrade us to a one bedroom after hearing about the "fast one" that was pulled. She blamed it on a computer glitch. We checked into our room, which was very clean. The one bedroom will very comfortably sleep a family of 4. At check in, you can choose between the 2 towers, one offers a flat panel tv, the other offers jets in the room bath tub. If you are going out for the timeshare tour, know that the hotel and staff are great. The marketplace has decent food. The rooms are clean and spacious. There is no casino on site (yay!). Just be cautious of any offers you are made on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great smoke free stay away from the traffic”
Reviews.Author: Everstil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a road trip honeymoon in January. Our first stop was in Vegas, and we wanted a hotel where we could feel like we were at home for the three nights we stayed, and not at a casino, we wanted a place we could get away and relax after our long drive, and after having fun each night. The HGVLVS has large suites with full kitchens, and in-room laundry machines. We also picked a room with a large jacuzzi to soak in. Neither of us smokes and my wife has asthma, so we wanted a hotel that would be comfortable for us and smoke free. I did a lot of research and the Hilton Grand Vacations Las Vegas Strip seemed like the hotel for us, especially after reading the reviews from others on TripAdvisor. The reviews described this hotel accurately, and it turned into a good pick for us. I liked the cleanliness of our room and the entire hotel. Room service is regular, and not disruptive. They made sure we had everything we needed daily...including laundry soap for the in-room washer. The location is away from the traffic congestion that is regular around other hotels, largely because the resort across the street is undergoing construction which has been slow and stalled at times. The location was perfect for us because I wanted to drive all over Las Vegas and beyond at will. Having quick access to the street without traffic was great. Driving around to destinations in Las Vegas is not everyones cup of tea, but if you are a good driver, and know where you want to go, Las Vegas has free parking at almost every Casino. So if you like being behind the wheel, know the area well, or have good GPS, I suggest driving from this Hotel. You will never be late for any shows you schedule because you missed the train or the bus. The location of the HGVLVS is not in a good place if you want to walk to the best parts of the strip, or ride the expensive monorail. On our first full day and night, we drove to the Paris Casino from the Hotel, parked for free and walked all around the strip, and afterward drove back to our peaceful hotel in less than five minutes. We got ready for our show then drove to the Venetian at night to see the Phantom. So the location was great for us. There is an outdoor pool which we never used because we had so much planned, but it looked like an awesome area to swim and soak in the sun. The HGVLVS has a deli style shop near the lobby. We never ate there because we had restaurants planned and we usually ate breakfast in our kitchen, that we stocked with a few groceries. The value was excellent, if you book at the right time, you can find deals for $100.00 a night or less for an apartment style luxury room. The hotel has beauty that that rivals some of the casinos, and is worth the stay. I also must mention what disappointed us though. There needs to be better areas to unload and check in for road trippers and people planning on stocking groceries in their kitchen for extended stays. After driving through all sorts of weather and spending 12 hours in our car, I wanted to just walk into the lobby check in, and then park the car somewhere close where we could unload the car ourselves, without a bell man or valet. I don't like a bell man toting around our road tripping gear, groceries, and dirty laundry through the lobby. So I decided to park in the only parking area they have before unloading which is nearly 100 yards from the rear entrance. So I hauled all our stuff from the parking garage across an uncovered and lonely sidewalk to the hotels rear entrance at night, all due to the fact I didn't want to be seen in the elegant lobby with all my back packs, food tubs, and laundry bags. That sucked. The hotel needs a covered walkway from the garage, because if you don't use a valet your walking a football field in the elements to your car. Also because this hotel is also a time share property prepare to be 'pitched to' at some point during or even before your stay if you pre-book. You can always politely refuse the offers though. Other negatives are no full service restaurant, and no indoor pool. The positives far out weigh the negatives. I recommend this hotel for people who like to drive, people who need to stay someplace smoke free, people who have families, people who plan to have a long stay in Vegas and need a large room, people who want to get away from the action at their hotel, and people who plan to cook their own food or dine at restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great time share hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lstenbeck
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Hilton grand on the strip. The room was perfect with a 2 bedroom suite for 2 couples. Love the full kitchen and washer and dryer! Beds were very comfortable. Nice layout in the unit, allows for privacy for both bedrooms. Pool area was very nice with a small bar and restarante .If you have the chance rent a car and venture away from the strip to see the Hoover Dam and Lake Mead. We also drove to Valley of Fire which was a great take. Recommend the helicopter ride to the western rim of the grand Canyon. Tom our tour guide was terrific. We went thru the internet and Stars and stripes for this trip. We enjoyed walking the strip and trying out different hotel venues each night for dinner. My favorite was Samba in the Mirage. Saw two shows , Cirque de soleil LOVE the beattles and Jersey Boys. Both were well worth the ticket. Also look online or go to the same day ticket place and purchase the tickets. No need to pay full price. The economy is really hursting this area so there are some great deals out there!! Would definately return to this hotel for the main reason that it is not a gaming hotel. It is a bit away from the big gaming hotels on the strip but all of them have free self parking or Taxi's are readily available. Take a trip to Freemont street at night for the experience. A really fun place to gamble and hang out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: LuvLVEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a studio rm adjoining a 2-bedroom at the HGV on the Strip Feb 18-25, 2010. Our rooms were on the 32nd floor. This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this property and I really like it. There was no noise from the traffic below or Fountainbleau construction site. No party animals running up and down the halls slamming doors and yelling. My suite was so soundproof I didn't even year noise from the main suite other than the water running in the bathroom. Security does a key check in the evenings for added security. All staff were friendly and helpful. Yes, it's far away from the busy-ness of the centre-Strip, but that's what I like about it. A quick taxi ride and you and in the heart of the action. Rarely will you wait more than a couple minutes here for a taxi. Circus Circus and Riviera are a short walk north or catch the Deuce downtown. The pool area is truly lovely although it was too cool to indulge in more than a dip in the hot tub. Next time we need to try the spa services.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: blodgett22
Reviews.Content: I think I was one of the youngest guests. It was quiet and the deli staff was GREAT! This was a great place to stay during my conference. Close to the light rail and not smokey like the main Hilton LV (Casino).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Sawwhetowls2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was non-smoking. I was thrilled with how quiet it was. We slept well, although the bed was a little harder than I'm used to. The suites were gorgeous and had everything we needed including a great view. We were on the 23rd floor so we had a view of mountains, and lovely view of the pool area too. The hotel concierge was very helpful in securing tickets to a show and we adored the bell hops, they were friendly and also helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for a quiet retreat away from the hussle and bustle of the strip uptown. My lungs appreciated the break from the smoke too! The spa was great and the marketplace cafe food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nursing Symposium”
Reviews.Author: dogtalker
Reviews.Content: A very large hotel, but fairly easy to navigate. Lots of good restaraunts and buffets easy access to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: RakiemW
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. I had such a good time and all accommodations were accounted for. I had a great room and I had great food. It was right on the strip and I had access to all shopping and events. Walked right down the street and checked out the Bellagio hotel and Ceasar's Palace. I would definitely do the trip again. It is also 50%-60% cheaper than the big name hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Classy Hotel/Condo”
Reviews.Author: ChuckB8
Reviews.Content: Loved this property. Beautiful architecture, interiors, grounds, pool and patio areas, and lobby! We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite with full kitchen, living room, large bath with separate glass shower and jacuzzi tub. Beautifully decorated and very comfortable with tile and marble through out. Has big flat sceen TV, great hospitality and service!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful hotel with extremely helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vix814
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation Club was a breath of fresh air. It was a beautiful refuge with a nice pool complex (which we unfortunately couldn't take advantage of because of the cold weather!), spa, fitness room, and other perks not available in all hotels. The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautiful. Our view wasn't the best (faced construction and Circus Circus hotel), but other views in the hotel were nice. The staff (from the bell service to the front desk to the employees in the Marketplace deli) were super helpful and extremely friendly. They always had smiles on and were willing to go above and beyond to help. It was refreshing to be in a non-smoking hotel, considering that everywhere else in Vegas seems to have no non-smoking areas. If you are a big gambler and need a casino in the lobby of the hotel, then this is not for you; however, if you don't mind going to another hotel to do your gambling and then going back to your hotel, then this is perfect. The only downside to the hotel is that it is on the less developed end of the strip, slightly farther from the action at the other end--there are fewer hotels in the area and some of the neighborhood can be a little sketchy, especially at night. Overall, it was a beautiful hotel and a great experience. I would definitely go back and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but decieving, ours is forsale.”
Reviews.Author: ZeroWyoming
Reviews.Content: After we bought it we found out it wasn't worth half of it's apraised valve. Now we can't sell it without loosing a lot of money. The annual fees are higher than they said they would be. It's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...bad Location!”
Reviews.Author: GirlsMomma09
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean room. Not so great location. The pool area is great! 4 hot tubs, 2 pools -- very nice. It was a bit chilly on our stay, however the hot tubs were SO relaxing after walking 900 miles each day LOL I would buy a nice new pair of tennis shoes before going to Vegas! Our room had a coffee maker (Starbucks), fridge, microwave, cabinets w/utensils & plates. The room was kinda hot... air was on the coolest possible but since it was chilly outside, it kept kicking off. Comfy bed, several pillows. Flat screen tv was nice w/a dvd player (& you can rent dvds downstairs as well). Very nice cleaning people -- we preferred not to have our room cleaned, but anything that we needed they gave us. There is a cvs right next door, they have everything you need....resonable pricing as well. Nice shower/bathroom. Marketplace is downstairs, kinda pricey -- but worth trying their lunchmeat & desserts. Walking around at night where the hotel is located is kinda iffy... The Sahara is right across the street, they offer 1.00 shots 1.00 beers each night, which was pretty cool. We figured out that we could ride the monoral from the Sahara to the main strip, there are 5 stops, comes every few minutes. I would NOT bother buying a ticket for the Deuce! They are always packed to the rim & never on time arriving to the stops. Definitely go down to see the Pawn Shop (Pawn Stars)!! (Its past the Statosphere, down a bit further). We took the Deuce down which wasent bad. Monoral is 30.00 for 3 days & the Deuce is 15.00 for 3 days I believe. Depends on your preference. Goto the Paris Eiffel Tower, watch the water show from the top, see the Volcano..! I mean, all in all... The Hilton was a great hotel, I would stay there again --- no casino inside, but its nice & low key. Next year we plan on taking our daughter w/us. This hotel does not give upgrades for Diamond members, etc -- so dont bother with that unless you want to pay the extra 35.00 a night. There are two other Hiltons in Las Vegas on the strip that DO give upgrades, but we figured this was the nicest out of them all. The staff at the hotel actually sent a basket up to our room on our last day for our anniversary. Which was beyond nice of them, which was filled with all sorts of goodies & wine. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone thinking about staying for leisure w/either their family, or even by themselves. It was truely a great experince & we do plan on returning next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: RSShasta312
Reviews.Content: these were very clean, beautiful rooms. There was some construction going on outside at the building next door, but couldn't hear it at all. We were there over New Year's Eve. The staff was wonderful and so helpful. It is a short walk anywhere. It's on the less traveled end of the strip which we liked. It does not have casino games inside so you don't have to walk through that element when inside, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the first non-smoking hotels in Vegas! Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mustachman
Reviews.Content: This is one of Hilton's newest properties and it has one, two and three bedroom condos. Beautiful place and all non-smoking and no gambling there. Refreshing for Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A non-gamblers vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: mcbeth528
Reviews.Content: Great for a Hilton and hotel in general but for the traditional Vegas experience (ie casinos and shows). It is at the very north end of the strip, so about 1.5 miles from the Palazzo, 3 miles from Caesar's and Bellagio, 4 from NY NY and MGM Grand. When you have to basically cab it or take a bus everywhere when the traffic itself is as bad as Vegas' is, I can't recommend it! However, the hotel itself is very nice. I don't know what happened with J B's visit, but we had none of those same problems. Wi-fi worked great, no smoke smell (and we were in Tower 1), the pool was nice (though lacking in total sun which as a sun lover bummed me out), nice gym, friendly staff and helpful concierge. We had a studio which is plenty big for 2 people and includes a microwave and fridge. Overall I would recommend if your a Grand Vacations member since it's a great deal, but if you're just looking for a place to stay in Vegas, I would stay somewhere farther south on Vegas Blvd!

Reviews.Title: “good suite, excellent price but make sure you have your walking shoes”
Reviews.Author: nevermissabeat
Reviews.Content: A very good price for the suite at £60 per night, suite was very nicely done, large living area with sofa bed and then seperate king bedroom. Bathroom was clean and the kitchen was spotless. Nice to have so much space and is nice to have two seperate sleeping areas when stay with friends. The pol area was nice, though some work was going on when we visited so wasn't quite as nice as it might have been. The location is good, on the strip however it is quite a walk down to the main action (encore/venetian/mirage etc) and late at night it can be slightly unpleasant, the monorail at the sahara is good for long journeys down the strip but is a waste of time for shorter ones by the time you've made your way through the casinos out to the back where the monorail stations are. We liked not staying in a gaming property though and we overall would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Awesome and Enjoyable !!”
Reviews.Author: JeannaLuna
Reviews.Content: It was right on the strip everything and everywhere was just great and the Hotel Hospitality was the very great........in everything :) Will stay there again and no where esle :) Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Time Share”
Reviews.Author: dimar88
Reviews.Content: We have a time share with the Hilton and this is our "home club". Great rooms and a super staff. It's at the far end of the strip by Circus Circus & The Sahara and does not have a casino so it's very quiet and there isn't any traffic in and out of people not staying here. The pool area is really nice with a bar and gas grills if you want to do some grilling for supper or whatever. There is a mini-mart / deli in the lower level (kind of pricey, but handy when you need something (like a pizza after having too much of a giant margarita on Freemont St!!!) and there is also a nice convenience store about a 1/2 a block away or so for all your other needs. There is a parking garage on-site (free if you are an owner) and just a short walk across the street and then a block or so to The Sahara where you can catch the monorail system down to the strip so you don't have to drive and park elsewhere. We absolutely LOVE the Hilton time share system because of the flexibility of being able to convert points into Hilton Honors for use at hotels where there are none of the huge resorts. If anyone is thinking about investing in a time share PLEASE CALL US!!! We would be happy to answer any questions about our ownership and would be happy to make recommendations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property in a rotten location”
Reviews.Author: smitty195
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this review on my last night here, so I wanted to jot my thoughts down while they were still fresh in my mind. I am a regular traveler to Vegas (about once a month for the last 4 years), and I have stayed pretty much everywhere on the Strip. I came to this property because of a marketing phone call I received from Hilton HHonors (I'm an HHonors member). They initially offered me 2 nights in a studio for $199, but I told them that I know the Vegas rates very well and that is NOT a deal. Another person then got on the phone and said, "I see that you know the rates in Vegas very well. How about 3 nights for $99?". Ah, that's more like it. So if you ever receive a marketing call from these folks, accept it only if you are comfortable with what they are offering. By the way, I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen---score! This is a great hotel! I was pleasantly surprised, because I have driven by here many times and I always kinda thought "Eh...I'll never stay there". This is mainly because of the location. It is at the north end of the Strip across from the new "Fontainbleu" resort which is only 70% completed, but construction is frozen due to the economy. If you have a view in that direction, you're not looking at anything special. Actually, there really is no "view" here no matter what room or suite you get. If you look north, you see the Stratosphere and Sahara (blah and blah!) as well as a big dirt lot. On the south side is the Skyloft Condos which block your view of the Strip. To the west is Highway 15----so don't worry about where your room is located because the view is crappy no matter what. I would have given this hotel 5 stars, but the reason I withheld a star is because of the location. I don't mean to offend anyone when I say this, but the Circus Circus (next door), the Sahara (across the street), the Riviera (also across the street), and the Stratosphere (1 block away) draw a much, much, much different clientele than, say, Wynn, Venetian, Bellagio, etc. But there is good news in the future! When the economy picks up, Fontainbleu will get completed (and it looks like it will be beautiful once they finish it), MGM-Mirage owns the dirt lot on the north side and will be building something there, I'm pretty sure the Sahara won't be around much longer because they are really hurting (buffet is permanently closed and one entire hotel tower has been shut down). So in five years or so, I think this will be a really nice area. But for now, you have to take a taxi (or the Deuce Bus located directly out front) to get to a nicer part of the Strip. Housekeeping here does a beautiful job of keeping things clean and well-maintained. I'm very picky, and i can find NOTHING to complain about. The room is spotless, the kitchen is spotless, the bathroom/shower are spotless---very , very nice. For those who are coming here for the timeshare sales pitch, ugh.........Here are my observations from it. It does not take 2 hours as advertised---mine took 3 1/2 hours. Once you finally get down to the meat and potatoes of dealing in numbers, they throw an awful lot at you. Very hard to keep track of it. Hilton Timeshares does not sell "time" (like Marriott does)...instead, everything is based on "points". They will show you different options that you can buy, but here is an example that I was given today: Pay $39,500 today and that gets you 7,000 points for life. If you pay cash, they will thrown in 8,000 more points (one-time use, not for life). If you want to convert your points to Hilton HHonors (hotel) points, the ratio is 25 to 1 (1 timeshare point equals 25 HHonors points). An example of a one week Hawaiian vacation at the Hilton Waikola on the Big Island is about 6,000 points (in the timeshare condo---not the hotel). Hilton Grand Vacations has 49 properties, and the points are the same no matter where you go. You can also stay at RCI properties (the big book where you choose non HGV properties). Any time you book a condo at an HGV property, it will cost you $49 booking fee ($59 if you do it over the phone). To book an RCI property, it will cost you $179 to book your trip. These fees apply EVERY TIME you book---for life. You also have an annual homeowner's fee, which ranges from about $780 a year to $2,200 a year. This fee **will** go up over time---guaranteed---so keep that in mind. So no matter what plan you purchase, you will be stuck with a $49 or $179 fee, plus increasing annual dues. If you reject the offer to buy, they send in a 3rd salesman (yes, they make you visit with 3 people). The 3rd guy tries to sell you a 15 month plan where you can try it out to see if you like it. This plan costs $1,395 and gives you 5,000 points that you must use in 15 months. You can use the points only in Vegas, Orlando, or Hawaii (10 specific properties). If you do end up buying after 15 months, the $1,395 will be applied to the numbers you were shown at your sales pitch. I hope this makes sense...it's lots of numbers being thrown out there and that's the quick and dirty version of how it works. As others have noted, once you say "no", they are no longer friendly and will show you the door---without even shaking your hand. It's like, "Well screw you, get the heck out of here". They didn't say that, but I sure got that impression. Sales issues aside, I highly recommend this property. Everyone here is nice, the Marketplace is open until midnight, there's a CVS next door, and it's very family oriented. Feel free to email me with any questions. Oh, and here's a big bonus---you can stay here anytime you like without being an owner. Just go to Hilton's website and book a room!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: illini2k
Reviews.Content: I am not a member of their timeshare, however I stay at this hotel a few times a year when in LV. The hotel is quiet, very clean, the pools are nice with some privacy. The rooms are clean and they have DVD players/all cable channels. A great value for a family trip (game room, snack bar) or a couples get away (not smoky, easy walk to parking). You can walk to the hub of the strip (Wynn/Mirage) with the exception of mid day summer perhaps. The business center offers quiet work spaces and internet is easy. I travel for business 60+ days/year and this is my favorite spot.

Reviews.Title: “proud owner”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyecox
Reviews.Content: We have been Hilton owners in Las Vegas for over 10 years starting with the Flamingo property and moving the new one on the Strip. It is a very beautiful and comfortable property. Great pool. Yes, it is not right in the middle of all the action, but that can be a plus also. The bus stop is right there so you can get where you want cheaply or take a cab. We have always found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. It has been a feew years since we have been there as we have used our points to see other location but will be returning to Vegas soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing rooms - usual untruths in timeshare pitch”
Reviews.Author: TheFranci
Reviews.Content: We had always loved the art deco look of this Hilton so when we got a call telling us they would be giving us our money back after we arrived ($100 cash/card plus $50 in Hilton spending) we booked it. The $100 cash/card ended up being a $100 gift certificate for a future Hilton stay, so we did not get the money back. Check-in: The people at the desk were courteous and efficient and we were quickly on our way up to our room. Location: The Hilton is on the strip next to the Stratosphere. It is at the wrong end of the strip for convenient casino hopping so you will likely want to drive. The view: We had a room facing the strip, but there was almost nothing to see because the now-defunct building across the street and the other Hilton tower block most of the view. The view are not ugly, just don't expect to look out and see the neon streets lighting up. Next was the parking. The Hilton shares a parking structure about 50 yards from the hotel and charges guests to park there. It is not an overly long walk and since the weather is nice most of the time in Vegas it should not be too inconvenient. The studio rooms are ridiculously small. Motel 6 has more space and as many conveniences. However, the usual comfortable Hilton beds were great and the room was clean. We switched to a 1-bedroom and were much happier. Nice soaking tub and big shower, and the full kitchen setup. Definitely worth the upgrade from the studio room here. Finally, the sales pitch: We didn't buy the timeshare, but did go for the trial plan they had for a stay in Orlando, Vegas or Hawaii. The 7,000 point plan is a bit pricey at $1,600 but will allow you to stay for up to 23 to 32 days in a studio, 12 to 16 days in a 1 bedroom, or at least a week in a 2 bedroom suite. Since we were planning on spending about three weeks in Orlando, we thought we could put it to good use. The salesman made a big point that if we couldn't use it, we could get a refund on everything but the interest, citing the main reason being Hilton loses money on each one of these, but hopes we will buy after we experience the trip. As it turns out, it was a lie (I know, shocker, huh?). We decided to cancel the plan, but were told it would cost $500 to cancel it. When trying to book our rooms - the salesman recommended booking Hawaii (it does seem to be a really good value there) or Vegas for New Year's Eve, however since we have now been told we can book only nine months out, it seems unlikely that the busy times will be available. So just a word of caution for those of you visiting and experiencing "The Talk" as part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - No casino, isolated”
Reviews.Author: jlutzky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations for two nights in January. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The suite had plenty of room, including a full kitchen, and was more than enough space for the two of us. For a family of four, this would have been a nice option, since it included a sofa couch. The hotel has free wi-fi, which was a little spotty at time, running fine then suddenly stopping, but worked more than it didn't. The resort has some amenities (24 hour fitness center, lounge, and a small marketplace downstairs), however for Vegas it's somewhat lacking. Since it was a little chilly we didn't use the pool, however the hotel does have a nice pool area. There isn't a casino, plus there isn't any room service. The hotel is somewhat isolated, located on one end of the strip that is a little iffy. We knew this going in so we rented a car to get to the nicer area of the strip. If you're OK with this, this is an OK option, however unlike most of the hotels on the strip you can't stumble outside and go to the tables or multiple restaurants. We did this as a timeshare deal and took the tour. It lasted a little longer than we were told (2 1/2 hours versus 2 hours) however we didn't really feel pressured. We didn't end up buying one, however once we said no the presentation was over and no additional pressure was added. If you want to stay somewhere on the strip where you can get a break from the smoke and the casino's, this is a good option. If you want to be in the middle of the action on the strip, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager Adalberto Lugo not bothered to reply to complaint letter”
Reviews.Author: xyz35
Reviews.Content: During our 7 night stay in December 2009, we were moved from tower 1 to 2 due to faults resulting from poor maintenance before checking in and missing kitchen equipment and lot of noise coming from the nearby (like running water or fan noise from ac) for first 3 days, toilet flush faulty. We had received the standard welcome letter before the upcoming trip saying how the staff were all making preparations for our experience to be grand etc. This appears to be a bad joke as after having to call the housekeeping for over 6 times to rectify problems like faults and missing things, I decided to complain to the GM. As there were no writing blank pages or envelopes in the unit, I wrote the complain on the reverse of the confirmation copy of reservation that I had printed and taken with me. After that, the dishwasher powder/detergent door would not shut. So called houskeeping. The engineer came and said next day he would come to take the door of the dishwasher to fix the problem. As no one came next day, a reminder call had to be made and another engineer came and fix it, although he was surprised that the door did not need to be taken away for this ! The house keeping staff did apologise nearly every time and one of them confirmed that there is only random maintenance check of some units once a year, meaning they do not check things are working or not before someone checks in. Tower 2 had written instructions of how to work the TV and DVD player. But tower 1 did not have any written instructions and the remote control funtions were not user friendly for the BOSE system. The letter of complaint to the GM handed to the lady on the reception, never had any response from the GM or similar to see us, or ring us for the poor 3 days of wasted vacation. While the hosekeeping staff would respond once you call them, there is serious need for frequent maintenance routines for the units in the 2 towers. It is unfortunate that they fail to look after persons like us who have this resort as their so called ' home resort' and on this 7 nights stay, we were let down by Hilton. There were no writing paper or envelopes even after they were aware of this. The ancient CRT TVs means, Hilton has still a lot to catchup for technology and rather than just collect high maintenance fees,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful timeshare condo but beware of pushy sales!”
Reviews.Author: OregonKK
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the HGV on The Strip. As Hilton Honor members we stayed on a promotion, got the suite for a screamin' deal with our commitment to tour the property and listen to their presentation for selling the timeshare (our first and probably our last, more on that later). We stayed in the new Tower 2 @ mid tower. WHAT WE LIKED: * The one bedroom suite was beautiful with a full kitchen with dishes and cooking pans, coffee maker and all the other essential appliances and utensils which, we used to make our breakfast meals; no spices or cooking ingredient essentials though, you'll have to make a trip to the grocery store which is about 2 miles east on Sahara Ave; don't walk it's not worth it. * Our floor was completely non-smoking, although one evening we exited our room and it was clear that someone had been smoking in the hall or their room, it was terrible. * The grounds are pretty and it looks like they plan to expand the resort in the future. * The pool is small & nice; the outside temp was in the low 60's so several kids were having a good time in the water...which is kept at about 80 degrees. * The Deli is tasty and they have a Starbucks there too. They provide some grocery items to purchase but terribly spendy, just for convenience I guess. * The activity room was always active with kids at the pool table and the work out room equipment is excellent and open 24 hours a day. * Staff was friendly and helpful. WHAT WE DIDN'T LIKE: * No restaurant, but there is the deli and room service. * The view, boring, over looking an empty construction site, which will someday be a new wing of the resort. * Our free internet access did not work.but I didn't report it, either. * We were out most of our stay so the resort idea didn't work that great for us in LV. * We were too far away from the hub of the strip activity; the Stratosphere, Sahara and Circus Circus are the closest. * It took us a few trys to get the transportation thing worked out; double decker bus is 7.00 for as many rides within a 24 hour period but it is extremely slow, it stops at every bus stop. The monorail is a lot faster, it's 14.00 for 24 hours worth of rides but you have to walk through the Sahara to catch it, not a big deal if your feet aren't dead from walking to the grocery store. I'd recommend taxis if you have a specific destination and you don't want to walk in high heels. * It seemed as though HGV could benefit from providing a shuttle for guests to the two grocery stores east on Sahara Ave...but they do not provide one. Be prepared. * The timeshare presentation was terrible! They promised only 90 minutes at the most and we were there for 3 1/2 hours. Each time we tried to breakaway (as I was really hungry by 2:00pm) they brought in another sales person; very high pressure and the quality of the people making the sales presentations were not professional and very unorganized and disrepectful to our basic needs. Our "sales person" didn't know how to spell, he didn't know where several of their resort properties were located in the world and he was unaware of current events. As older patrons we respect the Hilton name and the quality of their properties and we choose specifically to patronize their properties, we know what we like and to pressure us to "sign today" or we won't get the deal is just cheesy. I have a different view now and I'm not sure I respect the Hilton image after what we went through. The sales manager was so unprofessional too! We asked a question and his response was "it's a no-brainer" what kind of guy says that to a potential client? Anyway, that was sour grapes for us. Good luck...You decide.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location, No Restaurants, No Casino”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hilton Grand Vacations Club as part of a timeshare presentation. The cost for 3 nights was great, about $170 or so if I recall correctly. Check-in was no problem and I was shown my room very quickly. The rooms themselves are a nice size and are attractively furnished. The location is not good at all, bounded by the unfinished Echelon project, Circus Circus, and Sahara. The pool is nice for a timeshare and there is a food shop on the lower level in case you want to eat in. My opinion was probably biased by a very high pressure sales presentation that I could have done without. In all, you can get a better location for the same money in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Nrs1234
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation Club at the Las Vegas Strip at 2650 Las Vegas Blvd. is absolutely breathtaking. I stayed for 4 nights and 5 days. The hotel is on the strip and is just a 10-15 minute car drive to the center of the strip, depending on traffic, of course. The hotel is walking distance to the Sahara, Riviera, Circus-Circus, and the Stratosphere hotels. I would not recommend walking to the heart of the strip from this hotel. It’s too far. The Deuce bus will take you up and down the strip unlimited times for $7 a day or simply having a rental car works well. The monorail can be picked up from across the street at the Sahara Hotel. The station is located to the back of the hotel through the casino. They are building a humongous hotel (Vdara Hotel and Spa) and a mall across the street but that may take a while to complete. A handy CVS is located right next door and a McDonalds, Subway, and Nathan’s Pizza are located at the Circus-Cirucs Hotel. Parking- the parking structure is a short trek to the back of the hotel but for $5 more ($13 a day) you can have valet parking and relax in the hotel lobby until your car arrives. Regular parking is $8 per day. Bathroom- from Kohler toilets and sinks to elegant Baltic green granite countertops to an all tile shower with plenty of room for 2. I stayed in Tower 2 the slightly newer tower than tower 1. I found out that the difference between the 2 towers is that tower 1 has a jetted tub in the bathroom while tower 2 has a soaker tub and no balconies. Kitchen- Very well designed with raised full outlay, cherry kitchen cabinets and the same rich, elegant light-colored Baltic green granite countertops. A full kitchen with a full size refrigerator, oven, microwave, washer/ dryer combo, dishwasher, coffee maker, blender, and toaster are standard. Again, there is a Kohler kitchen sink and all the appliances are made by Cuisinart. Room- I had a 1-bedroom suite that had a separate king-size bed, which connected to the bathroom via a sliding door. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room had a large TV, lounge chair, and a full size mirror attached to the back of the door. Living Room- comfortable sofa and lounge chair with a flat screen TV. The sofa doubles as a full size bed that is also very comfortable and not just for kids but adults too. Dining room- a beautiful glass table with 4 chairs. Desk- a laptop nook is also nice BUT the high speed internet that is suppose to be complimentary simply sucks. I never really got a strong connection and never could surf the internet. I even had them bring me an Ethernet cable that did nothing. The girl at the front desk told me they are working on adding more data ports but that she also agreed that the high-speed wireless internet is not great. There is a big 24-hour fitness gym with free weights, treadmill and an elliptical. There is also a 24-hour game room with a pool table, big screen TV, and table tennis. There is also a Starbucks coffee shop and a small convenience store all on the first floor

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: AnitaD4
Reviews.Content: Suites are all fitted with washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker, fridge/freezer and all other kitchen appliances. Separate bath from shower, 2 TVs and lounge area. No Casino here so a quiet haven to return to at the end of a hectic day on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DennisRN
Reviews.Content: We are owners of HGV and reside in California. (Worth mentioning, this is not a hotel or motel. It is a timeshare resort so don't expect room service and turn down service or the other amenities that the big hotels offer) Staff: Excellent! From driving up, to check in which was speedy, to concierge, maintenance, and housekeeping. All seemed to appreciate us staying there. The rooms are perfect. I was missing a remote for one of the TV's and they promptly brought another one up. There is a thermostat in each room. That's a huge plus. The kitchen's (both) were well stocked with all we needed and ready for us to cook in. Just like at home. Blender, full size coffee pot, refrigerator, dish washer and even a tea pot included. Okay, the bed's are too firm for my back, but still comfortable. Prices in the deli were not too high and some of the stuff was grocery store priced. Not too much of a mark up. Parking has a guard so I felt my SUV was secure. (My SUV had been broken into twice in Las Vegas! Once at The Rio and once at Venetian's parking lot.) Note: Suburban's are the #1 vehicle broken into in LV. That's what the police told me anyway. Oh yeah, after long walks on the strip, the over sized jacuzzi tub is a big plus! Shower had full body nozzle's as well. Very nice. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Quiet place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: concepts1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thursday - Sunday & thoroughly enjoyed it. We were in a one-bedroom suite. The place was immaculate! When we got in, the bell person turned on all the lights, the A/C & the fridge. He even checked our closets & sent maintenance to repair the closet door that was off track. The kitchen had everything - even a stacked washer & dryer. I like this place because there's no smoking in the lobby unlike the casinos that smelled like smoke the second you walk in! There's a pricey deli on the first floor but buying a whole medium pizza wasn't too bad (around $15-$17). This is a perfect place for families with young children, not so sure for the party crowd. All the action seems to take place on the South side of the strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Towers”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler
Reviews.Content: It's true--the rooms and hotel itself are great, what you would expect from a plush timeshare/hotel--free wi-fi, (expensive) deli, poolside restaurant, great fitness facility. They even allowed me to check-in early (10am.) However, the location truly is the main drawback.If you wish to go to Las Vegas and stay in the hotel all day and not gamble, shop, or do anything, this is your perfect hotel. You will need a car or enough cash to take taxis everywhere. Casinos that are nearby are old and sad, and quite a walk. The Fountainebleau across the street is a mere shell of a building/abandoned construction site--this is not a view you want, but the other views are of the parking garage and North Strip are not great either. I'm also not sure why they charge for parking while everyone else on the strip does not. During this 9-day trip, I ended up moving rooms 3 times (only once for a problem with the room, mostly to get a higher floor as you will hear noise from traffic/construction on lower floors). Tower two is the newer tower--rooms are the same (size, decor, amenities) except for the flat screen TVs. Also, people familiar with other HGVC Las Vegas properties should know that the overall size of the rooms are the smallest of all the Las Vegas HGVC properties and the studio rooms do not have a whirlpool. Lastly, during the entire stay, the second pool was out of commission.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location not so great”
Reviews.Author: Sweetflowers
Reviews.Content: This is the newest of the three HGVC resorts on the Las Vegas Strip. The rooms are great - the studio is similar to a standard Hilton hotel room, but it has a small kitchenette - fridge, microwave, coffee maker. The suites have a large living room and adequately stocked kitchen. The beds, linens, furnishings etc. are all great - No complaints. There is an overpriced deli onsite on the ground floor. There is also a CVS pharmacy next door that's open 24 hours which can be convenient. There is no casino and no smoking at this hotel - nice to come home to after spending time at smoky loud casinos/hotels. The only reason that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is the location - it's on the sad old end of the strip - the nearby casinos are Circus Circus, Riviera, Sahara,..........I only wish it was closer to the other end or center strip where there are some nice casinos and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beauiful, spacious clean room. Lots of amenities.”
Reviews.Author: dsakfong
Reviews.Content: We own at the HGVC Flamingo and used points to book this mid-week M-Th getaway. Owners get complimentary parking (garage level 4 and up), internet (LAN & wi-fi), and use of the fitness center. Fitness center - about 10 treadmills, step climber and a few ellipticals. Dumbbells up to 50 lbs and curl bars up to 90 lbs. Universal machine and sliding squat/press rack as well. All in all a nice center, not too crowded at 10 am. Location is only close to the Stratosphere & Sahara (& the big huge gift shop on Sahara & LV Blvd), but there is a monorail station at the Sahara. If you have a car, the location is not a big deal since the destination casinos are easily accessible via LV Blvd and using Sahara to I-15 is usually faster for strip hotels. Check in was smooth and the room was very spacious and well appointed. We had a 3-bedroom (2 br + the lockoff unit). The 3-br units are all on floors 36-39 (top floor). We were in Tower 2, the northeastern tower (more North-South view oriented), which had a nice view of the strip (saw PH Westgate, MGM, Mandalay Bay, and then west to the Rio & Palms), but the main part of the strip was blocked by the tower on the adjacent property to the south. We could see the north view from the elevator area windows and that looked very nice as well - not blocked by anything. Interior: Granite countertops throughout. Master bath in the 2 br had a very nice touch - the spa-shower where you not only had the regular shower head, but 3 additional nozzles at chest, abdomen, and thigh-level. Living area had a pull-out. We were able to fit 8 in this unit very comfortably. The 2 br unit kitchen had large appliances - microwave, stove/oven, refrigerator with icemaker & dishwasher. You can get groceries a couple miles away to the east or west at supermarkets, and there is a Whole Foods at the new Town Square mall south of the strip. Service - like other vacation ownership locations, less-than-weekly stays do not get maid service, though you can ask for more towels or sheets to change out yourself. You also take out your own trash, which is at the side opposite of the hallway from the elevators. Concerige was helpful with restaurant suggestions and was happy to try to help with tickets. We usually found that the Tix4Tonight booths had the best deals if you are flexibile. Pool was very nice but with the new adjacent skyscraper, you have to move around to chase the sun through the day. For us, it was VERY NICE not to have a casino on site (enough to go around on the strip), but the only place to eat on site (other than your room) is a small cafe / sandwich shop.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC's new resort in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DeborahH4
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that this HGVC resort had room service! Beautiful accommodations, most comfortable bed I've ever slept in outside of my home, helpful staff & a Starbucks on site :) It is a bit out of the way if you are wanting to spend time at Mandalay Bay, Mirage, etc... but cabs are plentiful. I would like to see a bigger & better staffed restaurant at the pool, the food was very good but the service was far too slow. The only other change we'd make is to put flat screen tv's in all rooms..don't make us choose between a Jacuzzi or a flat screen tv... most of us have both at home and expect them when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpenders
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay atht Hilton GVC. Great property with nice pool amenities. A bit far from the rest of the hotels on the strip but overall, a great hotel for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: x0me880x
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Las Vegas, but I was not there for what most are there for, I was there for a concert at The Pearl inside the Palms. I wanted to stay off the strip and wasnt up for a casino hotel. The Hilton Grand Vacations Club seemed to be a good deal. No casino, and the price was good. Not far from the airport, short distance to the venue, though I didnt realize there was going to be so much traffic. The lobby was beautiful, with a large grand staircase. I was greeted by a man who checked my name on a list, and got me ready for check in which was rather quick. I then proceeded up to my room. This was my first time staying at a Hilton, and didnt know what to expect, but honestly, I expected a bit more out of my room. I dont know how to describe it, but will share a few pictures I took. From first glance it seemed nice, but there where a few random things around the room I noticed through the night, the room seemed very warn. I was there for 2 nights, again, not for a typical trip to Vegas. My first night was spent in and relaxing, the second day I had to be to the venue early, so not much time was spent actually in the room. I did however get to enjoy the beautiful pool area and tan a bit the second day. I noticed that chairs fill fast, so if you want to get a spot at the pool, make sure to get there early in the morning. Make a note that this hotel does not offer any sort of room service, something I did not know ahead of time. I didnt adventure much around outside the property, but am pretty sure there are not many restaurants around the hotel. There is a shop of basic foods in the lobby area, and all the rooms have a kitchen with at least a fridge, sink, dishes, microwave, coffee maker, etc. Overall it wasnt a horrible experience, but if I where to be in Vegas again, I would not be staying here. All the staff I met was extremly nice, the pool area was beautiful, the free in room wifi is always awesome, and I loved that the room had a DVD player. Those however where pretty much the best parts. I was overcharged (ALOT) at check in (they just kept adding charges by the hundreds, and though it was resolved at checkout, it just added alot of stress), and I just expected my room to be a bit more nice, by what I had heard from Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Retreat”
Reviews.Author: TysParents
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for a timeshare demonstration. We went into it basically for a "free" anniversary place to go since funds are tight. After reading some of the reviews before we left, I was very scared although a friend of mine had just been to the new one in Orlando and loved it. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff couldn't be more attentive and helpful. We stayed in tower two in a one-room suite and it was large with a full kitchen/laundry, dining room, livingroom with flat-screen t.v. with Bose sound system, king-size bedroom with a two-person tub right next to it and another flat-screen t.v., and a large bathroom with granite/marble countertops. Although upon arrival, the maintenance guy was fixing the dishwasher, he left shortly after we arrived and apologized for not being done already. The bed was very comfortable and it was a treat to travel and have a bed as good as our own (we have a very expensive matress from Ethan Allen and high-end duvet, linens, etc.). I would agree with the reviews that it is at the undesirable end of the strip near all the older hotels (Circus Circus, Sahara, Riveria, etc.), but there is a new one that will be done soon across the street and it looks very high end. Hilton is building two new towers in the near future and there will be a huge new hotel/casino complex between this hotel and Circus Circus once the economy turns around. It was nice to know that not every "Joe Schmoe" off the strip can walk into the hotel and as one reviewer noted, they will/may check to see that you have a room key later into the night (which I did not mind at all). We didn't get to spend much time at the pool, but when we did, it was as big as other larger casinos I've stayed (Treasure Island, Rio, MGM, New York/New York). Prices for snack items/food were high inside the hotel, but there is a CVS next door (although their prices weren't much better). If I were to stay here again and if we stayed a week instead of 3 days/2 nights, I would go get some groceries and utilize the kitchen a little more (at least for breakfast and lunch)...although I don't think you should have to cook on vacation...especially in the land of buffets! Note: DO NOT got to the buffet at Sahara...I wouldn't feed my dog the stuff they had there and it smelled! Overall--the Hilton Grand Vacation Club is great for couples wanting to gamble a little (easy walk or bus/tram), get away from it all and get great airfare and great weather. For going to the timeshare demo, we received $50 to be used at the Hilton Convention Center just east of our hotel (easy walk...but not in high heels) and ate at T.J. Steakhouse. My husband's filet mignon was the best he ever ate.

Reviews.Title: “Good non-gaming hotel a top end of strip”
Reviews.Author: stressmastermk
Reviews.Content: First thing to bear in mind that this is a timeshare resort which means the rooms will come fully equipped for catering etc which in general , all things are provided . Being a non-gaming hotel it can be an oasis of calm to return to and general impressions are quite good ,in between the Riveria and Sahara area of the strip , its housed in two towers of about 25 levels each which i believe differ slightly but you enter via the main door and the atmosphere is rather low key with reception at the same level with a very handy mini-market , deli-counter where they make up rolls etc and fresh coffee which is open from 5am to 1am next day downstairs so if you don"t want o do it yourself , you can wander down here . There is an outdoor swimming pool , a tour desk, but thats it so because of its timeshare status , some people may find it limited . The rooms are a very good size with a fully eqipped kitchinette , fridge/freezer , washer & dryer , good size seating area with dining table & chairs , tv and of course , air-con . The bathroom has a shower , toilet and washbasin and the bedroom houses a spa-type bath along with plenty of storage space , in general eveything seemed to be of a good standard . You are not stuck for transport as there are plenty of taxis always to hand , a bus stop for the "deuce" service right outside and the Monorail at The Sahara is only a 5-8 minute walk away also there is a CVS pharmacy store next door - which sells more than just medicine -along with other shops just a few more moments away . Overall , not a bad stay the only main drawbacks being that i would find it hard to recommend if you have children and the locaton - there is a large amount of development going on around the area which is not eye pleasing also creating large areas of wasteland to walk past which also sadly seems to attract vagrants which can be annoying and the last thing - if Vegas is busy , it can take forever to get around. Apart from that , this hotel is not too bad at all if you like low-key activites just a shame its not a little closer to the action

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: leataylor
Reviews.Content: we booked vegas as a belated honeymoon. And we were not disappointed at all. The hilton is perfect. The room was just the right size, had a fridge, micro wave, big flat screen. It is at the south end of the strip and you will need to bus/taxi it to the large hotels. We got on the deuce bus $7 for 24hrs or $15 for 3 days. They are alittle irregular so be patient. We were glad we didnt go for a larger hotel for our first visit and would definately go back to vegas and the hilton grand vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Canyon...a must”
Reviews.Author: Lisa50Succasunna_N_J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club located north on the Strip. It was a pleasure staying there because the hotel did not have a casino therefore, It had a resort like environment , it was quiet and I felt safe there (non guest roaming the casino). The staff was very attentive and checking in/out was ideal. Since we only had a few days in Las Vegas, visiting the Grand Canyon was not a choice for us. Instead, we drove (35miles) out to the Red Rock Canyon. We arrived around 4pm and drove the 13 mile senic route. We were able to get out and take pictures at the many senic spots located on the 13 mile route. At the time that we were there, the sun was setting and the views of the Canyon were breath taking. There is no fee and you can take all the time you need to visit. One show that is also a 'must see' is KA. This is a Cirque Du Soleil show and is located at the MGM Grand Hotel. An unbelievable show. There are many things to do and see in Las Vegas but, if you have a 'Must see' list, you must add the Red Rock Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Resort needs a new Location, not close to the action at all.”
Reviews.Author: HGVClub_Owner
Reviews.Content: Well This resort is in need of some major help. I geuss to be fair I should point out the nice things. The rooms are nicely appointed and the kitchen was decently appointed and bathroom was quite large. I stayed in a 1 Bedroom Suite and found the TV and couch to be nice. I was in tower 1 which does not have flat screen tv's advertised but the regular old fashioned tube tv's. The room was actually quite small for a 1 bedroom suite. The kitchen was tiny and only one person could be in it and you could barely open the fridge and stand behind it without hitting the bar, and I am not that large having a 34 inch wasite. The room was ok with decor, but the dining table was stuck into the bar so it wasnt large enough to call a kitchen area and living area, they were right near each other. The other 2 properties rooms are larger, the Flamingo Club has the larger and nicer rooms. I would recomend that location. This hotel was not next to anything. If you love old school smoky casino's then the Riverea and Circus Circus are right next door. You have to walk to anything and construction around has halted. Seems interesting that 2 more twoers are planned and this resort is in an awful location. The convention center is a good walk as you have to take some detours with construction sites. I would not recomend staying here, if you can get a room somehwere else or trade into another location. The sad thing is I used Hilton Grand vacations owner bonus time and thought I would never stay here again, and I own in the club.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas countless times - always staying at the big resorts on The Strip, but often trying different properties for variety. When I heard about the Hilton Grand Vacations Club, I was intrigued, but not immediately excited, due to its location and iffy reviews on Trip Advisor. However, once I pulled up to the hotel, I knew right away that I was going to enjoy my time here. This hotel is not nearly as off-the-beaten path as some reviewers make it sound. It is located exactly between The Stratosphere and Circus Circus (not exactly the most desireable location, but it was perfectly fine). There is a 24 hour CVS located directly next door and hotels and casinos are within a couple minutes walking distance. I actually liked the location for a change as it is quieter and more relaxing than the hotels in the middle of everything. Another nice change of pace is the fact that this is a non-gaming property. Now, I am big gambler, but it was wonderful coming back to the hotel in the evenings after hours in the casinos, to a quiet, tranquil retreat. The staff was friendly and welcoming (especially the playful valet guys) and our room was immaculately maintained during the entire stay. Another huge plus here was our free in-room internet and 24-hour business center, which would be great for those in town on business. I have high standards, as I often stay in suites in 5-star hotels, and I could not find one fault with this property. It felt like home. After stays in some of Vegas' best resort hotels, this one has become one of my new favorites. I will definitely look into staying here next time. I enjoyed every minute and cannot recommend the Hilton Grand Vacations Club enough.

Reviews.Title: “Sun lovers beware”
Reviews.Author: robeth_8
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Great apartment, spacious & very clean. Pool area lovely & worthwhile watching sun lovers chase the sun in the morning. Two highrises - one a condo & the other an unfinished hotel block the sun in the morning. Transport to strip easy - deuce bus stops outside & monorail across the road in the Sahara. Plenty to see & do but don't miss Freemont Street. Can be very busy from Thursday through weekend. On site pool bar & restaurant great for lunching. On site marketplace great for basics, but slightly overpriced on some items.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet location, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dandeannap
Reviews.Content: This was my second year in a row staying at this resort. The first year I stayed in a studio, which was nice but not big enough for me, so I decided to stay in a 1 bedroom this time around. I have stayed in both tower 1 and 2. They are the same but tower 2 is newer. The room was nice and big enough for me. If you are traveling with a few kids the 1 bedroom might be a bit crapped for you. I am a smoker but I always go for the nonsmoking rooms. Even though this hotel is a smoking hotel they have the smoking floors far away from the nonsmoking floors so you will never smell it. They do allow the smokers to smoke outside. The hotel is very clean both the inside and the outside! You will see the cleaning ladies day and night keeping up the place. The deli market downstairs is a bit pricey for what they serve. The outside grill is comparable to any burger restaurant around there. The down fall is that it is only open until 8pm. The pool is great! I always found a place to sit and lay out. They have 2 pools next to each other. The only bad thing I have to say about this place is the location...I prefer the location because it is quiet and there is not a casino on the property. Others I have talked to did not like the location because they wanted all of the action that the strip provided. I did not mind walking to the Sahara to catch the monarail. ( The Sahara is across the street) Oh and they have CVS next door which came in handy. I will return next year , that is if my company still offers the conference in Vegas :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JenniferMK
Reviews.Content: Our large one bedroom suite in Tower One 25th floor was very quiet,clean, and comfortable, and had a really spacious kitchen and sitting room. Tasteful decor, older flat screen TVs, very nice pool area with private cabanas, shade, bar and not awash with look-at-me bimbos and himbos, thus a nice outdoor space for those of us who are not seeking a hot singles scene. The friendly, helpful staff added to the enjoyment of our four night stay, as did the great value price point, leaving us with more $$ for gambling and shows. The monorail can be caught across the road at the Sahara, but we drove everywhere and used valet parking, which was free in most places - other than the tip. I loved the location at the top of the strip - a little quieter. You don't step out the door and find Caesars or the Venetian, or Bellagio - those destinations are a couple of blocks down the strip - no big deal, but it's too hot to walk to them most days. The Hilton Grand Vacation is not an ultra-glamorous hotel, but its very nice and I really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere. In fact, I liked it better than most of the very high end places I usually stay at on Vegas visits.

Reviews.Title: “The HGVC on the Strip delivers once again!”
Reviews.Author: RoyWally
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 20-23, arriving very late Thursday night. I believe it was the late check-in that led to us being put in a 2-bedroom room in Tower 1 that was wheelchair-accessible. The main problem with this room setup, besides not having a washer/dryer setup, is that the second bathroom has no counters to set toiletries on! In addition to this, the shower was a "wheel-in" shower and allowed water to run across the bathroom floor, which is annoying at best and a slipping hazard at worst. I'm glad they have these accessible rooms for those that need them, but it was an inconvenience for us. Be aware that if you are placed in a room of this type, you might have to deal with some different stuff than you're used to. Besides this, the HGVC worked out great again! The resort was in good shape, well kept up and safe. Almost every employee we ran across was friendly, making eye contact and saying hello or asking if there was anything they could do for us. We were on the 27th floor of Tower 1, in room 12704. Everything was in decent shape in the room, and it all was nice and clean. We had housekeeping skip us the first day, and left them a couple dollars on the second day. I believe that this is money well spent for the person that is cleaning up after your mess! We weren't shorted any towels, shampoo, soap, etc and the dishes we had used were in the dishwasher, cleaned and ready for our additional use. Our room faced the pool area, the residential condo tower next door, the parking garage, and further out was the Circus Circus property. Looking beyond all that you could see the Trump tower and T.I. (even saw the "cannon blasts" and smoke from the battle out front). We didn't notice noise from outside or from other rooms, except the occasional door slamming. We'd definitely stay here again, and in fact will be returning in November! TIP: For those with a vehicle, there's a Trader Joe's grocery store just about 3 1/2 miles West on Sahara, then just North on Decatur (2101 S Decatur Blvd #25). Depending on traffic, it's a 5 - 10 minute drive. It's a great place to pick up groceries for you kitchen in the condo! We like to grab a few bottles of wine, some cheese and crackers and fruit to have on hand before going to dinner so we don't need to order any more than the entree! Trader Joe's has a nice eclectic mix of all the mentioned items, and at decent prices too!

Reviews.Title: “Location aside, a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa1974
Reviews.Content: My husband & I visit Las Vegas two to three times a year & have seen the good, the bad & the ugly. We enjoyed our stay at the HGVC on the LV Strip May 24-30. The location makes it suitable for visitors wanting to be on the scene, but not in the mix. We exchanged through RCI for a two-bedroom suite, which contained everything we want while on vacation: full kitchen, washer & dryer (stacked, not full size), flat-screen TVs in bedrooms & living room, & free (reliable!) wi-fi. Our first suite reeked of cigarette smoke. We gave it one night & requested a move to something that afforded a more pleasant breathing experience – the desk agent pleasantly made the transaction without question. Unfortunately I don’t remember which floor we nearly suffocated on (I think it was 20), but I do know it was below a smoking floor. So if you don’t want a smoky non-smoking room, just ask for a room on a floor neither above nor below the smoking floor. Unlike other reviewers, we did not encounter problems with uncomfortable beds, dirty toilets, noisy neighbors, construction issues or loud pool music. I will agree with the reviewer who mentioned the understaffed pool bar. However, a refreshing margarita under the hot desert sun is worth a 10-minute wait. I would suggest hitting the pool by 9 a.m. if you want a good spot. Pool restroom was clean, which was a huge plus for my cootiephobia. We took a cab to Albertson’s (2575 S. Maryland Parkway) to load the kitchen up for the week. Cab ride was $12 each way. For shorter stays, I suggest the little market in the hotel or the CVS a few blocks away. For a gambling fix, the Sahara is a 5-minute walk north. We enjoyed our stay at this property, but we probably would not stay there again because of the location. We go to Vegas to party, so being on the scene AND in the mix is key. We stayed at the HGVC at the Flamingo for a week in August 2008 & found it to be perfect – great Hilton standards & centrally located in the middle of the Strip (& an awesome pool scene!). If it weren’t for HGVC’s one-visit-per-four-years rule for RCI exchangers, we would’ve stayed there again instead of this property. Questions? Drop me an e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away until all surrounding construction is complete”
Reviews.Author: Xenawantsapony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were to stay here for a week in March 2009 through our timeshare. We thought the location on the strip would be convenient, but it was not. The building is surrounded mostly by construction and you are rather isolated. You can walk to the Stratosphere or to the Sahara Casinos. The hotel has no shuttle to the airport or anywhere. The room itself was quite nice. It had a full kitchen, a king size bed and a jacuzzi bathtub. However maid service was a little lacking and careless. We found all sorts of chip bags and chocolate bar wrappers on the sofa- not under the seat cushions but just behind the loose cushions. We seemed to always be shorted on shampoo or soap or towels and would have to wait hours and hours to get anything. Although the room looked nice and had all the amenities, the bed was a lower end bed (not the standard Hilton seems to use in most of it's hotels). The bed was not particularly comfortable and the bedding was something you would expect in a 2 star hotel. The view from the room was of construction-on all sides. When we booked at this hotel there was no mention through our timeshare or through the hotel that there was any on-going construction. Construction is carried on 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, unless the weather doesn't allow for it (high winds). The noise from the construction is enough to drive you to madness as you will spend your night and day listening to the beeping of trucks as they back up to load and unload materials, as well as the general banging that goes on during construction. We were first assigned to a room in Tower A (facing the strip and towards the newer part of the strip). We asked to have our room moved and were moved to a room in Tower B where we faced the Stratosphere and could look towards the mountains. Tower A faced the main part where the construction was happening. Tower B faced the storage area for the construction material and trucks. As we noticed the construction when we checked in and inquired about it, we were ensured that the noise did not bother the guests as they had had no complaints. They were wrong. When we requested to move rooms, the front desk was very accomodating and we were told we would be moved to another room that would not be bothered by the construction. They were wrong again. When we went to them a third time to discuss the issue, we were told that others (including a Hilton manager that was staying there for a meeting) had also complained. Eventually we were able to arrange a transfer to one of the other Hiltons, however by this time we had lost about 4 days of our week's vacation-time spent packing and unpacking as we moved from room to room and then from hotel to hotel. We had had no sleep and were stressed out from having to deal with the hotel as well as our timeshare company. We would recommend this hotel once all the construction surrounding it is complete. It is nice enough, though for the time being it is removed from most of the action on the strip. The pool areas is nice (though the pools were not heated so it was too cold to use them in March). There is a little deli and market in the basement where you can buy some basic grocerieds (reasonably priced, considering) or you can order sandwiches, salads, etc. However, a restaurant on or near the premises would be nice. There was also a games room that always seemed to be packed with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great once your inside”
Reviews.Author: Charli13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a weekend while attending an expo with our teenage daughter. I called the front desk at 3 to see if we could check in a little early and was told by a rather nasty woman that check in time was at 4 and I could check in then, she wouldn't even check to see if a room was ready - then she tried to convince me that I had reserved a studio instead of a suite. The man who helped us when we arrived was much nicer and even walked us to our room when we got turned around. The hotel is very nice - our room was mostly clean and very spacious. We got a one bedroom suite which was very well equipped. The room has a full kitchen, washer and dryer, and two tv's. Parking is a huge frustration - they will valet your car for you but since it was full of expensive equipement we didn't feel comfortable giving the keys to someone so we opted to self park. The parking lot is around the corner and halfway down the next block - it is cramped - poorly lit - and filthy! When you come out of the parking garage you have to walk in the alley to get back to the door of the hotel. The parking situation is enough to keep me from coming back alone. Also, try not to get a room on the first floor or anywhere near the pool unless you like to listen to blaring music coming from the pool area all day and half the night. Overall it isn't a bad place if you don't have to drive to it.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is amazing, very nice, new clean and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: michelleyum02
Reviews.Content: We came for our honeymoon, I was a little worried where we stayed because I wanted it to be perfect! And everything was great the people there were so nice, and the rooms were amazing. We stayed in tower 1 because tower 1 had jaccuzzi tubs, and tower 2 didn't have jaccuzzi they had soaker tubs. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - an oasis away from the madness (and excitement)”
Reviews.Author: lisajane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful apartments in the quieter northern part of the strip. Full amenities in the room made the stay comfortable and relaxing despite our "full on" and "party" trip. The area between here and Circus Circus needs landscaping and cleaning up but this isnt the Hiltons fault. It was comfortable to walk up to the stratosphere and down to the Fashion Show Mall but not much further because of the heat. The deuce and taxis took care of the travel and didnt cost much. We were a party of 5 and had no problems with sunbeds round the pool. The pool bar did good strong cocktails and were reasonably priced.
